Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mmscmichelle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel. The location is excellent for the main tourist areas in Barcelona. You can walk out at night and feel safe in this area and their are many bars and places to eat very close by. The roof top terrace was lovely and gave fanatastic views over the ciy. We enjoyed drinks in the hotel bar before and after our days and nights out. In the bar area they had crisps and nuts and cakes to help yourself to which was a nice touch. The rooms were lovely and very clean and we had a huge double bed. The breakfast area is lovely and there was lots of choice from bacon etc to cakes and biscuits. We would return here if we came back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel in old building, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Astridvandermeer
Reviews.Content: The location and the staff are the best part of this hotel, It's a restored hotel, comtemporary and that's my style. My husband and I had a late arrival and after a prompt check in, we went to our room and we were very disapointed that we had a very small (I guess single) room with a small double bed. No room to open our luggage, I had to put mine in in the bathroom (beautiful and spacious) under the sink. Happily, next day we got a bigger (21m2) room at the front of the hotel, with a little balcony. I really liked the staff, the breakfast and the location the hotel, close to Plaza de Catalunya and the metro, busses, El Corte Ingles etc. And the roof terrace is also a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: NISHA F
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were going to Barcelona for the first for 3 nights – I read the comments on here and decided to book the hotel – it was perfect! The room was immaculate and really stylish – we were on the 7th floor with a lovely balcony looking out onto the main road. Initially we were worried it’d be noisy but we were never once disturbed. The breakfast is extensive – and all the staff were always very polite and helpful. The location of the hotel was such a great surprise as it was again – perfect! Using the metro to travel round – there were stations dotted around everywhere – including steps away from the hotel. Being so close to the ramblers meant we were able to go for a late drink/meal and able to walk it back to the hotel – there were also ost of little cafes and places to get a coffee and a bite to eat. Would defiantly recommend this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: RodbarryBeechworth
Reviews.Content: Great hotel..stayed 5 nights. In a wonderful position to see everything in town and only a short walk from with the University or Catalonya square bus stops via the airport bus. Friendly helpful reception staff, comfy beds and a great breakfast. Sometimes we read people complaining about minor issues...get over it! Appreciate what the hotel does offer and realise for this price you can't do better...why pay a whole lot more when this hotel is perfect in so many ways!

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised by the price and quality”
Reviews.Author: MarianaPK
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff saved us from terrible hotel with Sallés Hotel Pere IV ****. Good things of H10 are: a) in the center of the city; b) friendly helpful staff; c) comfortable room; d) nice terrace with great view. We travel a lot and we can say for sure that this hotel is value for money. We were satisfied, with pleasure will stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL TICKED ALL THE BOXES!”
Reviews.Author: Gillian S
Reviews.Content: We are big fans of the H10 chain and this one did not let us down. We had never been to Barcelona before and not fully understanding the city layout for best loaction - but this was definitely it! The aerobus drops you at the Catalunya Plaza/mid way along La Rambla and is only 5 mins walk then to the hotel - perfect! On arrival we were given a glass of bubbly and a very welcoming smile. We upgraded to a Universitat room on a B&B only. 512 - very good sized room, spotless clean, with huge bed, bath robes/slippers, mini bar etc. It had a little balconey overlooking a very busy road but the french double glazed doors kept the noise out. The staff were always very helpful and friendly. Excellent choice at breakfast and is served from 08:00 to 10:30 - very civilised! And, if it does rain, the hotel has umberella's that you can use for 10euros fully refunable deposit. As for the city tours - a few words of advice. Its advisable to purchase the tour bus tickets from the hotel as they are slightly cheaper. If you, as we did, bought a one day bus pass and paid an additional fee for entry to the Camp Nou experience (Barcelona FC ground tour) ask the hotel to call them to check there are open for tours that day. We we got off the bus and got to the front of the queue, they told us that as there was a game the next day the Experience tour was closed. Upon returning to the hotel and told them what happened, they gave us a full refund for this part of the ticket, no questions asked. If you do add on extra tours to the bus ticket, ask the hotel to print of 2 copies of the pre paid vouchour, as you will need one to hand over the bus company and the other copy to hand over to the pre paid attraction you are going to visit. All in all 10 out of 10 and we can't wait to return to the city and would not dream of staying in any other hotel. Oh, by the way, the room terrace is only open from May to September.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: zen123102
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from a 4 night break at this hotel and overall we didn't rate it very highly at all! Found the staff at reception very unfriendly and not helpful in the least. No welcome drinks, room was grubby and the cooked breakfast lukewarm. Would not go back or recommend to family or friends. On the positive side the hotel is in an excellent position to get to see all the sights and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore the sights of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: julie t
Reviews.Content: we arrived 2nd April for a 3 night stay to be greeted with glass of bubbly.We were on the first floor (room 105) a twin room which was very spacious and had a surprise to find it has it's own little terrace with table and chairs.The room was spotless and beds very comfortable with beds changed everyday. We took the aerobus from airport to placa de catalunya (5.30 euros) The rooftop terrace has excellent views of the surrounding area and although the bar wasn't open when we were there we did take our own drink up there and chilled. we were B&B, there it a hugh choice of food available from continental to full english so fab value. The staff were friendly and helpful and willing to accomadate anything they can so don't be afraid to ask. It's worth getting a tour bus pass,we took 2 day option at 31 euros.You can get on and off at any attraction you wish to visit and buses are about every 10 minutes or less there are 3 bus routes blue red and green so you can plan what your want to visit. There is so much to see we plan on returning to see more of this amazing and beautiful city at a later date.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: vineyardhaven
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Barcelona and this hotel did not let us down. Great location to all the sights, not far from the waterfront, the metro around the corner, and also getting on and off the aerobus to and from the airport again just around the corner. The room itself was lovely and clean, nice large king bed and very modern. Up on the balcony you got great views across the city. The staff were most helpful and the breakfast was great. All in all I would stay here again and having 3days in Barcelona it was not enough so I suggest a week. Will be returning and will stay in this hotel for shizzle.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandra Y
Reviews.Content: central location of the hotel, two minutes walk from La Rambla, Catalunya Square (stop of BusTouristic) and undeground. access on foot for shopping and restaurants. rooms are small, but clean, bad sounisolation. Staff is friendly, but not all speak in English

Reviews.Title: “H10 Universitat, Barcelona - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Riggers7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in March. Very friendly welcome from the Reception staff on arrival which included a glass of lovely chilled sparkling wine. Rooms are a reasonable size the only downside for us was the toilet and shower cubicle in the room rather than a separate bathroom. Breakfast was plentiful and of good quality. The location of the hotel is excellent for getting to Placa de Catalunya [two minutes walk] where you can catch the tour buses to all areas of the city and also the Airport buses which run every 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “H10 Marina Hotel Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGP1022655
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Immaculately clean. Super breakfast and attentive and helpful staff. Great location just 2 blocks from Bogatell on Metro L4. Perhaps the area immediately surrounding the hotel could be described as a little 'seedy' but did not detract from a wonderful weekend. Comfy walking shoes definitely required. Barcelona Card also a must as public transport and discounts were very good - even on a Sunday. Sagrada Familia - well worth 17 euros per person but must have audio guide. Park Guell a great 'freebie' but a 25 minute 'hike' from the nearest tube. A lovely, lovely weekend and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Leole86
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th trip to barcelona. We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in Feb 2012 and we travelled as a group of young couples.. We booked the romantic package which included upgraded amenities (i think we had a bigger room as the other rooms looked quite small), breakfast, champagne and strawberries, welcome drink, snacks in the afternoon (which is just drinks and mini croissants) and late check out so all in all it was very good value for money, esp for a central hotel in Barcelona! The hotel was nice, nice design but the best feature was the location just a 2 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas. The only complaint we have is that the air conditioning in our room wasn't working properly and it was extremely hot!! It was like an oven! The breakfast was decent. Would we return to the hotel...maybe, maybe not. If for the location, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: tina b
Reviews.Content: just returned from barcelona , traveled with hubby and two daughters aged 16 and 20. hotel in excellent spot, right beside catalunya sq, rambles also very close to high end shops, gothic cathedral and casa batllo. Rooms were clean ok size, stayed in rooms on 8th floor, only downside the air con didn't work in our room so had to sleep with windows open but still not much traffic noise. Roof terrace was a huge bonus with great views, and no-one else seemed to use it. Was great to come back after sight seeing and chill with a bottle of cava(bought from supermarket). Like said previously try to keep off rambles for eat and drink as very expensive. Would recommend the hop on hop off barcelona city tour, around 24euro each for day which you can use two routes very good value. Also wouldn't pay for transfer from airport use the aerobus outside airport 5euro each which drops you off in catalunya sq and hotel is two minute walk. Theres a tourist information booth right where you get off bus and the point you in right direction.. Also on return to airport, we fly with easyjet and seems they have own terminal which is 2c which is down from main terminal. All had a wonderful time and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, very good!”
Reviews.Author: Klaus_J_S
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the very center of Barcelona, and this says a lot! It is only one building, so the space available is restricted, which means there are "big" rooms and smaller ones, so try to get a "big" one when making your reservatoin. Otherwise: decent breakfast, nice view from the terrase, excellent location (bus to the exhibtion grounds right in front of the hotel!), clean and very freindly and competent saff. Definitely would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichelleK_10
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. It is close to where the airport buses stop (Placa Catalunya) and very central for all other sights. The hotel is very modern, we had a warm and friendly welcome from the reception staff and got a glass of bubbly wine on our arrival. The room was modern, massive queen size bed and plenty of room for our things. We were at the front of the hotel - 412 so we could hear the traffic - which to be honest didn't bother us, it didn't stop us sleeping after a days sightseeing and as the hotel is so central I don't see how you can then complain about the noise!! Breakfast was one of the best buffets I have ever had, it is all the usual - fruit, bread, meat,cheeses, pastries, hotfood but the quality was exceptional. I couldn't fault it. All in all it's a hotel I would recommend to anyone. We managed to walk to most of the sights - La Pedrera and Sagrada Familia are all within easy walking distances. We did walk to Park Guell but it was all uphill and I don't think we would have walked if we had known how far it was! So I would recommend getting the tourist bus up there which we did get to the Football ground.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryCar0le
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of January after visiting family in England and before returning to Canada. Hotel was better than expected. Staff very helpful and friendly. Went to breakfast late every day but staff still got us coffee and let us eat without rushing us out of the restaurant. There are two computers with a printer available for guest use... nice touch. Room was very clean and modern. Will definately return to this hotel and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MikaPasilasta
Reviews.Content: Like many others have said, the location is almost perfect. Rambla, the Gothic quarters, metro, the harbor - everything within walking distance. Excellent airport shuttle bus (leaves every 5 minutes) is 2 minutes away. Our room was on the 8th floor, facing to the backyard. Very quiet, expect when it comes to noises from other rooms, you could hear their phones ringing but i did not hear talking, partying etc. Cleaning was good, minibar selection and prices ok, Shower good, water temperature was changing sometimes, though. Room was big enough for us, there were 2 of us, i don't think you could fit kids in there. The young staff was polite and helpful. Gave good tips about bars, transportation, etc. Their English is ok. Breakfast maybe 8/10. Nice cheeses, good selection of soft drinks and tasty coffee. We were there on Christmas -11, we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you get a deal!!”
Reviews.Author: Freyr F
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal @ EUR 70 per night (including free breakfast) in January 2012. On a deal like that this place is awesome for all kinds of travellers - solo, couples, family etc. Staff are friendly and helpful. Free printouts at the public printer for guests :). Always useful to print those boarding passes after checking in online. Rooms were spacious enough, clean, well equipped (surprisingly well actually with toiletries and the like), good minibar (reasonable prices for minibar standards), free wi-fi or cable internet, the breakfast buffet was good and I loved the sausages, chocolate cake and custard. Fabulous location: 5 mins. on foot to Placa Catalunya, Ramblas, Placa Universidad etc. Bus stops right outside the hotel. 30 mins on foot to the beach though. It's got some cool add-on's: terrace bar (21) and coffee bar. Neat little place!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: M_BR1986
Reviews.Content: We chose the smallest room, good enaugh for a weekend but book a bigger one if you are staying longer. The rooms are well decorated and the bed is extremely comfotable. Excellent location, right in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BeeBeeLongBeach
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here. A little expensive but well worth it I thought. Geat location just off Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas and El Corte Englese department store. I chose this hotel for the rooftop bar and enjoyed a glass of sangria every night before going out to dinner. We had live entertainment our last night here. Breakfast was very good. Would go back in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joCole809
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, clean and modern. Walking distance to shopping and all tranportation.

Reviews.Title: “Paying only for Location - US$215/night”
Reviews.Author: CrstnBeach
Reviews.Content: We paid about US$215/night, stayed for four nights over New Years. The location is perfect, but that's the only positive. We are a married couple, late twenties. When we got to our room (front bldg of third floor), we found two single beds, not even pushed together. We complained and were told someone would absolutely combine the beds that night. We returned to the room after midnight, still two single beds. Then the street noise was abysmal, kept us up all night. We asked to switch rooms in the morning - got a third floor interior room. Others have also commented on significant subway shaking/noise, which we didn't notice in the front room but did feel in the interior room. Our bathroom ceiling leaked on our second night, and while they did eventually fix it that day, the workmen's boots left marks that housekeeping did not clean. Agree with others that the noise from other travellers (many young Europeans in town for NYE) was really bad. We heard the 6:30 alarm clock from room next door and had to bang on their door to wake them up to turn it off after 10 minutes. You can hear neighbor's toilet flush, etc. Just no sound barriers at all. Our fridge wasn't plugged in (no outlet nearby) and we asked for ice & ice bucket but it never arrived. I read that someone else was able to borrow a kettle, but there was no info in the room that this would have been an option when we wanted coffee. The wireless internet did not work, but the free printing downstairs was a plus. I wouldn't stay here again - friends had a much better experience at Hotel Jazz down the street. Same location, same price, but better quality. This might be fine for groups of backpacker mentality travelers, but I had higher expectations given the >$200/night price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Room, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: matakan
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to Barcelona for romantic getaway at last february. The hotel is located at Catalunya Square. We rented a car. And the hotel provide a membership card for the underground parking facility at Catalunya Square(100m away from hotel) for 20€/night. It wasnt easy for us to park every time. I m not recomending rent a car at Barcelona. Hotel room was standart and clean. Breakfast was normal and tasty. I think, i have paid a good value for good location and normal room. If you dont expecting somethin luxry, the hotel is a good opportunity for you. By walking to the Catalunya Square you can take sightseeing busses, visit rambalas street, 15min walking you can visit dali museum. If you wanna watch flamengo show, i recommend dont purchase with dinner!! bcs it will be a big mistake and you ll loose money.

Reviews.Title: “BARCELONA CENTER POINT”
Reviews.Author: OMIDREZA
Reviews.Content: Great location.just 1 minute to catolonia squre which is center of every thing in Barcelona(Shopping,Resturant,City tour,...). You can take a barcelona city tour bus from catolonia squre and enjoy all attractions in the city. only 2 minutes to metro station. just 1 minutes to bicycle station which yo can visit the city with this about the hotel: Very clean, kind staff and great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good raport quality/price/location”
Reviews.Author: tzumpy_oana
Reviews.Content: Great location between Universitat and Catalunya Metro stations. Opposite the hotel is a shopping street Pelai. Very close is Corte Ingles in Catalunya square from where you can go on Rambla or Paseo de Gracia Streets. Free wireless in all hotel and 2 computers and a printer at the reception. Daily cleaning. Employees are very kind. A very beautiful opened terrace on the 9th floor - top of the Hotel. Breakfast is rich and is served from 7:30 to 10:30 every day.

Reviews.Title: “Tight, but just right for the night”
Reviews.Author: dbalc
Reviews.Content: Rooms (and elevator) a tight fit, but very clean and functional. Super location 3 minutes from Placa Catalunya on Las Ramblas. View from rooftop bar is excellent. Romance Package has nice continental breakfast in your room and bottle of cava in the evening w/ chocolate strawberries. Location is the key; It is a short walk to many attractions and tapas bars and pubs abound within a couple blocks. Friendly and helpful English speaking front desk.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind sleeping in a shoe box...”
Reviews.Author: wesz
Reviews.Content: The Pros: 1. Very friendly and helpful young staff 2. Very clean rooms, cleaned every day, all amenities are provided, outstanding cleaning staff 3. Free WIFI, although not always available, but when yes, then it's fast. Also available in the rooms. 4. Very central location 5. I booked a special price, on a 6 nights stay, it was around 90EUR/night, no breakfast. The Cons: 1. The size of the single rooms is ridiculous. Like a shoe box 2. The doors have zero noise reduction capability, if someone speaks outside it's like he was in the room with you. 3. The metro shakes the entire building and it could be felt even on the 8th floor. Conclusion, this hotel is not worth of a 4 star hotel,but would be a great 3 star. The breakfast is priced ridiculously, 17 EUR, for below 10EUR, you can have a great breakfast anywhere within 100 meters around the hotel. Unless you get a grat price, avoid this hotel, on full price it's not worth.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: FSP827
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! Stayed at this hotel from 11/17 to 11/20 - don't have one complaint. From the moment we booked (via phone, triple room wasn't available online for some reason) to the moment we walked out we had nothing but top notch service from the staff. They were friendly, professional and accomodating. I accidentally blew out a fuse attempting to blow-dry my hair (didn't know I needed a converter - whoops!) and the service guys who came up were kind enough to fix the fusebox and loan us a converter for the rest of our stay. Score! The room was clean and comfortable - triple room had a double bed and a pull out in the living room area. The room also had a nice balcony with a great view of the city. In addition, there was a nice rooftop terrace with amazing views and comfy chairs - perfect place to have a pre-outing drink or just hang after a long day of sightseeing. The room included breakfast which was phenomenal, it was served in a large and comfortable dining area and offered a wide variety of items ranging from tasty local food (tortilla Espanola, cantimpalo chorizos, fried eggs) to croissants, nutella, fresh fruit, etc. The location was perfect for our needs - 2 blocks away from Las Ramblas and within walking distance of tons of shops, restaurants, and our Hop On Hop Off bus stop. Also, being 3 young girls traveling alone we felt very safe in the area as well as in the hotel, which was important to us. I have nothing but good things to say about this place. If I ever return to Barcelona I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: suhelen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for a short break and if you are only wanting to spend a minimum of time in your room. Very small( although those on the front of the hotel looked bigger) not keen on the bathroom idea Just frosted glass doors separating you from the rest of the bedroom which means not a lot of privacy in such a small room ! But it was very clean and modern the breakfast good and the staff pleasant and helpful when needed. Bar did shut early though ! The location is ideal though, just a couple of minutes walk to Catalunya square where you can catch the open top buses or on to La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, good location, disinterested staff!”
Reviews.Author: kd592
Reviews.Content: First impressions? Very good. This hotel is in a great location and is well appointed. Sadly no one is availalbe to sell bottles of wine after 11.00pm to residents (you can go around the corner there you will find a bar .....); no one is interested if the aircon in your room is functioning or not; we reported this everyday and were told that a) the technician is not here; yes it has been repaired(no still not working!) (if you are allocated room 402 just see if they have repaired it yet .... )No one asks at check in if you want to order a kettle and tea/coffee for the room. To quote another resident never have I paid so much for so little service!

Reviews.Title: “Small roomes”
Reviews.Author: Zvi R
Reviews.Content: The location is grate near the Ramla near the metro near Catalunya The staff are helpful and they answer every question The breakfast is good But the roomes are very small - The closet so tiny that we can not unload our clothes from the suitcase. those roomes are good just to sleap. If you travel all day and just need to take a shower and sleep it nis O.K They promise free internet but the internet is not working all the day - They have a lot of problem with they

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chinaphoto
Reviews.Content: We do a lot of city breaks and what we look for is location, location, location. This one was perfect, the aerobus drops you off a few minutes walk from the hotel on Placa de Catalunya. The metro and bus stops are also nearby, as are plenty of restaurants, and even a nice Irish bar within MSD (maximum staggering distance). Of the hotel itself, we had a corner room on the 6th floor which was reasonably big for a European city hotel, staff were very friendly, and breakfasts good with a very wide choice from cereals to sausage and egg, traditional continental b/fast, cakes and fruit. You can feel the metro trains as others have said but we only felt them in the restaurant and bar on the lower floors. Great shower once it warms up, but make sure you put a small towel on the floor other side of the door to stop the water spreading the the toilet floor.

Reviews.Title: “Bustling location but noisy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_from_IS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and enjoyed the hotels location which was great - walkable to almost everything. Staff were friendly and helpful and all guests were treated to glasses of cava upon arrival. Rooms were stylish and clean but the walls were dreadfully thin and despite being on a higher floor we could feel the rumbles from the trains. So noise was a big issue in addition to the fact that the beds were hard as a rock. The stone floor would have been more comfortable. Bathroom is a part of your room (not my favorite trend these days) but was modern, bright and elegant. Free wifi throughout the hotel and connectivity was excellent. Breakfast was included in our rate and was excellent. Fantastic selection of local specialties and those that cater to an international crowd. And given that cruise ship people are the main customer at this hotel, I can understand why familiar breakfast items are important. Overall, I'd stay here again if you were looking for location but only if its a good value. A poor nights sleep has its price.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for all, great location”
Reviews.Author: basil24
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 staying here for 2 nights.We had 2 fab rooms with great views and 1 poor room, dimly lit, no view to talk about. Location smack where you need it to be, short walk to metro, bus tours and resaurants. Hotal very clean, service good but would not recommend the resaurant food,not on parr with surrounding restaurants. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: HollyHavok
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in spring 2010. Aerobús from airport drops you off just around the corner. Hotel a couple blocks from central train station. Starbucks also nearby. We stopped there every morning for a coffee. Short walk to Las Ramblas and shopping. Main square also around the corner. Only issue with room was the shower. It leaked under the glass door every time we took a shower. Flaw in the design of the bathroom. Rooms were small for Europe but not bad. More of a standard 3 star hotel. Staff was friendly. We speak Spanish, but even when we didn't, it was fine. Great Italian restaurant a couple doors down. Don't go to dinner before 9 PM. They will know you're a tourist. We went at 930 one night and the restaurant didn't get busy til after 10.

Reviews.Title: “Good peaceful stay”
Reviews.Author: bluenose1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and enjoyed the hotels facilities and peace. Although the walls are a bit thin and you can hear others, we were out most of the day and this never stopped our enjoyment. Rooms are very nice. Free Internet useage in the reception was useful. Their restaurant was better than some in the city so we ate there twice, not dissapointed. There is an Irish bar across the street which is great after a long day exploring that great city .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family, clean, efficient service.”
Reviews.Author: macblades
Reviews.Content: We have two kids under 10 and booked interconnecting rooms, which were a fine size. Rooms were very clean, with fresh towels daily. Room service meal we had was better quality and value for money than the street cafes on Las Ramblas. Really enjoyed our stay, and would come back. Only one very minor gripe, you could occcasionally here the lift mechanism which made the wall vibrate now and again. You cannot feel the metro as one reviewer noted, I suspect he was mistaking the lift noises for the metro. Hotel very handy for the aerobus and metro, which are really good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: dwrb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early September and picked this hotel because of previous great experience with the H10 chain. We arrived very late at night due to a delayed flight and the check in was not the greatest but this is more to do with the late time we arrived. As we went into the room, it was very hot and the ice for the cava in the room had completely melted and the strawberries as part of the room rate were inedible. Called reception to tell them the air conditioning was not working and they came up to try to get it working. They could not so said they could ether put us in the smallest room or provide us with a fan. We opted for the fan. At this point we were a little bit disappointed with the room but it did not spoil the stay too much. The buffet breakfast was excellent and the staff in the breakfast room were friendly and helpful. Great selection of freshly cooked food available. The hotel's location is perfect. Close to everything and lots to see and explore and overall an excellent stay. The roof top terrace bar offers an excellent place to relax and take in the fantastic view from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Central loction, great for a city break”
Reviews.Author: DaffyBrightonUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location about a 3 minute walk from Las Ramblas and the Gothic area in central Barcelona. It is a perfect place to stay for a short city break in Barcelona. There is a fantastic bar on the roof of the hotel that has great views over Barcelona which opens at 6pm but on our visit they open it early when we requested. The breakfast provided by the hotel was really nice and the downstairs breakfast room was much nicer than many I have used before. The rooms are nice and not to small. We had room on the front which is on busy main road, but to be honest was not that loud. Our friend had a room that looked out on to a central court yard that was not nice, but for the amount of time you spend in the room really didn't matter. The biggest plus points of this hotel are is amazing central location (also great for the Metro) and the fantastic roof top bar. Would use it agian.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoEUR767
Reviews.Content: Stay here, Stay here! This hotel was awesome from start to finish. I wasn't quite sure what to expect being the rates was less than $100 a night during high season, however this was perfect. I actually used my Delta Skymiles to book this hotel and it was only 9,500 miles per night...great deal! The staff at the desk was super friendly and offered me breakfast and a place to store my bags being we arrived at 8am and the room wasn't quite ready. She then called housekeeping and ensured my room was on the priority list to be cleaned soon, can you say above and beyond. Once I got to my room I was very pleasantly surprised how nice, modern, spacious, and clean this room was and all for a great price. The bed was super comfortable and the internet in the hotel worked great and was free. I had a nice balcony that over looked the streets of the Plaza Catalunya area. The location was awesome and I walked to everything including the bus tours that pick up at Plaza Catalunya. I had friends staying a short distance away on Las Ramblas and was paying triple the amount I was and they were very impressed with my hotel room. I often recommend this hotel to my American friends traveling to Barcelona and I would absolutely do the same for you. TIP: Frequent flyer miles can be used for more than just booking flights. You can use them for hotels and rental cars. I prefer not to use my miles for flights because you don't accrue more miles on an awards ticket. Try buying your flight and using miles to pay for your hotel and/or rental car your next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding roof terrace and super location”
Reviews.Author: Andy N
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights while attending a conference in the city. The hotel was modern, clean and well appointed, with helpful and knowledgeable staff. The roof terrace is clearly the highlight of this hotel and was an excellent spot to relax with a San Miguel! Will definately recommend this hotel to friends and use again on any future trips to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ManiNij
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent 3 nights at this hotel. Being first timers in Barcelona, the hotel and location were perfect. We were 100 yards away from the central square where you could easily jump on one of the tourist buses, and the same distance to the top of the Rambla's. The hotel was clean and nicely decorated. breakfast was light and simple. We even had a complementary drink at the roof top bar one evening which was really pleasant. All in all, would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for eveything on the door step but just far enough from the hussel and bussel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, one of the best hotels I have even been in!”
Reviews.Author: Caspartje
Reviews.Content: This is simply a top hotel, large room and bathroom, very friendly staff, welcome drink, free WiFi, excellent room service (and food) and very good breakfast. Location very close to Plaça de Catalunya, which is also the location of the inexpensive but fast airport shuttle bus. Would definitely go back here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marduk23
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. 2mins away from las ramblas. Very clean, modern and spacious. Huge bed with big flat screen tv. A/C excellent. Large bathroom with all necessary stuff from a sewing kit to hair caps (for women) :) really enjoyed my stay and was very disappointed to leave! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy069
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and myself stayed here 3 nights in the last week of July. Although the rooms are not huge, they were certainly adequate. There was the usual H10 hotel buffet breakfast which is so good. There is a lovely roof top terrace that has a bar after 6pm. The location is five minutes walk from the Place de Catalunya which has the tourist buses and airport buses. The metro is also right here and so easy to use. The top of the Ramblas is also right here. The location of this hotel could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: h0nestyfirst
Reviews.Content: If youre looking for a hotel with THE location - this is your hotel. Its a 5 minutes walk from La Rambla, and the airport bus goes just outside the hotel. Taxis everywhere. We paid about 30 euros extra and booked a romantic suite, and it sure was worth it. You get a late check out, breakfast at bed (very good breakfast), cava, strawberries with chocolate etc. The front desk was great, and they also had free Wi-Fi. (we also stayed at a 5 star hotel during this trip which didnt have wi-fi, a shame!) The romantic deal also includes a bigger room with a terrace. One of the only negative things I have to mention: The walls are extremely thin. We had to hush on our "neighbours" who sat outside on their terrace at 2 o´clock at night having a "jolly good time". You will hear every single word if someone stands outside your door. The metro line is also situated directly under the hotel, so this may also wake you up at night. Even though this may disturb you, I strongly recommend this hotel. The location is everything, and the rooms are comfortable and clean. Pay a little extra for a romantic suite is my tip!

Reviews.Title: “Knowing and asking helps”
Reviews.Author: Christy012
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 5th and July 18th before and after a cruise. The first room was very small and we could barely get our two big suitcases and two carry ons in the room and shut the door. The bed was pretty hard. When we stayed after the cruise we had a room with a king sized bed and we had a ton of space. So, you need to ask for the options as it isn't as clear as in America. The front desk people were very helpful. We got a great referral to a non-tourist place about two blocks away for tapas and drinks--Ciudad Condal. It saved a lot of time wandering around looking. The Ramblas is something to look at and then get on the city tour and leave behind. The hotel sells a city tour kit for 2 Euro savings and then you walk the 2 blocks and pay 19 Euro to the bus people. It is worth it as you see a lot for the money in 2 hrs and you can get off and on all day over three routes. The breakfast in the hotel is not what Americans expect for a buffet for 12 Euro. It was varied but no bacon, omelettes, pancakes, or donuts. The terrace is worth a visit day or night. Great view. The location is very good. We were very tired and were able to nap during the day and sleep all night without noise issues. The bathrooms were great. After the ship and looking for public restrooms in other European ports it was refreshing. The hotel was very good about storing luggage before checkin and the room being ready and after checkout before we could get on the ship. Taxi from the airport was 26 Euro. Taxi to the port was 19 Euro. Oddly, taxi from the port back was less and taxi to the airport was higher. the hotel called taxis for us and they were there in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Central location!”
Reviews.Author: AussieSophia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything! Round the corner you have the famous Gaudi buildings, other corner is La Rambla. 1 block from Plaza Catalunya, near all the bus stops and metro. Great spanish brand and up market brand shops around the corner! Room and facilities all modern, new and clean. Wifi was fast and free. Reception staff extremely helpful. Would definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Torrz
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel it was small, but very clean and styish and amazing for the value. Great location just up from the main street La Rumbla. Cool roof top to chill out and great views. Great range of breakfast! would return if coming back to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mollyUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and lovely hotel. The rooms were spotless and breakfast very good. The only down side was the size of the room. Bit disappointing although we didn't spend much time in it as plenty to do. Rooftop terrace lovely

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff is illogical and unreasonable...never again.”
Reviews.Author: davidchic
Reviews.Content: I reserved a double room for me, my wife, and 2 kids (age 5 and 2). "Double" is the largest room they have. When I checked in, the hotel manager told me that only 2 people can stay in the room. He wanted me to book another double room at the rack rate of 190 euros. Despite the fact that I was there with my family for my ten year anniversary, his solution was that we should stay in separate rooms. We argued for about 15 minutes and we "negotiated" a deal where I paid for 1 night (we were there for 2 nights) for an extra room (but I can't stay in it so he can still rent it out if someone shows up). The whole ordeal costs me 190 euros and a lot of frustration. It seems like all they want to do is take as much money from you as possible........NOT THE RIGHT WAY TO TREAT YOUR CUSTOMER.....NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Just Excellent”
Reviews.Author: riros
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is fully renovated, and the rooms are modern and spacious with a great bathroom. It's centrally located, within a short walk to Placa Catalunya and La Ramblas. The service was brilliant, the breakfast was unforgettable and plenty. Our 4 day stay in that hotel turned our visit to Barcelona into an unforgettable experience. This was definitely the BEST value for money hotel stay we've ever experienced. The people running this hotel are simply fantastic and are leaders in the hospitality industry. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelNorfolk
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this Hotel and after reading reviews was unsure how the Hotel would be. I went with a friend and we found the Reception Staff very friendly and helpful. Other members of Staff were as helpful but spoken less English. We did get the drink of Cava which was excellent. Our Room was 602 and faced the Street but as my friend has asked for a view I expected this. However I did sleep and enjoyed using the balcony especially the night Barcelona won the league!! The Hotel is close to many bus stops and we used the buses rather than the Metro. Our Room had all the necessary toiletries it did have the glass door to the bathroom, my friend and I overcame any embarrasement. Should be easier for people who are together, married etc, Breakfast was superb a wonderful selection of everything you could wish for, hot, cold , pastries, cereals, cheeses fruit etc., Staff at breakfast were very good too, we tried to say Good Morning etc., in Catalonia and they loved it. Do not go to La Tagitelle if you cook yourself as the meal was rubbish, we only had a pasta dish and the contents, salmon seafood were missing! Divini was ok the rissoto excellent but cold. Good service there. Best meal at the Hotel, great presentation etc., Was 23Euros. We loved the Magic Fountain and the Cala Balio house. Magic Fountain free. We travelled to Monserrat by FCG and Cable Car 16.55Euros excellent. Very helpful ticket Staff to purchase ticket from machine. Aeroporto bus fare was 5.30 each way. Not what it is on some web sites. 10 trip travel tickets great for the day if you are doing lots of journeys buy inside the metro from ticket machine. We went to the Spanish Village and the Flamenco Show there and enjoyed it. Would recommend just tapas and drink. Bus up there and back so easy to do. Saw the 730pm show.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: jaydee2003
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time staying at this hotel and once again superb. arrived to be told we would be in a junior suite. plenty of space in the room. bottle ofcava and choc covered strawberries in the room on arrival. staff very friendly and location was superb. i will be back, hopefully soon

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rip off prices and staff who are willing, but unable to help with difficulties”
Reviews.Author: susi2shoes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just off Catalunya Square in the middle of Barcelona. It is very convenient for Rambla and all the city tour buses. We were assured that secure parking was available and on arrival we were told it was free. We booked two double rooms for two nights for me and my husband and two friends from America. We have been to Barcelona a number of times, love the city and wanted to show our friends round. Initially we had tried to get into the H10 Marina, which we had stayed in before, was reasonably priced and very enjoyable. This was full and so we naturally sought a hotel in the same chain. We were quoted €180 for Thursday night and €520 for Saturday night - a total of €700. For our American friends this was $1000 for a mediocre hotel. We reluctantly accepted this. The rooms are quite small - not big enough to accommodate cruise ship baggage easily. The walls are paper thin - I could hear snoring from one side and coughing from the other. When we came to collect our car from the car park we were charged €89.90, because the card provided by the hotel did not work. We complained to the staff, but after 40 minutes were informed there was nothing they could do because the car park would not reimburse them.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: 63michelle
Reviews.Content: Went for my Birthday only for two days the Hotel was brilliant very friendly great location. Went on the bus tour great way to get round. Will definitely be going back again and staying at the H10 Unievesitat Hotel. Thanks for a great time. MICHELLE.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona stay”
Reviews.Author: Belgy11 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is in the centre, very easy for the Aerobus from and to the airport, as well as for the hop and off buses. If you have a room at the front the traffic is quite noisy. If you are at the first up to 3rd floor, you feel the metro going under the hotel, higher up you don't feel it that much. If you are really unlucky and you receive a small room as a double, (very small, not even space enough to put the suitcase on the floor) just ask for another room, and if there are rooms available you will get one.

Reviews.Title: “Go to another Hotel if you can”
Reviews.Author: aida_b1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the evening and the receptionist was friendly, BUT he told us, that the Hotel has a technical problem and due to this we have to go to another hotel. We might come back on the next day, but he also said: I cant say, when you can check in. (We have booked this hotel 3 months ago). So we changed the hotel, the taxi was coming taking us to a hotel in no-where. Out of downtown without restaurants around etc. We asked in this hotel the Receptionist why we have had to change the hotel, he told us, that HOTEL UNIVERSITAT H10 was fully booked. Actually, they were lying to us (due to technical Problems you cant check in tonight). So we came back at the next day, and he offered us free breakfast. The Breakfast was also awful. If we had to pay for it, we have had to pay 12 EURO per Person. you can also go and have very good breakfast next to the hotel in a Café. Nobody excused this mistake and our stay became really bad, because we wanted to stay only 4 days. 1,5 day was lost. For such a big city, is that too much. We wouldnt book anymore in Hotel Universitat H10.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AnneRowneyGreen
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location: 5 minutes' walk from Placa Catalunya where La Rambla starts. I travelled with my teenage daughter and we did lots of exploring from the hotel. The reception we got was friendly and welcoming, but did not go as far as offering us a glass of cava, as other guests reported. The room was the smallest I have ever stayed in. It had a double bed which was not ideal. I had requested a twin bedded room but when I queried this at reception, I was told that it would cost 30 euros extra per night. We coped with the double. Perhaps it was the particular deal I had booked through lastminute.com, but beware if you go through a similar agent. That apart, the hotel was immaculately clean, the bathroom was great (probably bigger than the room actually) and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was extensive, but also expensive at 12 euros per person unless you've got a very large appetite. All in all, I wouldn't pay for this hotel unless I was on some kind of deal. The room I got was definitely not 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: WelshTraveller10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the H10 Universitat Hotel. We had a great time in Barcelona thanks to this lovely hotel right in the middle of the city centre. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. PLUS POINTS: Helpful staff Great Location (5 minute walk from Placa de Catalunya and associated metro stops) Lovely buffet breakfast Nice room with balcony Roof terrace with superb views of the city Nice bar and reasonably priced Spotlessley Clean Free glass of Cava on arrival and a treat in your room to welcome you - nice touch NEGATIVE: Traffic on main street quite noisy which means you have to keep the windows closed at night with AC on. A problem is you dont like sleeping with AC on all night. Some rooms are very small TOP TIPS: pay a little extra for a deluxe double which gives you a large room at the front of the building with a balcony Sign up as a friend of the Hotel on their facebook page and you get a free cocktail voucher to use in the bar

Reviews.Title: “If you miss this you miss out!!”
Reviews.Author: kateknowsu
Reviews.Content: I have NO complains. The hotel staff were amazing. We arrived on Saturday morning and were greeted by a lovely receptionist who gavr us a glass of champange on arrival. As i requested a room that overlooked the road for view they said it was no problem and put us on the 7th floor. The terrace was amazing and as i joined the facebook group we both recieved a free cocktail. In the evening as we were getting ready in our beautiful room someone bought us up chocolate cake, slippers and water. Both my sister and I just couldnt believe our luck throughout the trip. We had the most amazing time and mostly down the the excellent hotel. Very central and overall a luxury hotel! Thanks again all.... Katie and Alex xxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel with great roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Jenfro
Reviews.Content: Booked one of the smallest rooms for my 2 days businesstrip and was delighted with my room. Small of course, but very functional and clean. Great breakfastbuffe with a good selection of fruit, bread and other things, which gave me a good start in the moorning. Really helpful and nice hotelstaff. Nearby communications if you are going to other parts of Barcelona. Don´t miss the roof terrace with nice view over Barcelona all the way down to the Mediterranean.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms. Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CanalcruiserDerby
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms here are quite small the hotel is perfectly located. The hotel is very clean with excellent bathrooms and a good buffet breakfast. The staff are all very helpful and the welcome glass of sparkling wine is a nice touch.If you going to take the city bus tour buy your ticket from the hotel reception its cheaper and there is a stop nearby. Excellent hotel which I recommend when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: vicky_vd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a perfect in the center of Barcelona! The staff is great and friendly. They to everything they can for you. Rooms are very clean and spacious enough. Breakfast has everything you need and even a bit more! We had a diner in the restaurant of the hotel and enjoyed it very much. I would highly recomened this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wettim
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise city break for my husband for our wedding anniversary, and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is just around the corner from the main square where you'll find taxi's, the Metro, the airport buses and the city tour buses. The square is also at the top of the Rambla, which is the main tourist street that stretches all the way down to the marina. All the hotel staff spoke English and were very helpful with tips on where to eat and drink, and places to visit. Our room was on the 8th floor and the back of the hotel, so no view. It was also quite small, but had a flatscreen TV, safe in the small wardrobe and a great bathroom/wet room, with all the usual free shampoo, shower gel, toothbrush, etc. There's a bar near reception, where we collected our free glass of Cava, and another bar on the roof of the hotel with comfy sofas and great views over the city rooftops. The hotel also has a restuarant in the basement. We didn't have dinner there, but we had one breakfast, which was disappointing at 10 euro's, so the day after, we ate at a cafe a few doors down the road which was great at just over 8 euro's. We were only in Barcelona for a long weekend, so to see as much as we could, we took the open-top city tour bus on a 2 day ticket (cheaper booked through the hotel). The tour is highly recommended. You are given a map, a book of money off vouchers for shops, restuarants, museum's, and a host of other attractions, and earphones to plug in to the seat in front with a running commentary as the bus glides past all the sporting and cultural sites. You can get on and off at various locations along the way, as may times as you like. We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel which cost 30 euro's and about 15/20mins. To get back to the airport, we took the airport bus...which cost 5 euro's and about 30mins...brilliant! All-in-all, a great location, in great area. Brill weekend.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: POLINA2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on August 2010. The location was great, breakfast was excellent!!!, the hotel was clean. But the biggest problem was the size of the room. We had 2 luggages and if we wanted to take something out, we had to put them on the bed because there was not enough space in the room for us and the luggages together. It was the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. When we checked-out we mentioned that to the reception, and they told us if we had mentioned it before they would have change the room to a bigger one. TAKE THAT AS ADVICE. Except of that we had no other problem. The personell was very friendly even though their english was poor. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, staff are so friendly”
Reviews.Author: farrels9
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful time at this hotel. there was 3 young irish couples (20-30), Barcelona is amazing but the staff also contributed to our holiday. Went to great lenghts to help us out with everything we needed and always with a smile! the roof top terrace is gorgeous! didnt eat any of the food there ( but stay away from the buffet down the road)! the hotel is central to everything you dont have to walk far for anything.only down fall was the beds were a bit on the hard side but when you have a few gargles on you it didnt bother us! definitely go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “We have a winner!”
Reviews.Author: misssyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently with my husband on our European trip and absolutely loved it! Below are my comments: LOCATION: The hotel is PERFECTLY located, close to everything convenient to a traveler. We caught the shuttle bus straight from the airport to Plaza de Catalunya and walked about 2 minutes to the hotel. From this same spot, we walked across to ‘Las Ramblas’, Casa Batlo, Casa Mila (La Padrera), and also caught the ‘Turistic’ sightseeing bus. HOTEL: The hotel had a nice vibrant feel to it. The top terrace is very impressive and has a fabulous view of Barcelona city. You can spend your evenings cooling off sipping a cocktail and enjoying the view. ROOMS: We booked the ‘Romantic Bed and Breakfast’ package and were thrilled with what we received! It included breakfast (we had the option of having it either in bed or in the breakfast room), chocolate dipped strawberries (YUM), cava, robes, slippers, a magazine and a lovely welcome note! The room itself was beautifully appointed with a fresh red and white colour scheme. The room was spotlessly clean and spacious with the mod cons that you would expect. (eg. Flat screen TV, A/C, safe, hairdryer etc.) The bathroom was quite modern and very clean. We had no problems with the design of the bathroom even with the glass screens. STAFF: We found staff extremely helpful! Overall, we LOVED H10 Universtat and would stay here again on our next trip to Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great value. Lovely room”
Reviews.Author: gliblighting
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the romantic break. We were welcomed with a glass of cava on arrival and the deal included a bottle of cava sent to our room with chocolate dipped strawberries and also included a late check-out of 2.00pm the following day. the room was clean and well furbished. We had a balcony view, which was noisy when the doors were openned, but was very quiet once the doors were closed. We were on the 5th floor which was great, although I probably would not to have wanted to be on a lower floor as there would have been too much connection with the street. The breakfast offered a huge variety and i believe had something to satisfy all tastes. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay on my next trip to Barcelona, huge variety

Reviews.Title: “It's like sleeping in small Ikea showroom”
Reviews.Author: mwynn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of town, just off Plaza Catalunya conveniently close to the shopping areas and several metro stops. My room, which was very clean, appeared recently updated and looked something like a sharply designed Ikea showroom. It was quiet, but very small as was the twin bed, whereas the bathroom was oversized in comparison. Also, heed the warnings about the pickpockets. While in the Gothic District, a guy grabbed my hand as if to greet me, and then tried to reach into my pocket for my wallet with his other hand. Fortunately, he didn't get anything, except for my fist waving in front of his face.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.. Beware pickpockets in Barcelona :(”
Reviews.Author: Gardners96
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel.. its fantastic! Rooms very modern, light and airy, we had a room on 5th floor overlooking the street.. perfect!.. Breakfast is also fantastic.. loads of it and huge variety. Christian and the rest of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is ideally located just 4 mins (if that) walk to Las Ramblas. Went to restaurant Divine just a few metres away.. lovely ambience and food. I had booked this trip as xmas pressie for my husband and had booked tickets for the Barcelona match on our first nite. Unfortunately on the way to the match my husband had his pocket picked and tickets and cash stolen. This must have happened on the tube and he wasn't aware until we got to the stadium. So please please be careful.. It must have happened on the metro. .it was very packed and he was the last on and the back of his coat caught in between the tube doors.. three guys pulled/pushed etc to get it out while he kept say no its fine wait till next station.... it ruined what should have been a lovely weekend. When we reported it to the police they said someone else had also reported they had had tickets/cash stolen too. Other than that I would definitely recommend the hotel and Barcelona. Maybe we will get to back and enjoy it more one day.:(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traceybee
Reviews.Content: I've have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. The trip was with my 70 year old mother. The service we recieved from the moment we arrived until the minute we left was excellent. The staff at this hotel were great. We were offered a welcome drink when we arrived, a ilttle later a member of staff came to our room with 2 delicious cakes which were a welcome gift. The hotel is in a great location, just minutes from the Rambla. Breakfast was excellent, good choice of food and great coffee. The room was a little small, but with the whole of Barcelona to explore how much time do you spend in the room anyway? its was also spotlessly clean and comfortable. I would happily stay at this hotel again, and if this is anything to go by will seek out H10 hotels to stay in on my next holiday.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING TIME”
Reviews.Author: 3d3mon3
Reviews.Content: Great HOTEL..AMAZING STAFF....THE breakfast was nice and the location was perfect..CLOSE TO EVERYTHING...I WOULD DEFINITELY COME BACK to this hotel, thank you for making my first trip to Barcelona an Unforgettable ONE!, I CANNOT WAIT TO REPEAT! HOLA FROM NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Thief in our room”
Reviews.Author: Jansbu
Reviews.Content: Was in Barcelona in connection with a 60th birthday with a group of about 12 persons. Was suprised by a thief early one morning. A man was standig just inside our door and managed to steele my mobile telephone. I do not know how he managed to get into our room but I guess this could happen to anyone. I think he may have come thru the window ( the window was open because the air condition did not work ). The big shock came when the staff at the hotel would not believe what I told them. First I was asked by the person at the reception desk to talk to the Hotel Manager. She came the next day !? In between I was asked to go to the police. The police was nice and wrote a three page report. The Hotel Manager told me she covered all floors with cameras and she told us that she could not find anything there. The problem - in my view - was that she gave me an impression that we told her stories and that this never had happened. She did not take this serius in my view. By the way - I have never slept in a smaller room for two people ! To be just I must underline that most of the staff in the restaurant, bar and roomservice was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: NorthernNez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between Christmas and New Year for 3 Nights. I booked this as a romantic treat for my Girlfriend's 30th Birthday and also to propose whilst we were out there. The Staff from start to finish were excellent, we had a "Romantic" package and with a bottle of Cava and chocolate dipped strawberries upon arrival and breakfast in bed. The Cava arrived 20 minutes after we arrived, which was perfect timing, giving you chance to get yourself sat down and relaxed after travelling. The breakfast was very good witha great selection, and was served till 10.30 which is ideal if you fancy a lie in. The hotel was very clean and the maid came and tidied the room at a sociable time and left a bottle of water with a welcome note on the first day. The room we had didnt have a great view but its a city centre hotel, bang in the middle of Barcelona, its to be expected surely? the room itself was of a perfectly acceptable size with a large shower. On the negative side the bed was very hard, i like a firm matress but found it to be a little too hard, and wasnt complimented by having silly trendy pillows, one square and one narrow and the width of half the bed, 3 nights on those pillows was the most i would have accepted and would have asked reception to change them if i was staying longer/ had remembered on my way out. The hotel location is exactly where i wanted, 2 minutes from Placa Catalunya/ La Rambla and the excellent Metro system, couldnt be better in my opinion. Overall i would highly recommend this hotel for its excellent location, staff and breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Booked here? Good news & bad news...........”
Reviews.Author: Narrabeam
Reviews.Content: Hard to begin to review this hotel. So many really good points, but also many bad. Start with the negatives: The room was tiny, bareley room to get into bed. The bed was hard. There was no view from the window. The bathroom sits behind a glass wall. How could you enjoy a drink from the mini bar? You would either have to sit on the bed or the toilet !! No tea & coffee in room-but I guess there is nowhere to put it. After 5 hours walking the city, I wanted to return to the room for a rest, but by 3pm the maid still had not been. Now the good points. The hotel, is spotlessly clean. All the staff are very good, friendly & helpful. The rooftop bar is nice & has a good view. The restaurant serves really good evening meals for a very reasonable price.. Welcome glass of Cava on arrival. Free internet. The hotel is minutes from the Metro & The Ramblas / Catalunya. Hard to say it is a four star hotel, but certainly a highly rated three star. The staff & the restaurant could not be better, however, the prime purpose of a hotel is the room & the bed & in my case, these fell short.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, outstanding food”
Reviews.Author: oga25
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Barcelona for friend's wedding and decided to book this hotel as it was in the most central area of Barcelona and also because it offered half board, so we did not have to worry about searching for a good restaurant or even booking dinners at other places. Few days before the arrival I wrote to the hotel staff requesting specifically the room overlooking the street. From my understanding the "double gourmet" room should have been a larger room anyway, because I red the description on the hotel website. I also indicated that we might arrive 1 hour prior to the check in time, because our flight from Toronto was cheduled to arrive at 11:40 am. The hotel responded and told me that they took the note of my request and that they were lookign forward aving us as their guests. Since our baggage was delayed we arrived at the hotel around the check-in time anyway. The lady at the front desk told us that we would be given a temporary room for one night as there was a large group occupying all other bigger rooms. She promissed that the next day they would give us the room we requested. I already did not like this "suggestion", but we decided to go upstairs and check the room. This is when we realised that we were given a single room with one double bed, that was even too small for one people, not to mention how it looked like with two adults and 4 suitcases. We could barely move around and in order to open the door we had to put one of the bags on the bad. Everything was so crammed and dark. After a quick shower and strech we went downstairs and demanded a larger room, an actual double room and all of a sudden we were told that a large room would be available at 6 pm. After a long walke at "La Rambla" we returned to the hotel and as promissed our room was ready. It was on the first floor, overlooking the street and it had two separate twin beds. The room was not as large iether, but at least we could move around and hang our clothes. There wasn't much wardrobe space for two people, but we managed it somehow. The rooms are definitely a very low point of this hotel. If you are booking a double basic room be sure that this is an acutal single room and two people cannot fit there. Make sure you request a streetview room as these are the largest rooms. Beside the room issue, we did not have any other objections. The food was amazing. The breakfast items were all fresh and there was a variety to choose from. The dinner was also outstanding and portions were very big. All the premises were extremely clean. The location was great. It ws only 2 minutes walk from La Rambla and about 25 minutes walk from Sagrada Familia or Port Vell. Cabs are very cheap in Barcelona and it is easy to move around. One thing you have to watch out in Barcelona is street pocketers. They will lure you pretending that they are police or army officers and demand to see your documents and money. Do not ever comply with their requests. The real police will never ask you for such items or if they you look suspicious you will be taken to the police station and not interrogated and searched on the streets. Keep your valuables in the hotel safety box and don't carry too much cash with you. You will not need your passport anywhere other than the airport or hotel check-in. Your driver's license, no matter from what country you are coming from, it a valid proof of ID in case you might need one. Credit cards are accepted everywhere in Barcelona and the thiefs will rarely steal them from you, they are after cash or other items that they could easily turn into cash such as cameras, cell phones, i-pods, jewellery etc. Enjoy your stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hard beds”
Reviews.Author: Cavalier_Spaniels
Reviews.Content: The location was terrific - a short walk on a well lit street to the Place de Catluya square where the tourist buses leave from and La Rablas. Staff very helpful and breakfeast good. Free internet though I had trouble with the connection in our room. The one drawback-- the beds are extremely firm -- you could be sleeping on boards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: Silverstar68
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an enjoyable 4 night stay at the H10 Universitat. After reading the reviews here we requested a room on the upper floors facing the street and got exactly what we asked for. The room was spacious with all amenities. We were on the 6th floor and even with the double glazing you can still hear some traffic noise and the rumble of the metro train however that did not bother us much and would imagine is to be expected from a city centre hotel. Might be different if you are a very light sleeper. The breakfast was great lots of choice buffet style eat as much as you want and the overall service from all staff members was just great especially the front desk / reception. The hotel is also very well located just a couple of minutes from Pl Catalunya and Pl Universitat metro stations and the tourist bus. We took the Aerobus from the airport to Pl Universitat and then walked it to the hotel from there. Overall a great hotel in a fantastic location and very good value for money. Oh almost forgot the wifi worked fine in the room but not so good in the hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, well located, excellent breakfast and with a very courteous and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MAGNEFORCE
Reviews.Content: Very nice experience at this hotel and above title says it all.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful city break!”
Reviews.Author: Kipling32
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the H10 Universitat Hotel, very conveniently located within 5 mins walk to La Ramblas and Placa Catalunya, including sight seeing tour stops and shuttle to and from airport. Clean, modern hotel, very friendly and helpful staff and all worked well as one big team. We were given champagne on arrival plus a welcome cocktail at the bar for another evening. Reception staff always acknowledged us and were very helpful with information regarding Restaurants, sigh seeing tours and arranging tiockets to see Barcelona play at the stadium. The room was clean comfortable and had air con, everything we needed although there was no coffee and tea in the room which perhaps for a 4* hotel there should have been! Breakfasts were excellent with efficient and friendly staff and great variety of foods. The upstairs terraced bar was very nice and offered great views of the city. I would like to thank all staff including the Bookings Manager who emailed me with directions to the hotel and informed me how best to get there. A very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: alondr
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel good location - 5 minutes from plaza catalunia and airport bus - also near the stations for the sight seening bus. hotel is mainly bussiness hotel nice modern lobby - free internet in the lobby. Very nice room - deck floor and all modern and nice. got it in a bargin price through the hotel web site. nice restaurants and shops near by(including fc barcelona officall store 200 meters away) las ramblas also 5 minutes highly reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixtom
Reviews.Content: I don;t want to be too harsh about this place as the location was awesome, the staff were great and the rooftop bar and free drinks were a great touch but I have on or two complaints. For a hotel to advertise that they have free wifi and for it then to now work at all in either the rooms or the lobby is a pretty poor show. Had I been staying in the place for business I would have been mightily annoyed - as it was my girlfriend complained and was told that it was because too many people were on the wifi at the same time. That being said, we stayed for 4 night and tried at different times through the stay and got nothing! Second complaint is that the hotel is obvioulsy built above the Metro line and it felt as if our room was suffering from mini-earthquakes every 5/10 minutes but I assume the further up the hotel you stay then the less you are affected. All in all, OK but at the price you pay maybe worth looking at other 4 star options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gjfriend
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just off the Paza Catalunya. Las Ramblas is a few blocks from the door. Very close to the Metro. The staff is young, friendly and they want to be helpful. Our air conditioning (in two rooms) was adequate, but barely. Rooms were tiny, but bathrooms were large and roomy. The rooms were clean and well maintained. We didn't have a balcony. I liked having a safe in the room. Free WiFi was barely usable, but there are two good computers in the lobby for guest use, and they were usually available. The buffet breakfast was good. My only complaint is that we were on an upper floor, which is usually quieter. One night they had a private loud party in the rooftop lounge and we could hear it. I do recommend this hotel. It caters to adults. If you are a Facebook fan, they will give you a coupon for a free drink when you arrive. Their Facebook page is a good introduction to the hotel. I will stay here again when I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but get an exterior room if you can”
Reviews.Author: trainsifpossible
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit, and the positive impression I had on the first was confirmed - with a significant caveat. The hotel is, as before, sleek, quiet, efficient and clean, and very well located. This time, though, I made it my business to ask for an exterior room on arrival; to their credit, the hotel found me one the next day (of a five-day stay) - and the difference between the small and rather claustrophobic inner rooms and the larger exterior ones is very marked. So if you can, try for a room at the front. The hotel is narrow and deep, though, and you might not be lucky.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a perfect location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: andbain
Reviews.Content: After travelling it was really good to arrive and be met by some smiles and good service. Checkin was quick and we were offered a welcome drink! Our room was small but was exactly what we wanted as a base. The bathroom was lovely .. a wetroom with a massive shower! It was kept clean and the room was always a welcome place after walking Barcelona! It was perfect to have as a base as it was close to everything but not right on top of the toursit area. We chose to be 5 mins away! The roof top bar was such a find from the welcome Cava to the beers we drank at then end of each day. The breakfast could not have been better. I dont know anyone who could not eat themselves full on that range of food! This is a great place and I cant wait to return thanks

Reviews.Title: “If the rooms would be larger...”
Reviews.Author: paolo_celani
Reviews.Content: ... it is very difficult for 2 people to live 3 days into 9 square meters..... if you don't believe please booking rooms 703 and 704....

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, really friendly staff loved it : )”
Reviews.Author: madbetty
Reviews.Content: Its really handy location the bus from the airport stops at Universitat metro stop which is only a few mins walk from hotel. Its only a few mins walk from Las Ramblas which is handy as there are loads of restaurants around there. We chose the double basic room it was smaller than a standard room but we were happy with it .It suited us as we really only spent the night in the room and during the day we were busy site seeing. We liked the frosted glass of the bathroom door. We arrived early at the hotel because we had a morning flight, check in isn't until 2 but the hotel let us use the luggage room and told us we could come back around half one to check in. Also we got complimentary drinks on check in. If you become a fan of the hotel on facebook before you arrive you also get a free cocktail voucher to use in the bar and we also got 2 small chocolate brownies delieved to our room. so yummy : ) through out our stay the staff were really nice and helpful. Breckfast was really delicious there was a nice choice of buffet. your bound to find something you like. The ai con was so handy it was so hot when were there it was so nice to come back to a nice cool room and it was so quite you could leave it on all night without it bothering you. And the free wifi was a bonus. all in all great stay and would definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Not a Fan”
Reviews.Author: dicelees
Reviews.Content: This is far from my favourite hotel, and really has no hope of ever even making it into the top ten. My biggest complaints are with the rooms. I don't know if this applies to every room in the hotel, but the frosted glass bathroom doors that don't full close: a nightmare for me. This is stylistic decorating that I could live without. Furthermore I found the bed to be so hard and stiff that I might as well have been sleeping on the floor. I barely slept at all, so thankfully we only stayed for one night. The service was friendly enough, and the location was, admittedly, very ideal. I would never stay here again, but I think, if possible, another hotel in the same area would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lullabell75
Reviews.Content: Having just got back from staying here, I have to say that this hotel is really good. We stayed in a room at the back of the hotel on the forth floor (407). The air con in the room is silent, which is a bonus, the bed was massive and really comfy.
