The rooms have a safe located within the wardrobe where you can store your passports etc. The shower and toilet are located behind a frosted glass screen with the sink on the other side of the frosted glass - a bit odd but strangely enough it works! The room is spacious and sports a 32inch TV. As part of our room package we had strawberries dipped chocolate and a bottle of cava, which was brought up to our room about 20mins after we checked in. When we came back later that night, we found an almond cake with a strawberry on top for each of us. If you become a friend on H10 Universitat page on Facebook you also get a free drink each (Wine/Champagne/Beer) on the Terrace, which has amazing scenary! You can also request on this page to have either a 'smoking' or 'non-smoking' room which they are more than happy to provide you with! If you have access to Facebook check out the comments there as these are extremely positive and the staff respond regularly to comments! Our first morning we had a contential breakfast in the room, which was very nice with a nice selection of toast, cold meats, cheese, pastries, fruit and tea (could have had coffee if we wanted). The second and third morning we had breakfast downstairs in the restaurant, whcih was a nice buffet breakfast. There is a nice selection of food, ranging from a hot breakfast (sausages, bacon, fried and scrambled egg, beans and mushrooms), cereals, fruit, salad, cold meats and cheese, toast and pastries. They also offer a range of 'DIET' foods should you want to stay on a diet whilst you're there! Also wide range of drinks - including a bottle of chilled Cava should you wish to start the day on a high! Coffee and tea is provided by the staff (there are different types of tea provided and you can choose from these) The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is loacted just off the main square, Placa Catalunya (if getting the bus from the airport, walk over to the opposite side of the square where there is another H10 hotel and walk to the FC Barcelona shop and turn left walking down that road on the side of the FC Barcelona shop, the hotel is located on that side before the next road junction). This means that you are extremely close to the centre of town, close to the Ramblas and the bus tours. The staff at reception were very helpful and friendly. If you want to use the Barcelona Bus Touristic sightseeing bus, then ask at the reception and they will sell you the vouchers for 4euros and then buy the ticket on the bus for 16euros, saving 2euros on the price in the main square. Very nice touch and staff are always ready to help. Overall the hotel is a very nice hotel, located centrally with easy access to the rest of the city. I would really recommend staying here if you want to have a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Knattster
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, basic hotel - nothing special except the breakfasts, which are fantastic; and the rooftop terrace. Otherwise basic but clean and friendly enough. The location is good, by las ramblas (and where the tour buses leave from, plus you can get a bus to / from there from the airport). If you get a good deal on Lastminute.com or similar then you will get good value for money. The bathroom is a walled off area within the bedroom which was a bit odd, and the sink is in the bedroom. However, I would stay there again - just don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience with both room and staff”
Reviews.Author: EndaFler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was chosen as a result of my travelling fellows had already booked there. When we arrive there is problem with the air conditioning in one or more floors and my traveling companions got a room at another hotel nearby. The hotel can not be blamed for that. But when I as a single traveler saw the room I was assigned, I was very, to put it mildly disappointed. Small, cramped, claustrophobic overlooking an atrium without daylight. This was the first floor. Complained and was moved to seventh. Better, but the same size, no place to sit outside on the bed, etc. The elevator right beside it and a lot of noise. The bathroom was large and nice. The female employees in the check-in was not very welcoming. The morning I was checking out I was not greeted with good morning, but just "checking out..". As the hotel all the time asking for feedback via a form, I thought I'd give it orally to the lady behind the counter in a neutral manner. It was not a pleasant conversation. She could just have said that they were sorry I was not happy with the stay. I paid the same price as others who stayed in larger and nicer rooms. Would never recommend this hotel - on the contrary.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: rossbet
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel along with another couple of friends. The location is perfect for walking the "Ramblas" and for taking the open top hop on hop off bus. There are a multitude of excellent and inexpensive "tapas" restaurants nearby. The hotel is modern in style and the staff go out of their way to be helpful, we will definitely stay here again on our next Barcelona visit.

Reviews.Title: “Price quality is good”
Reviews.Author: aleman_claudia
Reviews.Content: is a nice hotel, don't have super big expectations, modern but could require some renovation... rooms are quite small so if you're having big -and more than 2- suitcases you probably won't have enough space to walk in and out of the room. Breakfast is extra (a bit expensive) but definetely worth it, enough food -buffet- if considering that spaniards don't really have a breakfast culture so you might be eneded spending about 10euro just for coffe, orange juice and bread outside. Very good located, great for turists!

Reviews.Title: “Best location and everything you'd need”
Reviews.Author: Passela
Reviews.Content: We loved the location o this hotel.A couple of minutes walk to corniche and the main city center.we had big suite very nice, comfortable and good lighting.The beakfast in this hotel is ok but certainly not as good as some....all staff members are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and everything you'd need”
Reviews.Author: TrishFish26
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. A couple of minutes walk to Plaça Catalunya, a main hub, and from there to La Ramblas. We had a room at the front which is worth asking for as you have a little balcony to view the street below. Quite a noisy street, but the double glazing cut out all the noise. TV and broadband connection in the room. Even a glass of bubbly for you in reception on check-in! We eat once in the restaurant and the food was lovely - perhaps a little lacking in atmosphere. The roof terrace was disappointing as it was essentially shut up still. Maybe better in the summer. Would use again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Closest Hotel To Pl Catalunya and Airport Buses”
Reviews.Author: harlan8
Reviews.Content: VERY centrally located. I got a good deal for a Sunday night. Room was very nice, bathroom quite nice. Comfortable and good lighting. They had a public computer for guests. It was VERY short walk to airport buses.

Reviews.Title: “position excellent,very close to all sites.”
Reviews.Author: mowil7
Reviews.Content: Get a two day Turistic bus pass.This will enable you to see all the sites on day one & stop off at the sites on day 2.Hop on hop off. La Quinze Nits (eatery) ok but really not worth the wait(mentioned in all the guide books). The breakfast in this hotel is ok but certainly not as good as some of the reviews I read before arriving here.The subway travels directly underneath the hotel & can be a little weird (shakes the cups etc in the lower rooms).We slept well in spite of this.Comfortable room but some looked on the small side.Staff very helpful & pleasant. Interesting city & enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaydee2003
Reviews.Content: Just back from Barcelona, excellent hotel. Met with a free glass of cava and as we were friends on facebook were also given a voucher for a complimentary cocktail at the bar. We were also given welcome gift, choc cake and fruit (very nice touch). Very close to the main square where you can get the tour buses and hard rock cafe. I would go back again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent concierge staff saved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: froogal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is bright, clean and modern inside, with excellent lighting and a wonderful shower in the room. The free Wi-Fi worked well. There was some street noise from our second floor front room, but otherwise all the amenities were fine. Going above and beyond their usual duties, the concierge staff helped us to resolve an accidental double charge for a very expensive lunch, without causing any hurt feelings -- which would have otherwise been impossible given our Spanish and the restauranteur's English. The hotel is near both the Plaza Catalunya and Universitat Metro stops, with a bus stop right out front. We found the location an ideal starting point for our exploration of the city.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT PLACE, GIVE IT A TRY. PERFECT FOR A CITY BREAK”
Reviews.Author: briddiver
Reviews.Content: Having been completely disolutioned with Rome last year this was like a breath of fresh air. We read the reviews and asked for an upper floor front room on arrival even though we did not book direct we were given an excellent room with balcony and champagne welcome. Room as good as you could expect given the rating/price, fresh linen every day,comfortable beds, big shower and good quality air con/heating. Breakfast is superb, chapagne, freshest of fruit and anything else you could want or eat, a bit short of staff at some times but give them a minute and what you want appears with a smile. Location could not be better, you could eat for a month going out of the door,turning left or right and going round the block one restaurant at a time, a couple of absolute gems even though my spanish isn't good and my wife is vegi.Only need to cross the road to get to the Irish bar opposite.Metro stations to everywhere within one block, loads of buses and taxis. 20 minutes walk down Las Ramblasto Colon monument & seafront, Gaudi house just round the corner,markets and shops of all kinds just a stroll away. Excellent roof terrace but you need to use the lift to avoid spilling too much beer going up 8 flights of stairs! Nice small bar at reasonable price. The staff are out of the top drawer, no matter what the time or nature of request we were always met with a smile and a pleasant manner. English not a problem! Wife's big birthday a total success thanks largely to a great hotel and a bit of sunshine

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great value.”
Reviews.Author: bobthetarmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a city break with friends to watch Barcelona v Valencia football match. We had single rooms which clean, modern and reasonably priced. The breakfast was really fantastic loads of variety and very good quality. The location of the hotel is perfect very close to Pl Catalunya and metro stations so ideal for sightseeing and getting about. The staff were very courteous and helpful Thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Superb Location!!”
Reviews.Author: west1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Universitat from April 1st until the 4th. The hotel itself was superb, service first class, but the real gem is it's location. Just off the Plaza Catalunya and 2 mins walk from the start of La Rambla, it really is an ideal spot. The Plaza itself is ideal for getting city tour bus, and also the airport shuttle coaches drop you off and pick you up there. A really super hotel, that made our trip to Barcelona even better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location; awesome breakfast buffet!”
Reviews.Author: RafalA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right by the Placa Catalunya and La Rambla; I mean you are right at the center of things, and within a walking distance of everything you need. The hotel is a 3-star hotel (no swimming pool or fitness center), with a fantastic restaurant, including one of the top breakfast buffets on the planet. The staff are very friendly, and service is first class. The terrace on top of the hotel is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL IN ALMOST EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: jaguar1414
Reviews.Content: Bright, clean, friendly, ideal location and comfortable. This is a good hotel and I can be fussy. The rooms were clean and bright - beds a little firm. We had a room overlooking the main road on the 6th floor - the double glazed windows and door onto the small balcony enabled us to get a good nights sleep with little interference from traffic noise. Perfectly located to Place Catalunya (2 mins walk) Barcelona is at your fingertips from there. Good cheap regular bus service from the airport stops with a 5 min walk of the hotel. Breakfast outstanding. Staff very friendly and welcoming glass of champagne! Little to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, professional staff, good location, great breakfast, good price”
Reviews.Author: menelaos1983
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip to Barcelona, where I stayed for 4 nights, all of them at H10 Universitat. The experience was very good! The Universitat Double Rooms we booked were not huge but spacious, the ventilation was silent and efficient and the breakfast was very good! Wide range of choices (not vast, but very satisfying) and most importantly: it actually TASTED good. The cakes, croisants, bacon and even the scrambled eggs were really good - not frequent as you probably know!! The automatic elevator system seemed to behave a little weird at times, but that's not really really a problem in a lowrise. Now, problems: the balcony door didn't shut totally when closed. I mean, it did close, but it wasn't very tight, so a little amount of cold air came in. Not a problem actually, we set the temperature of the room to 23 or something and didn't even feel any temperature fluctuations. Really nothing to worry about, just thought I'd write it for the review be complete. The only real problem of the room -just the one- was that the toilet was separated by just a glass wall. And although one would suppose that a glass wall would be on the side of the toilet where there's no door, this one was on the side of the room that had the toilet door on! So no blinds you can shut - obviously the glass was not transparent though. To make matters worse, it was on the side that actually faced the room door. Obviously, a door with no case can't really stop the air from flowing from the one side to the other, as it leaves half a cm of space between the door and the wall beside it. The obvious complication was that when someone had to use the bathroom a. the pleasant odor would spread to the entire room like a plague and b. if someone walks in the room or someone walks around the room he can just see inside... Being there with a friend that wasn't so terrible, but what if I was there with a co-worker? In some weird and cunning twist, we had this problem in the room with the two separate beds and NOT the room with the double bed. Kind of interesting, you would suppose that privacy was less of an issue for people who share beds. Add to that that if you forget a do-not-disturb sign and someone walks in to clean the room they'll just see what you do in the bathroom, and if they happen to see from the correct angle they'll see you perfectly clear. A nice addition was the glass curtain on the shower. No way you can be sure no one sees you there. Quite interesting. Ask for a room with normal walls around the bathroom if you need to. To end on a positive note, I wanted to keep my the about-the-staff notes for the end of the review. Everyone was friendly and welcoming and VERY helpful. Suggesting routes to visit landmarks, very helpful and efficient about airport bus and tourist bus info (incidentally, they both have a stop at Plaza Catalunya which is like 300 meters from the hotel - use them both, the airport bus normally takes less than half an hour to the new terminal and the tourist bus -especially the blue line- takes you around the city landmarks, plus you get many discount coupons with it). We were offered champagne upon arrival and check in/check out were a couple of moments each. The prices at the mini-bar seemed rather good too, although i didn't use it. On the whole, being next to Plaza Catalunya -which means also: close to Las Ramblas, Bari Gotic, Raval etc --> nightlife, food, walking around etc; just be very careful with your wallets and cameras, two of the three of us "lost" these) - I think H10 Universitat is a very very good choice to explore the city! Would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 15hockey
Reviews.Content: We chose H10 Universitat based on the reviews on the Trip Advisor pages and we chose well. The hotel is approximately 200m from Placa Catalunya which provides links to the airport (via buses and trains); to the city (via the metro) and to outlying places by using the train service. The main part of the city is at most 10 mins away and there are some fantastic restaurants and cafes in the vicinity. The room was clean and it is definitely worth asking for a room at the front of the hotel so that you can have a balcony with a view over the roofs of Barcelona. The roof top terrrace is worth a visit as I should imagine that it is a pleasant place to spend some time (we visited it during thunder storm!). We breakfasted at the hotel (10 E) and although not overly cheap, the food was good and you could eat as much as you wanted as it was a buffet system. I would definitely return here, given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VeryTravelled2
Reviews.Content: Rooms tiny with low natural light and no character. Staff unfriendly

Reviews.Title: “recommendations for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lizzie40
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona with my sister-in-law on 26th feb 2010 for 3 nights. Hotel h10 Universitat was recommended as a great central location which it was. It was excellent value, nice, comfortable bedroom, very friendly staff, buffet breakfast was included in price. Breakfast included a great selection of fresh fruit, juices, cereals, breads, cakes, cooked foods, salads. There was even champagne if you were up early enough!3 We bought a 2 day bus ticket for local tourist bus company which was a great way to see the city. There is a red route and blue route bringing you to different parts of the city. The hotel was located near Plaza catalunya and very near La Rambla. Had 2 very good meals in Los Quattres Gats & La Tramoia, both near our hotel. Weather was pleasant, sunny and warmer than Ireland. Only thing to watch was the shops were closed on Sunday which came as a shock. However, we found a shopping centre down near the harbour which was open. Has a really nice Desigual shop! We both loved Barcelona, plenty to do and see, good value - great city break.

Reviews.Title: “10/10 - location, comfort, cant fault!”
Reviews.Author: cass1410
Reviews.Content: Wanted a centrally located hotel, didnt want to spend too much! Found the H10 Universitat. Arrived in Barcelona and took the aerobus from outside the terminal €5 for a single trip and the bus dropped outside El Corte Ingles in Plaza Catalunia. The hotel is less than 100m from the Metro stop. First impressions were good. We arrived at 11am and were pleasantly suprised when we were allowed access to our room straight away! We had booked a "romantic" double room and were shown to room 106 on the first floor. The room was very modern, large double bed, sliding wardrobes with plenty of hanging space and drawers, plasma 32" TV, glass bathroom with walk in shower, a vanity unit and the biggest surprise of all - a decked terrace with chairs, table and umbrella! The room was well equipped with minibar, tea and coffee making facilities, internet access and hairdryer. Part of the Romantic room package included a bottle of cava in the room, chocolate strawberries and breakfast in bed if we wanted. When we arrived back at the room at around 5pm the cava was in the ice bucket and the chocolate strawberries on a plate beside. We also received slippers and 2 bottles of water later that evening. The hotel facilities are fairly basic - bar, restaurant, conference rooms and a roof terrace. There are no leisure facilities but we didnt need them - we were visiting to take in the sights. We decided to take breakfast in the restaurant rather than in our room. The breakfast was buffet and plenty of choice. As well as the standard european continental there was also scrambleds eggs, bacon, sausages etc. All good quality and hot. Another added extra with the romanitc room was late check out at 3pm which was great as we had a late flight home. The hotel was very clean, the staff very helpful and the location was outstanding. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and if I go back to Barcelona would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Millie66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in January, it was quite difficult to find as the signage isn't too clear, however once we found it the hotel was chic and modern. The staff were friendly and welcome glass of champagne really helped! The hotel is located around 5-10 minutes from La Rambla so is just far enough away from the hustle and noise, however there are numerous restaurants located close to the hotel. The hotel rooms are great, clean and modern with excellent facilities, the only downside to ours was being at the back of the hotel ran the metro so noise was a minor issue. The hotel's restaurant was excellent with the breakfast being the best we have ever had and the evening menu being equally good. This hotel gets a big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a Hotel & what a City”
Reviews.Author: Gillibrand65
Reviews.Content: I visited Barcelona on a 2 night 3 day mini brake with my wife at the beginning of October. It was our first time in Barca and we loved it. The Hotel was fantastic. We had read previous reviews and asked for a room on the front. We were on the 3rd floor and we had great viewes of the Street below. The hotel is ideally situated for the Ramblas and the hop on hop off bus services. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and the food was very good. The room itself was excellent and more than adequate for our needs. There is a magnificent roof terrace, with exceptional views of Barcelona. I would definately go back to Barcelona and this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location to visit barcelona”
Reviews.Author: srups
Reviews.Content: H10 Universtait is ideal for exploring barcelona, its location is perfect. Airport bus leaves you 2 minutes walk away, Las rambles is only short walf away. The reception staff were friendly and fast, our room was on 6th floor and front facing and had small balcony. room was large and well equiped and spotless.tea/coffee making facilities large flat screen t.v, Would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Super Service”
Reviews.Author: sss1970t
Reviews.Content: This hotel is bang in the centre of Barcelona. We were given a room on the 6th floor. Bus routes start from outside, taxis are readily available, Ramblas and Placa de Gracia are short walks away, and yet, you are not in the noisy/extremely busy areas. Rooms are good, neat and serve the most delicious hot chocolate i have ever tasted! Lovely little balcony/enclsoed ledges to see the lively city below. We arrived at the hotel way before check-in, and were asked to use the restaurant. Our baggage was taken care of and we were made very comfortable in the restaurant, although it was after breakfast time. The staff took special care of the needs of our children aged 3 and 8. All through our stay, the service was fantastic, and they were very accommodating with our luggage and left luggage, while we went for a short cruise. On our return, when we dropped in to collect the luggage, and asked to buy a hot chocolate for our younger daughter, they surprised us by offering all four of us free breakfast, which we had to decline for want of time. We will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SRWebb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected this hotel based on the generally positive reviews. Overall it was a very good experience and I would recommend it, but with some caveats. Based on the recommendations form others, I joined the free H10 Club and requested an outer room on and upper floor. We wound up in room 411. The views were definitely very nice, but there was a lot of traffic noise from the street below. On top of this, the metro trains run underground very close to the hotel and produce a low rumble every couple of minutes. Also, there was a staircase just outside our room with the door propped open at all times, so you could hear people tromping up and down the stairs from several floors away. It wasn't a big deal to us, but light sleepers might have problems. Aside from the noise issues, the stay was very pleasant. The key thing was the location. The hotel is just off the Placa de Catalunya, within easy walking distance to La Rambla, the Gothic Quarter, and Eixample. For longer trips, the Universitat and Catalunya metro stops were each less than a block away. The room appeared to have been recently remodeled in a modern style and was very nice. The beds were comfortable and the climate controls worked well. Room amenities included an in-room safe, a light-blocking curtain, and a large flat-screen TV (although BBC World News was the only English channel we could find). We had breakfast included in our price and the buffet had a great selection of delicious foods. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful, and the cleaning staff were efficient and unobtrusive. There were a few quirks with the bathroom. The bathroom area is walled off from the rest of the room with glass walls and a glass door. The glass door didn't close tightly like a regular door, so keep in mind that your fellow room occupant will be able to hear everything you're doing in there. Also, there was no door on the shower, just a short partition separating it from the sink, so the bathroom floor tended to get soaked while taking a shower. Other than this, the bathroom was nicely styled, clean, and functional. Based on our experience, we would consider staying at this or another H10 hotel for our future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Universitat”
Reviews.Author: cadiwales
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via the internet, which was dealt with efficiently. On the first night we were allocated an extremely small room, even though we had specifically requested a large room with a balcony. The Receptionist informed us that we would be moved the following moring. As promised all three parties from our booking were re-allocated to a much larger room at the front of the hotel. The only negative is that the Metro is to be heard from the rooms.The rooms are cleaned every day. Staff are friendly and accommodating. Breakfast is of a high standard, containing both Continental and English choices. The hotel is centrally located short walking distance from Catalunya Square and the top of Las Ramblas. We found a fantastic Cocktail Bar just a few doors( approx 10) towards the Square from the hotel, down a flight of stairs. It was a very popular bar. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone .

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Rahwayan
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a bit "shopworn" and in need of minor repairs, which caused us to change rooms 3 times during our short (3-night) stay! Inconsistent amenities in the rooms such as missing pillows. The major problem is that no matter what floor you are on, you will feel a regular rumble from the metro below. It's just a block from Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla, so location is convenient, but there are other, better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value for money, amazing breakfasts but you must get room at front”
Reviews.Author: PhilEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Junior Suite 801, 15-24 September 2010. Hotel is in a fantastic location right in the heart of Barcelona near Pl de Catalunya and Pl de Universitat - where you walk almost everywhere. It serves an amazing breakfasts (10 euros if not part of accommodation deal) which you must try. You get a glass of Cava on arrival and can even have one with your breakfast with your international and continental foods - cooked eggs, bacon & sausage, pastries, tortilla, sandwiches, salmon, cheeses, fruits, cakes, etc etc Room selection is key to enjoying your stay get a room at the front with large opening windows (preferably high up 4th floor and above to avoid metro and traffic noise) and you will love the hotel. Get a room at the back looking onto a wall and tiny and you will think you are in an expensive B&B. Daily you get free water, crisps, small cakes and sandwiches to help yourself to in the bar from about 5 pm. Also the hotel has now just opened a roof terrace where you can take up drinks from the bar and sit in the sun from 11 am until 11 pm a great facility for everyone. Use local buses to get around. Your are allowed 75 minutes to complete your journey and can transfer bus to tram or other bus. However, they are not hop on hop off even within 75 minutes allowed you must transfer from one bus to a tram or another different bus or your ticket will be stamped again when re boarding /returning

Reviews.Title: “Smooth, modern and impeccably clean”
Reviews.Author: trainsifpossible
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well placed, a block or so north of the Plaça Catalunya (away from the hectic Ramblas area). A five-minute walk from the airport bus stop. The décor is modern Mediterranean - lots of marble, dark wood and sharp edges. My room was probably one of the least good ones (small and facing into an airshaft) but it was well designed, with a spacious showerroom, and impeccably clean. The breakfast bar was one of the most best stocked and best managed that I've seen - certainly worth the 4 euro supplement if you have to pay it, unless you prefer a simple coffee and croissant at a café (the coffee and tea, by the way, were the usual awful hotel stews - the one duff note in my stay). Note for vegetarians - you might find, as I did, a welcoming plate of snacks in the room on arrival; but unless your curiosity about chorizo and jamón serrano gets the better of you, you'll need to give it a miss.... On the whole, a safe, quiet and comfortable three-star hotel with pretensions to a 4. But try and get a room with an external view.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Babyboomers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by others on Tripadvisor, so we booked it early, and were very glad we did. It was clean, cool, and very central. The staff were also very friendly and helpful. The hotel is only about 200 metres from where the double-decker tourist buses leave from, and from the supermarket and huge department store. A few metres from the hotel are some great cafes and restaurants and an ATM. We arrived at the hotel around 11am after a 12 hour flight and while it would have been wonderful to be able to check into our room immediately, the room was not ready, however they were happy to store our bags in a very secure room until our 2pm check-in. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: TheChennaiFoodie
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel this is!!!! Just a 5 min walk from the Catalunya Square, this hotel has wonderful rooms, great bathrooms, a decent lobby, very elaborate breakfast spread and a cozy feel to it. The staff are great and very very helpful. They made all the bookings for me and were willing to guide me on certain things to do in Barecelona. The location of the hotel is very important, esp if you plan on staying out late in Barcelona. All buses at night land on the Catalunya square and so you will not be stranded. You have two metro stations near by, the Catalunya and the Universitat, both only about 100 meters or so away. The breakfast at the hotel is stupendous with a lot of variety and very continental. Only downside was that everytime a metro passed by, the hotel seemed to vibrate. I first thought that it was an earthquake, but other than that, no complaints about this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and we hope to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: TheAcks
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to sights in Barcelona. The staff was wonderful and very helpful making suggestions. The breakfast was exceptionally good and we recommend the breakfast package. We had a junior suite that was spacious with a very nice balcony. We wished we could have stayed longer but we were only staying one night before our cruise vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: trixie33
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at this hotel for 2 days before a cruise. The only negative thing is that the air conditioning could have been more effective. It did not seem to cool the room properly. The room was not large but adequate and very clean. I thought the bed (two twins pushed together) was very comfortable but my husband thought the mattress was hard. We had a balcony to look out but there was not room to sit 2 chairs. We were on the 7th floor and were not bothered by noise at all. It was nice to be near the Ramblas but far enough away for quiet. It was only a short walk. The staff was very friendly, spoke English and helped however they could as far as giving recommendations for eating places etc. We arrived early on a Friday morning after an all night flight from the US and Erika gave us a room right away instead of making us wait un til check-in time in the afternoon. We were very grateful as we desparately needed a nap. The free internet service in the lobby was great.. We did not try the restaurant as we like to explore different places. It was a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: Dijkstra28
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great breakfast and service.Welcome reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in downtown Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: PtitLapin
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, and we were given a complimentary glass of cava on our arrival. We had requested a quiet room on a non-smoking floor. We were given a room at the back of the hotel and slept peacefully. The room was very clean, comfortable and modern. It is equipped with a flat-screen tv and electronic security box. There are also two computer terminals with internet in the lobby for guests. The location, just off of Plaza Catalunya, is close to the major tourist sites and shopping areas. We were able to walk from the hotel to Las Ramblas, the Gothic quarter, Sagrada Familia, Barcoloneta, etc. If you're not so inclined, there is a metro station 1/2 a block away. We didn't try the restaurant, so can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get to actually stay because they gave away our room”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl2020
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel before a few years ago and thought it very well located with modern rooms. But this time, we had a bad experience and ended up at another hotel. My husband lost his wallet and we had to cancel some credit cards. But we did not think this would affect our stay in 2 days in Barcelona at the H10. When we got there after a long train trip from France, we were told the hotel had given our room up since they noted our credit card was not valid and we had arrived after 6pm. It was 640pm. They were not very helpful at first, and then offed to call another hotel to see if they could find us a room, they did but at a much higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: marithbk
Reviews.Content: My husbond and I and our parents stayed at the H10 in May. We had been to Barcelona before and wanted a hotel near Placa de Catalunya. The hotel was perfect. Near busses and underground. Near Ramblas. Very nice breakfast. Nice rooms - 2 with a view to the street. The 3rd in the back was a bit dark but still nice. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. They helped me ordering flowers and cava to put in the rooms for our parents. Really nice and they had arranged a little extra too. We would love staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and central location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: naanamar
Reviews.Content: As someone who was visiting Barcelona for the first time (and travelling alone), I was most of all very pleased with the location of this hotel. It is only appr. 200 meters from Plaza Catalunya, which is one of the main plazas of the city. The plaza provides convenient access to airport transportation and a metro station for exploring the city, both of which were my key concerns. The hotel itself provides good services, such as internet PCs from the lobby and a nice bar. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and my room was always kept tidy and clean. Do have a go at the breakfast buffet during your stay! I had a single room that was very small and didn't have any proper view from the window. Also, the room was located on the first floor, which meant that the traffic noises from the street could be heard very easily. I would recommend getting the room from higher floors, if you can. All in all, I was very pleased with my stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful people”
Reviews.Author: rjfab
Reviews.Content: Everything was terrific - breakfast, service, assistance... room was a bit small and the air conditioning could have been a bit more effective - it was somewhat cooler than outside, but I would have liked it cooler. Staff in all areas of the hotel were terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent base for your stay”
Reviews.Author: kazza1979
Reviews.Content: We were there for a leisure break with friends and had an excellent stay, lovely clean hotel where the staff were very helpful. Room was very spacious and maintained to a high standard, cleaned every day for the 5 days we stayed. Very central base for staying in barcelona close to the underground and also the tour buses for the hop on hop off bus. Very nice restaraunts and bars close by. Would reccommend Cafe Zurich for a great stop for people watching. Would defintately return to this hotel, think some of the reviews on here are pretty unfair the hotel is perfect for a short break!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad overall”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeZappy
Reviews.Content: The H10 was very clean and had very friendly helpful English speaking staff. It was near Las Ramblas and had a metro (underground) station right opposite, from which you could get to anywhere, even the airport, (which was an overland link btw, but the tickets were good). Good fridge bar, clean restaurant with good food and there were a few good cafes/restaurants to eat at along that road. There was a Starbucks just around the corner to get a large cup of tea, good for us English tea freaks who get caffeine withdrawals. Downside, the room we had was tiny, there was no view from the window, only a space between the building and the bathroom had these massive frosted glass doors that ran right across the room, you pretty much could see what someone was doing in there from anywhere in the room, somewhat impersonal. The TV only had Spanish speaking channels, which was ok as we speak Spanish but you would think they could get the BBC world service for those that can only speak English. Overall we were just sleeping there and getting out early to go do the tourist thing, not hanging about, so for that it was good with us.

Reviews.Title: “A good city hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug365_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May 09 with my girlfriend. I can recommend it as a great place to stay for a short break. It’s quite a narrow and high building and the corridor’s are really narrow making the rooms look squashed together. The room we had was ok, not huge but all the usual facilities. The staff are very friendly and went that extra mile for us. The breakfast is ok but the restaurant is below the ground floor so feels a bit weird with no windows. Def worth staying for 2 or 3 nights but you might feel a bit claustrophobic after that. Barcelona is a beautiful city and plenty to see and do for a long weekend. Can recommend www.tablaocordobes.com for Flamenco, the main Gaudi buildings and tour of the Nou Camp.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & Spotless”
Reviews.Author: wanda516
Reviews.Content: -I was there for a week with 3 of my friends. The location is PERFECT. If you're going on any tours, it's a 2 minute walk to all tour bus pick ups and drop offs. Also, the metro station is just down the block and Las Ramblas is 2 blocks away (You're close enough to the action but you don't suffer from the crazy noise). -Furthermore, the staff is friendly and helpful with making dinner and entertainment reservations. Lastly, the rooms ARE small but they are newly renovated and they are spotless. The hotel is impeccably clean and hotel restaurant is delicious and reasonably priced. I would definitely stay at another H10 again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine For Insomniacs”
Reviews.Author: scalette
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at this hotel as a final stop before getting a plane home. We had been in four different Spanish cities and stayed in hostale to 4 star establishments. This hotel was the most expensive and the worst value. The staff were very pleasant and helpful but the very basic requirement of any hotel i.e. a night's sleep was problematic. We were given a first floor room which standard in size etc but there was totally inadequate noise insulation and there was a continuous roar of traffic from the road outside added to which there was the rumbling of metro trains (and neighbours who swiched on the television at 6am).The hotel we had stayed at prior to this was also on a busy main road but there was no problen with noise. Apart from the noise, the curtains were not effective at blocking out the light so the room was illuminated by street lights all night. I do not consider that this hotel deserves a 4 star designation

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, ideally-located, fab breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: hotelhoppers
Reviews.Content: to from the airport, via the aerobus which stops approx 100yds away from the hotel in Placa Catalunya. It is ideally located for shopping and sightseeing, being within walking distance of La Rambla, designer shops on Passeige de Gracia (Chanel, Armani, etc. as well as department stores and quirky boutiques), the port, the gothic quarter, Casa Batlla and Casa Mila. We chose not to use the tourist bus, which we thought was expensive but chose to use the ordinary buses to get to La Sagrada Familia, Placa d'Espana and Parc Guell (there is a tourist info booth in Placa Catalunya and they will advise which buses go where and where to catch them). Parc Guell is a must-see but get there early to avoid huge crowds and see it at its best - it opens at 10am. We found the staff at the hotel polite and very helpful. The hotel was spotlessly clean and our room, on the 7th floor, was a good size and although the view from the window was less than inspiring (an office building), there was a large bathroom (no bath but a huge shower cubicle), large, comfortable bed and a well-stocked mini bar. We chose the 'romantic package', which included a bottle of Cava and chocolate-covered strawberries on arrival and breakfast, which you can have delivered to your room; very good value. We did this on the first morning and enjoyed a nice selection of fresh pastries, cold meats and cheese, fruit, toast and preserves. For the remainder of our stay, however, we breakfasted in the restaurant where there was a wider selection, both hot and cold. I can recommend the scrambled eggs and we were delighted to discover chilled Cava with the bottled water; we indulged in Bucks Fizz every morning! In the evenings, we chose to eat in the bistros on Passeige de Gracia; cheaper than La Rambla and good value for money. Overall, a most enjoyable stay and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “H10 Universitat - Ideal Central location”
Reviews.Author: Fozziesontour
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Barcelona Airport, catched the Aerobus directly outside the terminal, these buses are blue and cost 4.25 Euros to Placa Catalunya. We got off at Universitat and within a 5 minute walk we arrived at the hotel H10 Universitat. We were swifty checked in, accepted a welcome glass of cava and we were on our way to our room. We stayed in Room 511, and although this room is beside the lift, we did not experience any noise. Our room faced the front of the hotel, and on to the main street. If the doors to small balcony are closed you will experience minimal noise from the street. As for the underground metro, only a minor rumble is experienced on the higher floors. We did use the free internet services in the hotel lobby, and the Wi Fi, although this was more tempremental depending on where you were in the hotel, but still a very good utility on offer. The room was of modern decor, very clean, tea/coffee making facilities, and yes the cups are plastic. We had a well stocked mini bar and the prices were the same as the bar prices. The room also had a TV, digital safe which could be used free of charge. The bathroom was well equipped, ours had a shower over bath and if you look through the traveller photos on this site you will see the very well stocked kit. This had shampoo, shower gel, body lotion, disposable razor, toothbrushes, shoe polisher, shower cap, sewing kit, tissues and even a comb!!! Also equipped with shaving mirror and hair dryer. We booked this hotel on a Bed and Breakfast basis, and there was something for everyone at breakfast time. This hotel is in an excellent location for exploring Barcelona, and within 5 mins you are on the Placa Catalunya and La Rambla, and close to underground metro stations linking you to the rest of this wonderful city. If we return to Barcelona we would not hesitate in staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great location lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: ghostie5
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location ! The hotel is very clsoe to the metro meaning you can get anywhere in Barcelona very quickly to see the sites whilst been just a five minute walk from the main street las rambles ( think thats how its spelt !) and the shops . The staff were very helpfull and as we didnt fly until midnight we were concerened about wandering with our cases all day but the hotel kept them in a locked room all day . The champagne on arrival was a lovely touch to start off the stay . Yes plastic cups for tea and coffee isnt the best but if asked they will provide normal cups . The staff speal fairly good english for Barcelona and are always willing to help . Room 805 we were in was plenty big enough for two people and deptie not having a front view we had a lovely view of the mountains through the buildoings . Overall great stay would stay again or at this chain again .

Reviews.Title: “Join H10 Club”
Reviews.Author: petelesbenbow
Reviews.Content: I am a member of Club H10 and would recomend anyone staying at this hotel to do the same. Having read some of the previous reviews before my stay I emailed the hotel requesting a High floor and an outside room, quoting my membership number. On arrival I was given room 701 which was a good size with a large bathroom and shower and it looked as if it had been recently refurbished. It had tea and coffee making facilitys and also a fridge. I saw inside some of the inside rooms and they did seem a bit small. I did not eat at the hotel as the breakfast was a bit pricey but there are numerous Cafes within 100 yards of the hotel where you can eat for a fraction of the price. The bar in the hotel is very quiet but is an Ideal place to have a drink before going out. The hotel is ideally located approximatly 100 yards from place Catalunya, which is at the top of Las Ramblas The Aerobus that runs from the airport to this location runs every 5-10 minutes and costs 4.25euro . On arrival at the hotel you are offered a free glass of Cava and also as a Member of Club H10 you are given a voucher for afree drink in the Hotel Bar. Overall this is an ideal Hotel in a great location for exploring Barcelona for a weekend

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel...great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: lazercat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel and the stay exceeded our expectations. Upon our arrival we found our rooms were not ready butonly waited a short while and were offered champagne while we waited. We stayed in room 611 which is one of the outer-facing rooms. The room was a perfect size for two people and was very comfortable. Although we had requested a queen-sized bed, the outer rooms only had 2 doubles, but the housekeeper came in right away and remade the bed after pushing the two together and it was perfect. The bed was really comfortable. The first night the hotel sent us two pieces of cake with a note welcoming us to Barcelona. The breakfast the next morning was unbeatable. The food and decor were those of a top restaurant and I couldnt wait to eat there each morning. We were also offered a complimentary cocktails at the bar during our stay. Make sure you ask for an outer facing room...one that ends in 11, on a high floor. The noise from the street is not noticeable once you close the balcony doors. The only drawback to this hotel is that we had some issues with the hot water. The water would turn from cold to hot and then every temperature in between and it needed a lot of adjustment. It was a bit of an annoyance for us but the hotel was perfect in every other way and we would be delighted to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: chas19670
Reviews.Content: Everything as it should have been here - including very good breakfast. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: heaveninwetsuit
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Barcelona and my friend recommended staying at a H10 hotel. This one was right at the top of Las Ramblas, not too far from the Bus Station, and really close to the a Metro line. The rooms were a bit small and some of our toiletries were already used before we got there. The double bed was two beds pushed together but we managed. The only soft bedding we could find was the blanket in the closet. The staff was great. We were on the 4th floor facing the back so it was relatively quiet. Try not to get a room by the elevators because you can hear a lot of noise from the hallway. Even with the small things that could have been better, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: padpop
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Ideally located in a clean and decent part of the city. Within walking distance of main attractions and within yards of pick up point of Tourist bus. Several good restaurants on same street that the locals were attracted to. The cava on arrival is a nice touch. Helpful staff, and adequate modern rooms. The patio at the rear was a wonderfully peaceful haven.The buffet breakfast was one of the best I've had in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Claire1624
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the H10 Universitat Hotel Barcelona for 3 nights, arriving Friday 30th Jan and departing Monday 2nd Feb 2009. I have read the reviews on tripadvisor before booking the hotel to ensure it was ok, and I was impressed with them so decided to book. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location, just off the top of La Rambla and Placa de Catulunya square. We stayed in Room 511 on the 5th floor and the room was average size with a good size bedroom. There was no double bed but twin beds, but this wasn't a big deal, we just moved them together. The hotel was very quiet and we had no problems with noise during the night or from the metro. The bar in the hotel was very quiet and wasn't always manned by staff so you had to wait a while sometimes to get served, but we generally only used it before going out for a meal or coming back from a night out. The hotel as 2 computers with free internet access and you can use these at any time. We booked room only and decided to have breakfast in the restaurant on the 1st morning. A little on the pricey side €17 per person which is expensive just for breakfast, but it is a buffet and you can have as much as you want, so we definatley filled up and that done us until late afternoon. The staff in the hotel were pleasant and their English was good. We went to a restaurant a few doors up from the hotel and the food was excellent (can't remember name) and very reasonably priced. I would recommend to do the 2 day bus tour. the blue and red routes are the best. A lot of people had said to me before we left that pickpocketing was a major problem in Barcelona, but I didn't see one incident the whole weekend, but was still very aware of my personal belongings and handbag etc. Some of the bars of Le Rambla are very expensive for drink, but with the Euro being so bad at the moment, this was expected. All in All we really enjoyed our stay in H10 Universitat Hotel Barcelona and would recommend it anyone and would definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: caroleblakeley
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central in location handy for the air port bus ect. We got off at Universistat the bus has a little screen to tell u the next stop so you won’t get off at the Wong one. Once you get off the bus turn left and basically it’s the street facing you down the side. If in doubt ask a policeman they all speak in English and are friendly. Its literally a 3 min walk from the bus please don’t get a 30 euro taxi its 4 euro on the bus (exchange rate was one for one !!) come out of air port terminal turn right and you will see the buses they are blue and have airport bus on them. Get the bus back from plaza cataluna you will see where they all are when you walk past this area. All bus drivers speak English. Check in was fast and we had the free cava the room was at the front and on floor 4. Personally I would have preferred higher to eliminate the low rumble of the metro below the building although it did not bother me that much you can hear it and it will disturb a light sleeper other than that it was not that noisy. Room as the internet pics all nice clean and modern nice bathroom with hair dryer and lots of smellies you could just get away with taking some conditioner. The breakfast was fine lots of choice although some of it was weird to us as they cater for most countries you will find something to eat its all buffet style. Staff all ok polite enough and fairly attentive, we did not dine in the restaurant but it was £20 for a 3 course meal at dinner so one of the cheaper places to eat drinks we thought where on the high side until we went on La Rambla (£3.50 a bottle of san Miguel in hotel bar) bar in hotel very lifeless could be far better. There is a mini bar in the room same prices as the main bar so not that bad. It’s good for keeping shop bought stuff in! We did the one day tour bus and it was ace worth the £20 each as in total its about 6 hours you don’t have to sit on get on and off when you want with your all day pass. The Guell park is a must wow factor. The port is nice and mounturic in fact all over is fab. I know its tempting but try not to eat and drink on the rambla its sooooo expensive and if you must eat and drink on it go for the menu of the day with a drink if poss this starts from £8 per person sounds cheap but add another drink and it will be as much as double ! we had 2 pints of larger (local stuff one small cava and a small water for £25.00 I almost fell on the floor another place to avoid is the jazz bar down stairs a few doors away from the hotel £18 for 2 very small cocktails. All I can say is check the menu for the prices before you enter or you WILL get stung. Most other places where fair expensive to eat and drink we spent a small fortune and we did not do half the things we could have (not because of money but we ran out of time) Average beer price is about £5-£7 a pint in the popular tourist places if you get away from the main parts we found places that it was £2.50 a pint. The best places we found for food and drink at reasonable prices where behind the hotel. If you walk out of the hotel turn left keep going until the end of the rd turn left again go to the top of the street and there is a bar on the corner all La Tromia right across the rd is Contedell Citual or something along those lines also there is Obhmas next door (more expensive tho) these 2 bars have excellent Tapa (contedell is the best) its not to dear small beer I think was about £1.40 and the Tapas was from a few pounds up to about £10. Stay clear of the Ibrirco Ham is very expensive indeed about £16.00 for a small plate (it’s the best I have ever had tho) I wish I had found these bars sooner as we ended up in and about La Rambla a lot. The old town Barri Gottic is a bit cheaper as well. There is a nice oyster bar Vildsvin if you come across it do go in it has very fresh oysters (try them if u have never had them they are nice but slimy!). Obamas is just a bar really but had a good atmosphere. Drinking and eating around the hotel and round the back of the hotel was the best bet for the best food and drink. We went to the market with high hopes of having some nice food but all the little cafes where packed out it was an amazing market and worth a visit. The street entertainers on La Rambla are good but do give them a euro if you want to take a photo this is how they make a living. One word of warning its very easy to wander off the beaten track with all the side streets they are all dark and narrow and can feel intimidating. We ended up I think in ravel (not 100% tho) at night time it was only about 10pm but we came out of the back door of the supermarket on La Rambla (carrforre) and ended up a bit lost the area was or seemed dodgy so please be careful. Lucky we did not get robbed or anything but it would have been easy for someone to do it to us. Like any city keep your bag close and gents keep money and wallets in your front pocket. All in all it was a nice break not sure I would go again for all over Christmas as I did miss home and thought it would be a bit more Christmassy but it was a bit of a let down in that area, however they don’t celebrate at the same time us (Prague is fab at Christmas) The weather was fine for the first 2 days sunny and about 17 degrees and it was about 20 on Xmas day, boxing day hammered it down so take a very large sturdy umbrella with you. There are lots of shops in Barcelona but again are quite expensive with the euro being so strong against the pound, but it’s nice to look in the windows of prada and Gucci etc. You will have a good time just keep off the big tourist areas to eat and drink go to the Aquarium that was good (£17 each to get in) there is the Zoo we did not visit tho and of course the Guell park where Gaudi art is amazing and the Sagradi Familiar is a must see. There are lots of other things to do just check out trip advisor. Any questions just email me. All in all I would stay in the hotel again but would like a higher floor I think it was about right for what we paid quality wise. I would recommend it and Barcelona but maybe when the pound is a bit stronger

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Herzog
Reviews.Content: Having browsed through several hotels and B&Bs in Barcelona, I decided to stay at the H10 Universitat. I arrived early in the morning and although I could not get my room until 11.30 am, the people at the front desk and the bell boy were very friendly, they offered to store my luggage immediately, offered me a cuo of coffee and gave me a city map if I wanted to visit the city centre. Although I booked a single room (normally with a back view), I was given a fair size front view room! The bathroom was enormous, about 1/3 of the room, stuffed with all the bare necessities a business traveller would look for. I have to agree with other people that the breakfast is very rich with lots of cereal, egg, fruit and bread choices. Overall, a great value for money hotel, at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Getting the right room is important”
Reviews.Author: ScotGlasgow2008
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a weekends stay for my birthday through a website that offered a "romantic double" package which included a bottle of cava, strawberries and chocolate, room service breakfast and a later check out time. All I can say is that we had a fantastic time in Barcelona; the service at this hotel was first class. The location really is very good; a two minute walk from La Rambla and the Hard Rock Cafe where we had dinner one night. The staff were helpful and friendly although there was a bit of a mix up with the bill at the end. I would say that requesting a larger room seems to be important. Our room (already listed in another review) was clean, spacious and modern with superb facilities; and a large bathroom sperated by a wall and a door! The air condtioning was a bit poor but then it was November and probably wasn't switched on centerally. The view from the small balcony was good and we were high up enough to avoid street noise; the only disturbance had was a large demonstration early evening which was not the hotel's fault. All in all a superb place for anyone visting the city....unless you want a swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “mounties on tour belfast”
Reviews.Author: JeannieBelfast
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Barcelona in a party of 7. We stayed at this hotel and from the moment we arrived we had nothing but first class service from all the staff. The staff comprised of quite a lot of young people and I can say they were helpful,friendly and polite at all times. The hotel itself was tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable. It's proximity to placa catalunya made touring the city easy. Transport is cheap and reliable, trains and buses leave and arrive on time, a pity it's not the same at home. I can safely recommend this hotel and Barcelona. Oh and by the way the breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Phil_123465
Reviews.Content: I booked the H10 as part of my girlfriend's 30th birthday present. I wanted it to be a special trip so emailed the hotel before we went to ask if we could have a bigger room. On arrival the reception staff gave us champagne and a warm welcome. Our room was excellent. 512 for those who are thinking of requesting. I travel quite a bit with work and have to say the breakfast at this hotel was one of the best I've ever experienced. The hotel is also in a brilliant location for all the sights. Summing up I'd strongly recommend the H10. The service throughout our 2 night stay was first class and when we return to Barcelona, we'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Closet Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PerthBrita
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted with champagne, that was probably to numb us for what awaited us when we went to our room. It was no bigger than a closet and claustraphobic with a tiny window opening to a dark airless internal shaft.We promptly complained and were told there was nothng that could be done as the hotel was full, so we demanded our money back as we were prepared to go in search of another hotel room ratjher than stay in this closet. On hearing this we were told that there was a room available but the people had still not checked out and we would have to wait for them to collect their luggage from the room. This was after 3pm.Two hours later we were told the people had checked out but the room needed to be cleaned. We had been sitting in reception all this time and had seen no one check out or collect luggage. Another three hour wait followed while the room was serviced and finally we were given a room at the back of the hotel. So in all from the time we arrived in Barcelona till the time we finally got our room it had been a wasted afternoon. They have a nerve charging people the same price for the closet room as for their normal sized rooms. The reception staff were not particularly helpful and downright unfriendly. Although we had little noise at the back of the hotel the rumbling of the metro every 10 minutes or so was very annoying. So fellow travellers when booking this hotel be very wary of the 4 internal rooms on each of the floors they are tiny and claustraphobic.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is stealing my money”
Reviews.Author: truax78
Reviews.Content: I work for an airline and have traveled extensively. I've seen my share of hotels, some good and some bad. Generally, what sticks out in my mind when I am contemplating rebooking at a hotel is the type of service that the hotel provides. We arrived in Barcelona early on the morning of September 14th. We were on the last leg of a nine European trip. We originally scheduled to leave the hotel on the 17th, but we were hoping to leave one day early on the 16th as we were getting a little tired from our trip. We spoke with two people at the front desk. The second one assured us, that since they have a 24 hour cancel policy, it was OK that we canceled our room for the night of the 16th so we could leave a day early. We ended up leaving the hotel the morning of the 16th and returing to the U.S. Upon my return home, I realized that we were charged for all three nights. I have since contacted them several times and they are telling me that they can't (or won't) refund my money for the last night we canceled because neither of the people at the desk documented it. So, now they are just saying it is my word against theirs. At 145 Euro (roughly $210), this is no cheap mistake on their part. Yet, we are the only ones paying for it. Very disappointing!!! The hotel itself is pretty nice (great breakfast). Except, I do not recommend staying in the rooms that end with 10, as they are the small rooms that everybody is complaining about. It is just so frustrating that a nice European vacation had to end with some disappointment all because of the staff of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Tiny!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Kangaroo1
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 4 * hotel- you get the impression the hotel was built with great quality but the operation is definitely 3 star. Stingy feeling. Its modern with great fixtures free internet but NO ROOM to place a suitcase. The bathroom is 1/3 size of the room!! Brekafst was great I have to say. What a let down the room size was..lets all the other positives fade away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: idophir
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel is new and stylish, the staff is very friendly and the breakfast buffet is very nice with a wide selection of foods. The hotel is in a great location, very close to two major metro stations and surrounded by nice restaurants and tapas bars. There are two minor glitches: (1) wireless connection does not reach all of the rooms. If you need it, ask for a room near the elevators where the access point is located; (2) the shower and toilet room is separated from the main room by an unsealed glass door, which may be awkward. I believe some of the rooms have a real door but I am not sure. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Worst receptionists ever”
Reviews.Author: SannaTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: This hotel should not be awarded four stars. Yes, the rooms are flawless (if you are so lucky to be assigned a medium sized one: there are very small rooms too). Yes, breakfast is affluent and yes, the complete hotel decoration is beautiful and stylish. Its location is perfect. Staff is generally friendly and adequate. But the service at the reception desk is the worst I've ever had to deal with (and I've seen a lot of hotels, especially in Spain). At arrival we had to wait six hours for our room. Every time we were sent away given the promise that our room would certainly be ready within the next hour. Every time we returned, our room was still not cleaned. When we finally complained, instead of getting an apology, we were treated like small children. I don't have to mention that there was no champagne for us, although some other guests (how do they select them?) did get their glass. Yes, we were suitably dressed, yes we know how to behave. When leaving it was not possible to keep our room any longer (although no other guests were arriving). And finally they charged us 10 euro for calling a taxi. Leaving such a beautiful city, the reception desk of this hotel left us feeling quite uneasy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: michih
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right at Las Ramblas and close to the metro station, helpfull and friendly staff, welcome champaign and cake in the evenining, free internet in the lobby. Stayed only one night, but we will return. Excellent breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “I'm with the 86%”
Reviews.Author: BoarderX
Reviews.Content: Even though a few reviewers have commented on the "mixed reviews" here for this hotel, it just ain't true. 86% have ranked the H10 Universitat at least four out of five. Having now just stayed there, I totally agree. From the point of check-in in the very nice lobby, the well-staffed front desk with enthusiastic and multilingual staff, the quick glance into a chic but not overdone hotel restaurant, and, of course, the glass of champagne that comes with your room key, this hotel feels like a first-class property. The room was immaculate and completely modern and stylish, with all glass paneling separating the bedroom from the bathroom (don't worry, its frosted). While my single room was unsurprisingly quite small, the bathroom was American-sized with an unexpected large shower. My room was on the second floor facing the interior courtyard, but other than the constant drip of a water drain two floors down I wasn't bothered. The in-room free wireless Internet access was easily set up, reliable, and fast. Like many European hotels, the room's electrical power requires the room key to be slid into a slot, which makes it impossible to charge phones and iPods while you're out -- so you have to plan your overnight charging accordingly. The location of the H10 Universitat can't be beat, at the tip of La Rambla where several of Barcelona's coolest and most historic districts intersect. For LGBT travelers, it offers a great middle ground between the old city and the "gayxample" district.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruby024
Reviews.Content: We have spent two nights at the H10 Universitat Hotel before leaving for a cruise. Our start was not good at all as our original booking was to the H10 Catalunya Plaza. At arrival we wore told that by their mistake we did not have a room, but instead we were “upgraded” to the very near hotel from the same chain: the H10 Universitat Hotel. After check-in at the new hotel we find the room (105 ) extremely small, with not enough space even to open our luggage, no views and, the worst, extraordinary hot as we had ever seen before ! Even the walls were hot if you touch them, most possible due to a near kitchen or the hot water hotel’s system and a bad isolation. We could almost not breathe inside even opening the window. After complain to the receptionist, we were quickly changed to a new room. This time an very good one on the 5th floor (511). After this minor incident we find the hotel extremely good, with a highly professional as pleasant staff. The people from the reception could not be nicer to all guests. The breakfast was really great with a good variety of choices. The room was very well designed with a good bathroom always spotless clean. The situation could not be better so near the Ramblas and the Bairro Gotico. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: david041
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights prior to cruising the Med. This has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, due to staff friendliness, cleanliness, room sizes and brilliant meals. They also allowed us to leave all our luggage with them on return from the cruise for a full day safe and secure. It is very central, just around 50 yards off Las Ramblas. Brilliant!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Very Contemporary Modern Hotel - Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: jpktrk
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect based on the mixed reviews - so we emailed the hotel and requested a large, modern room near the top of hotel (good for views & noise) and this is exactly what we got - ask for room 702 - its great! Although we did ask for a Double and got a twin, but as the room was so nice, we just pushed the beds together and actually caught up on some sleep too! Great location is an understatement - just off Playa de Catalunya and the Ramblas and just a few minutes walk from everything including the Airport Bus stop (just aim for top left corner of square!). Really easy to get around and the architecture is beautiful - better than expected. We did the tourist bus on the first day (red route is best) so it gave us our bearings and highlighted the tourist bits. Then the following days we just caught the Metro everywhere as its so easy and cheap and you can go whereever you wish. Park Guell and sagrada familia are defintely worth a visit and do the guided tour in the Sagrada, as you find out alot more than just walking around it. Also did the inside of La Pedras/Casa Mila, which if your a Gaudi fan, is worth it. The walk up to Park Guell is worth it, as you have great views and great scenery too. Have fun and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE BARMAN (NAMED WAN) BADLY NEEDED SOME MANNERS.”
Reviews.Author: PaisleyScotlandGeo
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great location & Breakfast very good.Rooms a little small but very comfortable .Mini bar fridge was not working ,but reception got it fixed no problemThe lad dani at reception was 1st classHe couldn"t do enough to help you,but shame about the barman named wan who is in the wrong job as his service & p.r. was appalling.

Reviews.Title: “ok for a prison cell”
Reviews.Author: marrianne
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the h10 universitat for one night and having read mixed reviews i did email the hotel to ask if we could possible have a room on a higher floor facing front. I was encouraged when i received back a very nice email saying they would take my request in to account and do their best. We did book a double room for 2 people i made sure of this as i had noted some people have previous said they booked single rooms for 2. We did get a good price this seemed to be due to a promotional deal so i didn't worry as other comments have also stated they got good prices and were very happy with their room. We arrived quite late in the evening and were pleasantly greeted with a glass of cava given our room keys all very efficient. Our room 210 was indeed on a higher floor but on opening the door proved to be a shock. I have seen bigger boxrooms. it did have a double bed but the room was so small 2 people couldn't even pass each to walk around. We had nowhere to put our suitcases other than to push them to one side close the room door and put them back in front of the door. The room was so small we felt like we were in a prison cell not the hotel room we had expected. Also the bed was the hardest i have ever slept in or not slept . We returned to the reception desk to ask to be moved to a bigger room as in our opinion the room was only suitable for a single traveller. They agreed the room was indeed very small but could nothing to help us as the hotel was full. We were only too glad we had only booked for one night as there was no was we could have stayed longer. Its a great shame the hotel feels it needs to maximise it's bookings to the extent of upsetting customers so they feel even though the location, breakfast and general decor was very nice they would not dare to return for fear of a repeat performance. We did note that the bathroom set up ie:- toothbrushes etc:- were indeed set for only one person. so i would question why?. I booked our hotel room about 3 months before our travel date so i can only assume it was felt as we were only staying for one night it didn't matter where they put us. Well it should always matter as regular visitors to barcelona we will not be returning to the h10 and i would not recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “BRILL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: pippinraimham
Reviews.Content: Booked with Alpha rooms on the net, about 130 pound oer night over May bank holiday weekend. Been to Barcelona before and this hotel was fab!. Great location, a stone throw from las Ramblas, shops and bars all around hotel. Very modern hotel, good rooms, sleek reception. Glass of champers on arrival. Staff great. Could not fault at all

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: brit_girl_ldn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Octopustravel and got a great deal! This was my first holiday away with my sister without our parents and to celebrate her 21st birthday. The location of the hotel is just 5 mins walk from the drop off point of the bus stop and 5 mins from La Rambla. I might go to barcelona again this year and will definately be looking to book this hotel again. I read previous bad reviews and laughed.... of course a single room will be too small for 2 people- book a double or twin room as I did and enjoy a large comfortable room, with fab bathroom facilities and aircon to use freely during those hot nights! Also, if you want your room to be cleaned or wine glasses changed then just put the sign on the door which clearly asks the maids to clean your room for you- when you get back EVERYTHING will be cleaned! Tip: find the nearest local shops and stock up on water and snacks if you are there during the summer- what my sister and I did was empty the goods from our rooms mini bar every night (leaving them on the desk next to the fridge), put our stuff in there overnight, then brought them along with us the next day! -oh just remember to put all the unused mini bar items back afterwards otherwise you will be charged! Also, feel free to accept the glass of champagne they offer you on your arrival and relax during breakfast- there is a wide selection of yummy hot and cold foods and if you want tea, just request from the waiter and he or she will bring it to you as you seat. So definately just praises from me- a great site to explore barca, great room, friendly staff and memories that will keep you wanting to come back! all this and the beach is just a short metro ride away! :) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Very Accomodating - Recommend”
Reviews.Author: TazHousehold
Reviews.Content: Great Location next to two train stops - Universitat and Placa Catalunya (Plah-sah Cat-a-lawnya). Barcelona is a wonderful, vibrant, and exciting town.
