We were there for a short trip, but we really enjoyed our stay. I would definitely recommend the hotel. We paid about $100/nt. But after looking just today at a couple dates, the rooms seem to be running the $200/nt range. I was just happy to find a decent room that was under $300/nt at the end of December, which was a definite feat.. 2-star hotels in decent areas were averaging $300/nt during that time, but after reading all the reviews for the H10 on TripAdvisor and elsewhere, I felt confident that the room would be great at the $100/nt price as long as we weren't in one of their known very small rooms. I emailed H10 Universitat to confirm that the room was paid for at the wonderful price I found, since I couldn't find that price even close on their website. I also emailed them to request one of the known larger rooms. We were accomodated very nicely. I believe we received one of the largest rooms for their hotel. I believe it was 712. Far enough away from the passing subway underneath the hotel. We received a complimentary glass of Cava upon check-in, and we also had access to the breakfast buffet - which was pretty good. One caveat about the breakfast buffet. On the day of our check-out, they wanted to charge us for the breakfast, but that makes no sense. Your check in time at 3pm doesn't allow you to take advantage of the breakfast buffet so you miss this day, but you expect to have it the day of your departure. After explanation, we did receive the breakfast free - although I didn't eat it because I had lost my appetite. Our room had a nice balcony, and we would leave the door open to hear the sounds of the city. The street is busy below, but we weren't in our room much. The room was very clean, and had the proper storage and amenities. I don't believe we did get the hot tea service to work, but again, it was a short stay, so we didn't request it to be fixed during our stay. The weird thing was the shower/tub had half a glass door so water would splash outside the tub onto the floor. I was prepared for this in previous reviews, and it was definitely manageable with a quick swipe of a dry towel. I just don't get the weird shower "door". Overall, I would recommend the H10 Universitat without hesitation. I don't know what similar hotels are priced during a "normal" season, so I can't compare. I'd say if you can get the room for less than $150, you might be doing good. The ease of access to everything was spectacular. As long as you are up to walking (and I have a bad knee), you can pretty much stay anywhere and enjoy being in that part of town as each part of town has an interesting flair about it. It doesn't take long to get to anywhere in Barcelona either by walking or taking the metro. We definitely want to go to Barcelona again...our earlier layover was in New York, and Barcelona blows New York away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Located, Small”
Reviews.Author: Hakan99
Reviews.Content: I've been H10 Universitat for 4 days ( june 2007).It is a few steps away from Plaza Catalunya so you can get here by bus from the airport and just get off on the last station (Pl. Catalunya) and walk about 200 meters and after check out you can return to the airport easily. Hotel is quite small but very clean and modern furnished. Corridors on the floors are narrow and rooms are quite small. But furniture and equipment in the room and bathroom are modern and new. You have an Lcd and quite a big safe box that I could put my 13'' laptop, easily. Bathroom is also clean but having a sliding glass door. I think it can be a problem for two people. Bathroom is also very convenient for handicapped tourists with having a number of holders in it. Breakfast was good with adequate number of food, also having a dietary table. So, it was a nice vacation at such a centrally located, clean and moderate priced hotel. Thanks to the receptionists having a conversation about football, Barca and Fenerbahce.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Peter&Ann
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in early Feb 08, booked on the H10 website and paid €111 per night B&B. Taking the advice of a previous reviewer, I included a request for a street-facing room on an upper floor - which we got. The hotel is very well located, only about 100m from Plaza Catalunya. Our room was clean, comfortable and reasonably spacious. Everything worked satisfactorily. It’s a busy street and the noise level is high with the window open, but no problem with it closed. Breakfast in the basement dining-room was an excellent buffet selection, with plenty of hot and cold options. Well worth taking as part of a package. We didn’t have lunch or dinner in the hotel. Two free internet terminals in the foyer, adjacent to the bar. The bar is a bit lacking in ambience, and customers, though the bar-man was friendly and the drink was reasonably priced. Some free snacks are available there in the afternoon. Generally, staff were friendly and helpful and most spoke good English. My only “complaint” is the quality of internal sound-proofing. We were there on “Super Tuesday” (the US primaries) and I found myself listening to the CNN coverage, as the guy in the next room had the tv on till 4-5am. Occasional noises from corridors and other rooms could also be clearly heard, but thankfully nothing too sustained and intrusive. But you could be unlucky with your neighbours and that can be very irritating. Overall, an excellent hotel at the price, we’d certainly be happy to stay there again. Eating out: Senyor Parellada, C. de la Argentaria, is worth a visit - nice ambience, good food, not too expensive. The hard to find Café de L’Academia, off C. de Jaume 1, is worth finding. Excellent food. Flamant, on C. d’Enrique Grandos, is a nice place for lunch or dinner, very affordable, nice bistro ambience, ok food.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ReadyToGo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at H10 Universitat and loved it! Even stayed an extra night. If you are not fluent in Spanish -- stay here, the front desk staff is incredibly helpful. The room is clean and modern. The location is great for walking and the Metro. The staff is VERY helpful with anything from directions to restaurant reservations. There is free use of the internet conveniently located in the lobby. Enjoy a coffee or drink from the lobby lounge while watching futbol on the lounge wide screen TV. I loved it here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: fg31
Reviews.Content: Group of us stayed at H10 Universitat for 3 nights for New Year. We couldn't have asked for more! Great value (about £40 per person per night) for a modern, funky hotel in a fantastic location (just off the Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas). Cava and nibbles on arrival. Very friendly and helpful staff on reception who made some good recommendations for restaurants and drinking establishments! Large room with modern decor and a superb shower. We asked for higher level rooms and our request was granted! Breakfast was of a high standard with great variety and perfect runny fried eggs!! The bar was cheap as chips; by far the cheapest rounds of drinks we had in all the bars we visited in Barcelona. Would certainly return to this hotel and would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel if you get the right room!”
Reviews.Author: marie-rhind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Universitat last weekend (1st dec-4th dec) and had requested a high floor overlooking the street. When we arrived our room wasn't ready but it wasn't too big a deal as we were early so had to wait about half hour. Were first offered room 208 but didn't want to be on a low floor so we were offered one on the 7th floor but it was a room at the back (705). The room was okay, beds were a bit uncomfortable and i don't think i could have slept in it for more than 3 nights. The room had the bathroom in the corner with frosted glass door. It was a bit different to what we're used to and don't think i'll be installing frosted glass at home anytime soon!! The breakfast was adequate and you could have a choice of cereals, fruit, juice, toast, cold meats, cheese or the full english. We took advantage of the free internet in the lobby, the free snacks in the afternoons and enjoyed the free cava at reception when we arrived, although i did have to ask for it as it wasn't forthcoming. The best thing about the hotel was the location and for the price we paid (339 Euros for 3 nights including breakfast) it was a really good deal. We didn't have any problems with pickpockets whilst there even though it was our biggest worry about going to Barcelona after all the horror stories we had read. Hubby used a discreet money pouch and didn't carry a wallet. I carried my camera all round the city but didn't take my hand off the bag and was constantly on alert, more so than anywhere in the world i've ever been. Would we stay again? Possibly not, but we will probably visit Barcelona again at some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with the hotel but its not a 4star”
Reviews.Author: M&SSurrey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel after reading some of the reviews on this site. Just before we left I logged onto the .co.uk site and the reviews were awful which meant we left the UK with a feeling of dread! I am pleased to say that there was nothing majorly wrong with the hotel, although it is clearly a budget hotel and not the 4stars it is rated on Expedia. The location is perfect, everything you need is right on your doorstep. The hotel itself was clean and modern, the rooms were a little on the small side but thats only expected in a city. (Tip - email the hotel the day before and ask them for a street facing room on one of the higher floors). The service was the only thing letting the hotel down. On our first night it took nearly half an hour for us to order a bottle of wine!!!!! The maid also failed to replace the glasses we used in our room for the duration of out trip. If you are on a budget and get a good rate for this hotel then I do not think you will be disapointed. If you are looking for something special then I would suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: CatalinaAdriana
Reviews.Content: Hi, I've been to Barcelona twice so far, and both times we've stayed at H10 Universitat. This hotel has a few major pluses: 1. location - very close to Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas (5 min walk) 2. very close to public means of transportation: 3 min walk to 2 metro stops, and 5 min walk to BUS TURISTIC start point in Plaza Catalunya 3. very intimate, cozy atmosphere 4. perfect rooms: designer rooms, very nice bathrooms, some of the rooms (especially those from top floors have also balcony) 5 super breakfast: most varied from Europe I've ever tried 6. not so expensive: between 100-150 eur/night/double room/including breakfast, depending on the month of the year 7. very helpful staff, pending to our every request. Really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Brilliant Location - Lovely People”
Reviews.Author: Alison15
Reviews.Content: What more can I say about this hotel. I booked a room over their own website and joined there club to collect points. I emailed and asked for a high floor as previous guests had advised. We were given room 702 overlooking the front and found it to be very roomy, we had twin beds with a glass door to the bathroom but this was frosted and did not overlook the room. Tea and coffee and complimentary safe incuded and mini bar. Road outside was noisy with window open but fully double glazed and could hardly hear anything when closed. Air conditioning worked well. Staff at hotel spoke really good English and were really helpful when asked questions about area. Upon checkin we were given a glass of cava and a really helpful map of Barcelona. Location of the hotel is just offf the Plaza Cataluna at the top of La Rambla. Excellent location, Excellent hotel and people, would deffinately stay there again. Only advice would be to book well in advance. We paid 278 Euros for 2 nighs in a twin room as I booked a few months in advance. Price on website went up to over 850Euros closer to our departure. Hotel was completely full when we arrived so must be a good hotel. If you have any prefferences of room, email before your departure and they are really helpful in trying to accommodate your requests.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict0101
Reviews.Content: I though this hotel was an excellent choice, I have to comment on some of the other people's reviews, I have traveled to Europe many times and if you want a larger hotel, you will also pay more for it OR you will not get the best quality. Most hotels in Europe are smaller. So I do think the rooms are small but if you are on vacation, the room size should not be that much of a concern as sightseeing and enjoying the vacation should be. I will say it was slightly louder than what I wanted but if that is a problem for some people, when you book the room, you can ask to stay on the inside courtyard, but then, you will not get the view of the street and nightlife. The location was excellent as was the price and I very carefully research my hotel and vacation choices, this was the best for the price/location/space. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't want to pay a fortune but values a good vacation in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: merciless
Reviews.Content: There were five of us in the group and was a bit anxious when we arrived because of some of the reviews on the hotel. The hotel room was excellent - large and spacious with modern theme. Breakfast was excellent - wide variety of items both western and mediterranean. Location was right in the middle of the city - close to Las Ramblas and shopping areas. The hotel staff was very helpful and courteous. Suggest that you eat at Cellar Tapas (5 minutes from hotel) recommended by the hotel and with hotel priviliges you will get a free drink at the restaurant. Best deal is to book a city tour for 19 euro one day or 22 euro for two days and you can get off and on as many times as you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Please dont do this to yourself”
Reviews.Author: citybreak00
Reviews.Content: How can they call themselves a 4 star hotel. The h10 group who own this hotel should be ashamed of themselves. I have read the reviews both good and bad, but please dont waste your money on this hotel. people in previous reviews have mentioned the paper thin walls and noise, the very small rooms etc. This is all so true, you will be subjected to excessive noise at all times of the day and night. The rooms are dirty and not cleaned properly. The management are never seen and this shows in the way staff conduct themselves, they are mostly polite but it is plain to see they have no direction from a management team in conducting their jobs properly and this can be seen from front desk to the kitchens to cleaning of the rooms. At breakfast one morning the poor chap sitting on the opposite table had a tablespoon of crushed glass in his his breakfast cereal the staff really could not of cared less. This hotel is truly appalling, please do not pay good money and subject yourself or your loved ones to such a shameful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great looks, bad quality/plumbing/paper-thin walls”
Reviews.Author: travelbluey
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great and has the feel of a 4 star when you enter the lobby. Clean and modern looking.....but the good stuff ends here. We had a myriad of plumbing issues in our room, the shower was leaking like crazy, took them 2 days to fix. The toilet would stop filling.....took them 1 day to fix. On the 3rd day the bathroom roof started leaking....not sure if this was a one off, but it seemed to us like the hotel was only a 3 start quality not 4. Also, way too expensive for the value. The walls were very very thin.....and we are sound sleepers, but u could hear each time any rooms opened, etc, and the train which is not too close shook the whole place when it passed by. Overall, the stay was okay, we just expected a lot more for the money we paid. The breakfast in the basement was alright, but the service was very prude.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - only if you book the right room!”
Reviews.Author: BornwithPassport
Reviews.Content: Most TA reviews raved about location - so I won't go into detail -- but say that location was the primary driver for my selection of this hotel. It also has solid service. I was able to check in early. Got the exact room requested. Staff extremely helpful. Received a nice welcome note & fruit plate in the room. Free internet access and printing. Complimentry snacks in the lobby late in the day. This hotel isn't special or memorable, but is spotlessly clean, conveniently located, solid service, and is excellent value for a hotel in Europe ONLY IF YOU BOOK THE RIGHT ROOM. 1) Request to be on floor 5 or above and request a room ending with 01, 02, 11 or 12. These are large and front facing, and have mini balconies. These are the best rooms. 2) Hotel has 8 floors. 8 floor has 2 junior suites. I was in 711. The room is front facing outlooking a major street - didn't hear any noise from the traffic or from other guests and I am an extremely light sleeper. 3) Do NOT stay in room numbers ending in the following: 05, 06, 07, 08. I peered in one, and it is extremely small looking out to a shaft. Please see my map photos for reference (the inner rooms). If I got stuck in one of these hole in the walls, I would of rated this hotel a one star. 4) Room 512 is the room they have advertised on the website Other critical tips: 5) Book directly via the website H10 and save money. H10 is a chain. Select the Universitat location. A few days before your travel, double check the rate per night online. I did and was able to save 40 Euros per night as the price dropped. So, I just cancelled my first reservation and rebooked at the lower rate. Note you are able to cancel 24 hours online vs. if you call the hotel directly it requires 48 hours. Specify room and floor preference in the notes section. 6) Book with the breakfast option. Great variety, great value, and delicious! The pot of coffee each morning was a great start. 7) Take the airport bus to the hotel and get dropped off at Universitat street. You will then need to walk about 1 block to the hotel. Take the airport bus back to the airport from Placa Cataluyna. Everyone takes it. It's convenient (comes every 10 minutes) and cheap (under 4 Euros per person). Note: If you are looking for a hotel with a pool or bar scene or spa atmosphere this is not the place for you. It's a great hotel for the practical tourist traveler or business traveler. Other hotels I considered: Jazz Hotel (stones throw from H10 and cheaper w/solid TA reviews), Hotel Arts (Ritz but located in no mans land by the beach/Olympic area) and Barclays Oriental (read in different guide books it was a special place). I only had 7 days advance notice to plan my trip, and H10 Universitat was available thankfully. I am very happy I ended up here thanks to the TA reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Total NIGHTMARE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rockon
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about H10 Universitat is the location, very close to the center of Barcelona and, maybe the A/C, abolutely noiseless. I spend 5 nights in this hotel and I founded it absoluted horror. Next to the hotel is a building under construction and from 8 AM till 5 PM you can hear workers knocking with hammers on the walls or making holes with their drilling machines. Wanna take a nap in the afternoon? No way! First night my wife and I stayed in a room (507) facing the interior court. It was the smallest room I ever seen. Practicaly, if the bed was a little bit closer you couldn't open the room's door. The sink was directly in the room, separeted from the shower and toillet. There is no tub. All the windows could be oppened only from down to up, not in the normal way. The closet was absolutely useless, beeing very, very small. The receptionist told us that is a bigger, quiet room. We try to sleep with all the windows open but fom the outside came a enoyng noise from the A/C and a powrfull smell of garlic, I don't know where from. The walls of the room are probably made of paper, I could hear very well a man next to our room snoring, and all the conversation from the lobby. Next day we changed the room with an other one facing the main street (511). It was a little bigger and has the sink, the tollet and the shower (with tub) completly separted from the room. Same problems with the closet, the walls and everything else. There's a little bit street noise in the night so you can sleep quite well. I read that many people enjoy breakfast, but is far from fantastic. Two years ago we spend two nights in a 2 star hotel in Madrid, and there's no diffrence regarding breakfast. Is a quite normal one. The only bad thing is that you have to stay in line untill a waitter came to you and ask you the room number and then he or she show you the table where to stay. The restaurant is divided in two rooms: one is the waitting room and the other is dining room. The funny thing is that the waitting room is almost bigger than the other so is a little bit stupid to put people on wait. Anyway, I definetly NOT recomanded this hotel to anybody, especialy for the money you have to pay per night.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: GArmianov
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience we have had in any hotel. The room is really ridiculously small. There is barely room for the queen bed and night-stands. No room for the luggage. Fortunately, ours were small and we managed to show them under the bed. Although with modern design, the room looked worn off. Haven't been given a lift off for some time. That however turned to be the least of the problems. The maid service was mediocre. All they did was to make the bed. didn't touch even the towels in the washroom, not to mention cleaning up. The works experience however came during the last night we stayed there. Suddenly the cold water stopped and only a boiling hot water was running. Even the flush was using hot water. We couldn't shower and the toilet felt as if it is going to explode. A call to the reception got me just one unconvincing "I am sorry, I will send somebody up sometime in the morning". Well, we had no choice but to use more eau the toilet and keep packing. Then, at 5am we got our wake-up call and information that our taxi for the airport is already waiting downstairs with running meter. When we called the elevator, nothing happened. Turns out, the elevator was broken and nobody cared to inform us or to come up to the eight floor to help with the luggage. We had to drag it all the way down by ourselves and when we got in the taxi, the meter was showing already 10 Euro while the standard fare to the Airport is about 25 Euro. My complains at the reception were answered with the same bored and uninterested "I am sorry" and I was told that this is the service I should be expecting in a normal hotel. I would never return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: chariot
Reviews.Content: Background -I stayed here with my husband for 2 nights for a 30th birthday trip with 2 friends. We booked with ebookers.co.uk for 2 double rooms. We had a great stay here, nothing to complain about and loved the hotel - we will definitely stay here again the next time we go to Barcelona. Points to note: The price for this 4 star hotel was cheaper than staying at the 3 star H10 Cataluyna Plaza and is literally 1 minute walk away - you can see the Cataluyna Plaza from the hotel. We stayed in rooms 105 and 108 which were a good size and on the first floor at the back of the hotel. They were clean and well furnished. We also had french doors which led to a terrace with a separate area for our room (bistro table and chairs) and also loungers for all four rooms leading out to the terrace. You could hear/feel the rumble from the metro but it was very faint and didn't wake us up. There was a free safe in the room with a key code lock - very convenient. We had cava on arrival, there is free internet in the lobby and snacks near the bar. The drinks in the bar are reasonable prices too. The staff on reception spoke good english were very helpful - even getting us an iron and ironing board straight away when we needed one. We were able to leave our bags after checking out in a locked room. Tips: If flying to BCN, get the A1 Aerobus for 3.90 euros - takes you straight to Cataluyna Plaza Try the Milano Cocktail bar, a few doors down from the hotel - great cocktails made properly in a great setting For an absolutely amazing Thai meal, try Matsuri in the Gothic Quarter (Barri Gotic) - very reasonable prices and out of this world food.

Reviews.Title: “The real truth about the H10 Universitat”
Reviews.Author: TravelogueGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Just back from an excellent four night weekend break in Barcelona. We booked last minute, we were not quite sure where to go, but we were determined to get a chance of some sun after a poor summer in Glasgow. It was the only weekend my wife and myself have off together until November. Booked the flights through Flyglobespan on the Tuesday morning. Not cheap but not too bad at £320 return for two. My wife works with Thomson and we were looking at booking the accommodation through them and using her yearly voucher. We found that good hotels in good locations were hard to come by and prices were on the high side, my brother and sister in law had visited Barcelona two weeks earlier at half the price for flights and accommodation. We decided on the H10 Universitat on location, cost and because we had stayed in the H10 in Tenerife, Costa Adeje earlier in the year. I quickly checked trip advisor for ratings, with mostly 4 and 5's I didn't bother reading through the reviews. We checked prices through Thomson web page, for my wife to use her voucher she has to phone Thomson Hotels. The online price was around £440, phone price £760. (room only) I therefore decided to book online. There was an option to take breakfast, they wanted £80. I thought I'll check the price on the H10 website, room price was the same but for breakfast they only wanted 40 Euros for the four nights for the two of us. So we booked direct with H10, 670 Euros for four nights including breakfast. Flights went well. We decided to take the A1 bus from outside of Terminal A direct into Placa de La Universitat. The hotel is only a 5 min walk from here. (You could stay onto Placa Catalunya, six and half a dozen) Check in was excellent, they had our reservation in hand and we were given room 310. After a complimentary glass of Cava it was off to the room. Did I say room? Sorry I meant cupboard. There was barely enough space to get round the bed and no where to store our cases other than in the reasonably large shower room. So it was straight back down the stairs to reception. They didn't look too surprised to see us. Unfortunately being a very busy weekend we were told they had nothing else available for that day but would move us the next day. We were just to leave our bags in our cupboard and they would move when we were out and about. So we decide to stay and headed back up to our cupboard. To be honest it was a four star cupboard with all the fixtures and fittings you'd expect, We even had free Wifi. The shower/toilet is separated from the room with a smoked glass wall/sliding door. Shower was excellent and a very good size considering the size of our "room". Room was a wee bit noisy, close to lift and exacerbated due to the slight gap in the door, not big enough to see through though We were indeed moved as promised. We were given room 707. This is at the back of the building. Room size was good and again with all the usual 4 star bits and pieces and free wifi. Bed was massive and comfy. Both rooms were very clean and tidy. 707 could do with a new floor but overall we were happy. Breakfast was excellent value. They did have sausage bacon and egg available but not quite up to UK standards. Eggs were always cold. However this is the norm in European hotels, the selection of cheese, cold meats, fruit and pastries easily made up for the failings in their cooked breakfast. They also leave out water and snacks through out the day. The location of the hotel is excellent just along from Placa Catalunya and the Ramblas. City bus tours leave from Place Catalunya, I suggest you take the two day ticket. On returning to the airport we took the Airport bus ( A1) from Placa Catalunya. The H10 Universitat would easily get a 5 rating if it wasn't for the small internal rooms. My wife, who is an agent for Thomson, would not risk putting clients into this hotel unless they were given assurances that they would not be put in an internal room. H10 should place single beds in all the internal rooms and charge a fare rate. If the Hotel is reasonably full there is a good chance you will end up in the “shoe box” rooms. They have 12 rooms on each floor, except the top floor where they have suites. 4 rooms to the front, 4 in the middle (shoe boxes) and four to the back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; somewhat noisy”
Reviews.Author: rgs408
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here one night pre-cruise and two nights post-cruise. Overall, the hotel was wonderful. Staff was friendly and always willing to speak English. We requested a larger room on a high floor and were given one both times (5th floor and then 6th floor). Location is terrific, ideal for exploring Barcelona. My only complaint was the noise. You could hear the metro running, but worse than that was the noise from other rooms. One night a very loud (seemingly very drunk) couple came in the room next to ours and proceeded to have lively conversations for well over an hour. About half an hour into it, we called reception (around 11pm) but nothing was ever done about the problem. Also, a minor mishap on another night occurred when the hotel assigned the same room to another couple (luckily we had used the deadbolt so they were unable to get in). Again, overall experience was good; just a couple complaints. If you're able to go to sleep (and stay asleep) very easily, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JimmyandHeather
Reviews.Content: We flew into Girona on Ryanair and got a bus into Barcelona which cost about 20 Euro return and the journey lasted an hour. We then took a cab from the central bus station to the hotel which cost about 12 euro. The H10 Universitat is a nice hotel and when we booked it was considerably cheaper than the H10 Catalunya which can charge more because it’s in Catalunya Plaza but if the truth be known they are about a minutes walk apart. From the front door of the H10 Universitat to the top of La Rambla is no more than a five minute walk and so the location is excellent. The staff are friendly and we requested a quiet room and got one around the back and so we had no real view but we could not hear any noise at all from the busy street at the front. The rooms are small for a 4 star but they are well equipped but not too well sound proofed as we found on our third night when a German couple had a drunken domestic at 4 in the morning (sounded like she was right!!!) and we could not tell if the racket was coming from next door, above us or below us. But other than that 10 minute interlude we heard nothing from our neighbours. Breakfast was good and we never had to queue. Barcelona is a great city but be prepared to do everything about two hours later than you normally would at home. It’s a bit pricey for pavement café eating and drinking (which Euro city isn’t ??) but the best paella and sangria deals etc can be found at lunchtime rather than in the evening when popular places can become very busy. The Nou Camp is a must as is the Sagrada Familia. The panoramic city views from either the Castle at Montjuic or The Church at Tibidabo are also well worthwhile. Art lovers might venture to the over rated Picasso Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great H10 Universitat Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBegg
Reviews.Content: The flight: We flew with flyglobespan and the flight was flawless. The hotel was gorgeous and was so clean. Check in was easy and we even got welcome cava. The room: Was spacious, clean and had a lovely wee balcony. The Food: We didn’t eat in the restaurant, but the breakfasts were fantastic. Location: The hotel is so central and easy walking distance to everything. Yet the surroundings are fairly quite. Will definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near La Ramblas and other attractions...”
Reviews.Author: MAD&Dib
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2007 with my wife. We found it very well located near La Ramblas where we walked and toured the many shops at night after diner. From the airport we took a bus that dropped us at walking distance (3-4 minutes) from the hotel. We also took a 2 day city bus tour (hop on, hop off) and found it well worth the money we paid to get on/off the tour bus. We visited many of the tourist sites and found the city to be quite amazing. Have the gelato, have the tapas even though you may not know what your eating! Try the different wine they are quite tasty. Do mix in with the locals at the tapas bar. We met interesting people from Spain and from around the world. The weather was around 15 celcius and quite cold especially when riding the open air bus (bring a sweather). The room at the hotel was very small and clean with a balcony facing the main street. Decor is quite modern. Our room (top floor) was quiet even if it was facing the main road. Our booking included breakfast which was good. Nothing to write home about. Free internet in the loby. Excellent hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: hulasticks
Reviews.Content: We found the H10 Universitat to be a clean pleasant hotel in a fantastic location. The Rambles and Placa Catalunya, along with the Bus Turistic (a must to appreciate all the sites of Barcelona) are all less than 5 mins away. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and allowed us to store our luggage on the final day, whilst we were out. Our room was on the sixth floor and was really small, but it was perfect for a couple who only used it to wash and sleep. The bathroom was large in comparison to the room and had a fabulous power shower. A point here is that the bedroom and bathroom are separated by a frosted glass wall so all the sounds of the bathroom can be heard in the bedroom. You need to be comfortable with your partner!!! We only had breakfast once and although there was a great deal of choice it was very expensive (37 Euros for 2 people). I would recommend going out for breakfast, there are plenty of cafes around. Overall the hotel was excellent, pleasant staff, clean and welcoming lobby/bar area and I can't help but mention the fabulous location again.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel,Best hotel stuff,best food,best location”
Reviews.Author: moty
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in this hotel. great food,very nice rooms we had the street front on the 6th floor. the hotel has a deal with a car parking near by. Location is near th the main attractions of barcelona. Catalunya circle,universitat circle,Gaudy's houses and more. we asked for 2 rooms with a connecting door on a high floor and front to the street. we have got as we asked. modern decorating big rooms,excellent beds, fully equipped bathrooms. Barcelona is a great place to visit and H10 hotel universitat is a great place to stay! we will come again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: magpie21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the H10 Universitat for 5 days during the end of july 2007. After much exploring ,this hotel appeared to have the least adverse remarks. Comments were made about various rooms and sizes. I booked through Hotelopia , I asked for a large outside room with bath and shower on floor 4 or above and received a very good deal. On arrival we were greeted with a glass of Cavas and a delightful attitude.Apologies were made that the floor requested was not available but we were allocated an excellent large room with bath and shower on floor 2. The general standard of the hotel is first class, the bedroom was of the highest standard (comments regarding the glass doors to bathroom and lack of privacy are unfounded) the bathroom does have a glass door but is totally opaque. The breakfast gives the most expansive choice I have ever seen in any hotel. Coming back on an afternoon there is a selection of tit-bits to eat available in the bar together with water and hot drinks. The position of the hotel is excellent and is just 500 metres from Las Ranbles which means there is no problems with noise. Overall this is the best value for money hotel I have stayed in. The decor is fresh and modern, the staff are efficient but cheerful, the rooms first class with a daily change of linen and the breakfast is out of this world and includes a full grill if this is your fancy. This hotel must be the gem of Barcelona. Just a little tip, the taxi fare from the hotel is more than 30 euro, the airport bus is 3.75. This hotel is 500 metres from Place Catalunya, the terminus for the bus. We paid for a taxi (33 euro) which includes a airport surcharge. My advice is take the bus, (we did on return and it only takes 20 mins from Catalunya Place) and if you have difficulty finding your hotel, then take a taxi from Catalunya place. But take my advice ,use the the H10 Universitat and enjoy a wonderful city from a gem of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: bav92
Reviews.Content: me amd my wife stayed in barca from 16th to 20th of july. the hotel was suberb. we stayed in room 512 and it was a good choice. the breakfast was very good but the best of this hotel is its position in the centre of the city. the reception was really really good and in general the next time we will be in barca we will stay in this hotel again without hesitation. the town is wonderful but a little bit expensive and the picasso museum is a disappointment DONT GO. the magic fountain in montjuic is really very very good

Reviews.Title: “Still great value”
Reviews.Author: traveltortoise
Reviews.Content: Return visit still found the staff as helpful as ever, love this hotel and have been back many times. never had an issue with room size. Only slight dissapointment was the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed with Barcelona...”
Reviews.Author: clouisep
Reviews.Content: Where to begin??....we had some issues with H10 Universitat, not necessarily the fault of the hotel staff, but things were not as we expected. Having a rental car we approached the hotel on the street and found there to be nowhere to park our car and unload our luggage, except for the very busy Taxi/Bus lane. After a record unload time of 1 minute, my husband drove around looking for a parking garage while I checked in. Luckily, there was a garage relatively close, but not associated with the hotel. The hotel accomodated my request of being on the 4th floor or higher, as I have read on Trip Advisor. We were given room 608 which was a middle room - where the window look into some type of elevator shaft-ish opening. We were not offered any cava or snacks like the previous reviewers upon check in. The room was so small, we had to keep one of our suitcases in the bathroom and the other in the bedroom. The closet was really of no use as it was so tiny. We wondered why the bathroom was so humongous at the expense of the living area where they jammed in a king size bed. The bed pillow spanned the entire width of the bed, and there was only one...this I named the "siamese pillow" as we both tried to get the proper placement for sleeping. That was something I'd never experienced. The mattress was also quite hard. The water pressure in the shower was excellent (we did not have a tub) and as the other reviewers stated, the bathroom was "in the room" separated by a wall of frosted glass. The A/C was lacking power and one of the vents had some very disturbing looking black mold/soot/etc....that made you wonder if it was toxic. The one highlight was the wonderful breakfast buffet that was included in our room rate. One of the best buffets we have ever seen - and everything very tasty. Service was excellent as well. Also, the free internet access in the business center was most appreciated. We chose H10 Universitat for it's close proximity to Las Ramblas, which is definitely true, and also to the Metro at Plaza Catalunya. Compared to our experiences at other Spain hotels, this one just didn't measure up.

Reviews.Title: “Great - once again!”
Reviews.Author: L8H
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at this hotel and had no hesitation in going back there. I love the little attention to detail at this property, like the glass of Cava and nibles offered to you after checking in, the free internet access and the complimentry snacks and water laid on all afternoon. We stayed in a larger room this time at the front of the property on the 5th floor. Noise was not an issue. It seems the hotel has two normal room types, 1 with a bathroom partially in the room with a glass wall seperating it, which I think is quite quirky, and the traditional style with a seperate bathroom area. We have now stayed in both and both are decent enough sizes for two adults, the latter being the slightly larger. Staff were very helpful, always smiling and always greeting you with "ola" as you work into the hotel. My wife is returning in 4 weeks with some friends and has booked a junior suite for the three of them which was really good value, all reserved by the helpful reception staff. Good value, good location, you wont go far wrong wth this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Proved to be very nice; AFTER we changed rooms”
Reviews.Author: W.R.F.
Reviews.Content: I reserved our room through Venere, and I think that was probably our mistake. I'm never going to use Venere again. Although I received a good price (I think), when we checked in at midnight after a long flight and metro ride, we were shocked at how bad our room was. It was extremely small, which wouldn't have bothered us so much, but it was very depressing and poorly designed. It was an inside room overlooking a light well, and the window opened in over the bed so it would bang your head. The room smelled funny (like turpentine or paint), and the bathroom was in the room, separated by frosted glass. The pergo floor was peeling off, and the furniture was banged up and the bedspread stained. We were depressed. The room certainly wasn't worth $125 euros, and this wasn't where we wanted to spend the night, let alone the next four nights. We asked to change rooms, and were told there was nothing available that night. We went out and walked around the vicinity looking for another hotel. Everything was booked up. The next morning I went downstairs and told them we were unhappy with our room, and the desk girl said she would change us to a double room (2 beds) at noon. She seemed used to the problem. The new room was an outside room, although not looking out at anything, and was kind of dark-but what a difference. It was twice the size of the other room, and much more normal. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. The free internet was great. The complimentary drinks and snacks every evening were very nice also. When you book with Venere I found out that breakfast is not included with the price. Otherwise it was $20, which we weren't willing to pay. If we had booked with the hotel it would have been included. Lots of people seemed to be enjoying it. I think we also could have specified a nicer room if we had contacted the hotel directly. With Venere, you get the "standard" room, which is their worst room. When looking at the map of the hotel, it looks like they have 4 inside standard (really substandard) rooms on every floor (8 floors). So be careful and get an outside room. The hotel is in a great location, close to the center of action.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: FarrellMLT
Reviews.Content: This is truly a fantastic hotel. We flew to Barcelona El prat airport and the AIRBUS (costs a couple of euros) took us directly near the hotel. It is perfectly located ... literally a few steps away from the Pl Catalunya and the Ramblas region. The room was large, well-decorated, clean and equipped with all sort of traveller "gadgets" - a shaving kit, toothbrush, comb, perfume etc. Breakfast was a lavish buffet - very good. Staff were friendly and helpful. Considering its location, excellent service and its very reasonable room rates, we really recommend this hotel to anybody travelling to Barcelona. Tom and Maria Farrell MALTA

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price, and overall hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLuv2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H10 Universtat in late April 2007 for 2 nights pre-cruise. After reading the reviews I found myself mixed on the hotel and unsure if I made the right decision. Now that we have been there I wanted to give back and let you know this is a great overall hotel. We had room 512 on the front of the building and our friends had room 712. These particular rooms were fine in size, typical eurpoean rooms but not tiny and uncomfortable as described in other posts. The rooms were newer and clean. The bathrooms were a very nice size. The breakfast was also good and gave a good start for the day. Despite being on the street side of the building we did not have any issues with traffic noise and I am a light sleeper. The balcony doors were well insulated which I think helped. The location is great, close to everything but just far enough to avoid the craziness. We felt perfectly safe roaming around at night going to dinner. Overall this was an excellant hotel for the price. It is the perfect balance of everything and a great spot to call home base. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: lilbeast
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my Mum on a short city break. Never having visited Barcelona before I was unsure as to where to stay and as a result sought the advice of Tripadvisor. The hotel was very easy to find (we got the airport bus to Place de Catalunya) and in an extremely convenient location for all the attractions. The hotel staff were excellent as was the room which was very modern and extremely clean. It was also excellent when our flight was cancelled by easyJet that we were able to come back to the same room. However this time we had the Breakfast which I think was the best I have ever had in a hotel. Overall an outstanding hotel in a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Las Rumbles in the night”
Reviews.Author: Ithacles
Reviews.Content: Easter long weekend, 2007. Hotel staff were great, room was clean and modern however... I travelled with my companion so in terms of the bed was expecting a double (having paid for one), but found that it was merely two singles pushed together. It wasn't that bad, but noticeable. The room we got on the first floor hosted periodic rumblings from the subway beneath - to be heard both during the day (or mid-mornings as we arose to new days) and until the last trains at night. I only mention the point during the day as in most cases, you might already be out sight-seeing, but during the early mornings, you would hear the first trains. I think that if you also notice this during day time with ambient noise, then it is loud enough to pose a problem at quieter times. Finally, the walls were also quite thin and we were blessed with a snorer on holiday in the next room. So for a few nights as we'd be settling in to bed, those darn rumbles then assaulted us from both beneath the floor and through the wall nearest to our heads. I managed to get a good deal on the price by shopping around. Had full price been paid, there would have been tears. Okay, but some problems.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and location”
Reviews.Author: joyful_sun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in H10 Universitat over the weekend and really liked our stay. I initially booked the hotel through a booking website but decided to contact them directly, and in by doing so, I got a better rate inclusive of breakfast for 2 persons at 140E per night. Initially, the booking websites were quoting 160E per night without breakfast, so it's best to contact them directly first. I also requested for a nice large room with view on the upper floors, and when we got there, they were able to grant our request and gave us room 701 - a nice big room (twin beds together but not a problem) with a nice terrace facing Ronda Universitat and minimal traffic noise because it was high above the street (8th floor was the highest). I guess we were quite lucky that this room was available because some rooms are indeed just half the size of this room with no terrace at all. Our room was pleasingly comfortable and clean. Wide assortment of bathroom amenities, and shower stall was spacious. A huge buffet breakfast is served at the basement with a nice assortment of warm food (bacon, sausages, eggs etc), cold cuts, cheeses, fruits, cereals, yogurts, pastries, breads, and juices. They do serve brewed coffee or tea in a pot, but do ask for their cappucino instead. I live in Italy and I must say, they serve really great cappucinos! Location wise, this hotel is great. It is right off Plaza Catalunya, in the heart of the city so everything is close by. The street it is on is a major street so it is safe and not seedy. You can easily walk to Las Ramblas, P de Gracia or Rambla Catalunya, take your pick. Restaurants, cafes, shopping, transport are all close by. When you check out, you can leave your bags with them until you depart for the airport. Good thing is they have a locked left luggage room and they issue tags. Some hotels don't issue tags and some just leave the bags in the lobby where people can just walk off with it. Above all, I think what will make me come back to this hotel is the service of the staff - from reception, to the breakfast staff, to the cleaning staff. Everyone was smiling and ready to help. It seemed they enjoyed working in this hotel and because of that, they were able to give great service. Would recommend and come back as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: jessfess
Reviews.Content: The H10 Universitat is an excellent hotel, right near Place Catalunya and La Ramblas - it is perfect for visitors as you can are right in the middle of town. There are a few metro/train stops very nearby so access is to transport is also good. The rooms in the hotel are very clean, modern, roomy (good sized bed) and comfortable, including the bathroom. We were welcomed with cava when we checked in which was also nice touch. The Universitat is quite good value if you want something a bit nicer and don't mind paying a a little more.

Reviews.Title: “big rooms great but.....”
Reviews.Author: wakeboarders
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in April and had a great stay. I will start with the problem. I emailed the hotel when booking stating I did not want a small room and wanted to be on an upper floor. When we arrived they had my request and apologized for not having the room I requested, but could only get us a small room on the first floor for the first night. As previously stated, these rooms are tiny! There is absolutley no room, I had to put my bag in the bathroom. No mini bar, just a teeny room (but very modern and clean) Also, as stated before, you really have no privacy in the bathroom in these rooms. They sent us a very nice fruit plate that evening for the problem, and moved us the next day to the 6th floor. This room was exellent. King bed was two twins pushed together. Room was modern, very comfortable, mini bar and ironing board, and nice large bathroom off the entrance, so even though the door is glass it was much more private. I do not know why the hotel does not charge a different fee for the two different kinds of rooms because the small room was terrible value, where as the large room was excellent value. We liked the large room so much, we might take the gamble again if we return to Barcelona! Location was perfect for seeing all the sights of Barcelona, just one block off las ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed Universitat”
Reviews.Author: smjak02
Reviews.Content: 7th trip to the city staying in a different hotel of similar standard each time. This was one of the best. Priced around 100e it was one of the cheapest too. Excellent location in this sprawling city, central and near Placa Catalunya and Universitat metro stops. Friendly welcome and room available even though I was there around 11am. Quit room of decent size at the back with 2 singles. Could hear some noise from other guests and being on floor 2 some rumble from underground but neither was enough to wake me up, I am a light sleeper. Room featured safe, decent storage a large shower area and good toiletries. Bed was harder than I like ideally but again didnt stop me sleeping. Room very clean. Staff friendly Didnt make breakfast either day and didn't use the bar which looked modern and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vistor Hotel in Barcelona, Spain”
Reviews.Author: Eugene3
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Barcelona, Spain at the H10 Universitat Hotel, beginning March 14, 2007. Two rooms for four men from Philadelphia, PA, USA. Although, not particularly relevant for this trip, all four of us are "gay." It was my partner and I - not too mature, yet; and two other quite mature friends. Booked with hotel direct and got best price anywhere at 135 Euro with the breakfast. Email communication with the hotel may have gotten us the best rooms in the hotel. Note: TripAdvisor User for many years and very remiss about doing reviews. Must state that I do not think I have ever gone wrong using thier advice. We have traveled quite a bit; over 30 trips to Europe alone in the last 15 years. You need assess your own values and requirements. Also, to better reflect on my comments some particulars: Marriott Platinum and somewhat "Americanized" - not necessarily have to live with the "natives" or community. Stay at Marriotts when price and location are correct. Will spend a bit more, if Marriott location is right like Vienna Marriott and Renaissance Chancery Court London (very or too expensive at times); Marriott Milan, Italy is a good hotel, but not at the center of town, so we stayed at TripAdvisor recommended hotel on the next vist. Location, with price in mind, and the acceptable standards for an Americanized traveler are the foremost attributes. As for location, being in the heart of everything, dispite noise and crowds. When we stayed in Venice at the TripAdvisor Recommended Best Western Monte Carlo Hotel, the key deciding factor was a review that stated, "if you are person that would not like staying in Times Square NYC, like I am, you do not want to stay here." That clinched my decision, and that is where we stayed and it was just great. H10-Universitat was the most perfect location of almost any hotel in Barcelona. It is a block from the Ramblas and Catalunya Square: Aeroport Bus Stop (3.90 Euro) the way to go, the two day on and off Tour Bus ( a must at 23 Euro), restaurants, huge Corte de Englais Department Store, and everything at your beckon call, including two Metro stops within a block. It also sits right on the corner of the renowned "Gayborhood" of Barcelona. Walking distance to most clubs and restaurants. This hotel location is probably better choice and less costly than the Axel, which appears very attractive, for gays who want to actually tour and visit. Good meals for the entire visit at moderate prices, but best two meals were in gay oriented, but open to all, restaurants. In Spain five or six times and best eating ever in Spain. Our hotel rooms adjoined in front and on main street of hotel 611 and 612 (seventh floor). With balcony doors open; it was noisy, but no problem for us, otherwise. It appears there are approximately 12 rooms on each floor. The eight front and rear rooms appear to be the largest , with the four center section rooms being small. The large rooms are a wonderful size for Europe at these prices. Beds were very firm. I prefer this, but maybe just a bit too hard for me. Bathrooms were superb. We always take our own washcloth to Europe, but second day hotel left them. Toletries were partcularly nice. Can't imagine what anyone's complaint would be about the glass opaque bathroom doors. Our companions had that in their adjoining room and it afforded all the privacy and are particularly attractive. Breakfast lavishly supplied, but in the European manner and tastes. We gave a 20 Euro gratuity for the breakfast staff at the end of our stay. A wonderful time in a beautiful city that turned out to be more interesting than ever suspected. I do not think, unless costs become a factor, that we would stay at or recommend any other hotel in Barcelona. We owe most of great choices, including this one to Trip Advisor and I hope this helps you.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: campinheaven
Reviews.Content: Great location and well equipped rooms - however our room was lacking a window which was a bit of a downer - but when asked the staff moved us to a brighter room, no problem. would recommend this to visitors wanting to stay in a delightful hotel in central Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from all standpoints!”
Reviews.Author: Vladislav
Reviews.Content: To put it in a nutshell, excellent place smack in the middle of everything! we requested a quiet room overlooking the back yard. it was quite roomy, big enough for 2 adults and 1 rambunctious toddler. Room servie great. reception always helpful and cheerful. stylish hotel at a VERY affordable price. Unbeatable deal all around!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: glennite
Reviews.Content: Haven't done this before but hope this helps someone who is thinking of staying at this hotel. We have just returned after a 4 night stay. I booked the hotel after searching through and reading all the reviews. I took note and requested a room at the front, on a high floor. However, when we arrived (at 10.30 p.m) we were given the tiniest room with no view on the third floor!! Complained straight away to reception who said that they were full and would change us in the morning. To their credit they did and gave us a room at the front which must have been double the size!! My problem with this hotel is -there are 12 rooms on each floor, 4 at the front, (which can be quite noisy), 4 at the back which seem okay and then 4 tiny rooms in the middle which can only be deemed as single rooms but are used as doubles. Yes, they changed us but at the end of a long journey you don't really need the hassle. The hotel is in a perfect situation and the staff were really friendly and helpful, breakfast was great. If I were to use this hotel again I would ring them directly and check room allocation.

Reviews.Title: “Really terrific with hard beds”
Reviews.Author: egerio
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great experience. We arrived in the late morning and there was a room ready, so the hotel booked us right in. After a redeye flight, that was the start of our excellent experience in the hotel. The booking staff was excellent and very professional. Everyone we spoke to was proficient in English. The room was small, but the bed was king-sized, though a bit hard. The amenities in the room were great, particularly the broadband access. The shower was spectacular with tons of hot water. We got the back of the hotel, so we had no street noise. There was some noise within the hotel. We could hear people in the hall, and muffled sounds of people using a bathroom somewhere, but that was minor. My guess is that the sound was due to the lack of carpets in the halls and in the room. But the flip side of no carpets is that the room was probably cleaner. The maid service was also perfect. My wife and I travel frequently and this was one of the best experiences that we've had in this class hotel. Barcelona, of course is also wonderful, and the location of this hotel brings most of the sites within walking distance. For those who prefer not to walk, the cabs are relatively inexpensive and the T-10 ticket brings the price of an integrated bus/subway ride down to about $1/ ride. BTW, the T-10 is also good for a cheap trip to/from the airport

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Yellowdog442
Reviews.Content: We began planning a trip to Barcelona about 6 months ago and narrowed the field of hotels down using Tripadvisor. We were extremely pleased our 7 days at the H10 Universitat for many of the reasons listed in the reviews we read. Specifically: -- The location cannot be beat. You are steps away from Plaza Catalunya and access to both the Metro and commuter train lines. It gave us quick access to every major venue in Barcelona. -- The ratio of value/money was off the charts. We ended up getting a good deal through an aggregator, but we would have paid even more for the extremely clean room, the friendly staff who helped a couple who don't speak a lick of Catalan, the excellent breakfast we enjoyed as part of our package and the excellent views. -- We took the suggestions of several on the site and asked for a balcony on a high floor. It was an excellent one. Though we stayed on the back of the hotel the first night (note: ideal for people who want to sleep with their windows open but still have quiet), the staff was able to switch us after that. We were on the 5th floor overlooking Ronda Universitat and the views were excellent. For those worried about street noise (something you can't escape, even on a high floor), the balcony doors were thick, double-paned glass with a good seal. When you closed the door, you didn't hear a thing. -- Did I mention the staff? Very gracious. Always polite and quick to wish us hello or goodbye as we left the hotel. They booked dinner for us one evening and drew us maps to get there. -- Our only criticisms are this: 1) The beds were ok, but frankly after the mini-revolution in comfortable beds at hotels here in the states (I mean, even the lower-end chains have great beds now), the extremely firm mattress took a little getting used to. 2) The bathrooms on the front of the hotel have a tub with a handheld shower nozzle that you can take off of its rest and use, but the glass protecting the rest of the bathroom from spray is only half as long as the tub. The result? There was a fair amount of water on the floor. 3) We had wireless access for the laptop but, honestly, it was a little weak. i only learned on the last day that there was an ethernet cable on the bottom of the desk. I would imagine rooms in the center of the floor would have a stronger wireless signal. -- Again, the location. We were able to walk up into Eixample or down into the Gothic district easily. La Rambla is at the bottom of the Plaza. We had a train to Valencia which was easily accesible by Metro to the Sants station on the green line. There are a few close convenience stores which were perfect for a late-night snack. All of the northbound commuter trains terminate at Plaza Catalunya, so there is quick access to them (perfect for getting to Tibidabo). This was a fantastic place to stay. If we return to Barcelona soon, it will be the first place we call.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: MacguyverCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Stunning central hotel. Loved this clean, hospitable hotel. Spacious and modern. Quiet enough to catch a few much needed ZZ's but near enough to Las Rambles so as not to miss any of the Barcelona vibe. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Super!!”
Reviews.Author: F19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at H10 Universitat Hotel for 3 nights in Feb 2007. Upon arrival the desk staff gave us complementary Cava and snacks which was perfect after a day of travelling. The location is really nice for exploring Barcelona. I really felt as if the staff was glad I was there and they were very helpful. Très bien! (OOps sorry I am lost again!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Artemis-Angel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, not far from Las Ramblas, stops for the hop on hop off tourist bus. I had a single room which is not the largest room that I have ever had or however the smallest and was quite adequate. The room was very clean and well decorated, with adequate wardrobing. The bathroom was massive, with a good shower. As mentioned in one of the earlier reviews the door to the bathroom is frosted glass which is obviously no problem if you are single traveller. The room had a minibar with reasonable-ish prices (2,50 Euros for a San Miguel). I had a room on the 5th floor towards the rear of the building which was very quiet. I did not use the restaurant but the menu looked good. The reception staff where friendly and helpful. The air conditioning was good and could be easily switched on and off as required. On Barcelona generally I would recommend the hop on/hop off bus particularly a two day ticket. I would also recommend taking the guided tour at Sagrada Familia, English tour at 11am.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: wonderwoman1972
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a suprise for my boyfriends birthday, I asked for a high floor room with a balcony as it was a special occasion. We got just what we asked for plus.....in the evening a lady delivered bathrobes, slippers, extra toiletries and a birthday cake. A lovely extra. Would definately stay here again. Hotel is so close to all the sights, very comfortable and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewsboyBelfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a short weekend break in Barcelona last May. The hotel is in a great location just a few minutes walk to Las Ramblas. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the roooms were nice and modern if just a little small but ours had a balcony overlooking the main street which was quite nice. The breakfast was fine with plenty of choice. Overall this hotel is great for a weekend break, it is modern and clean and in a good location to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not convinced by the high ratings”
Reviews.Author: libero7
Reviews.Content: I must echo the review of a recent writer who described his room as a 'postage stamp'. I have to agree - the room was minute and reminded me of one of those functional little Japanese pods where businessmen cram themselves for a couple of hours of shut-eye before returning to the office. The facilities in the room were ok - lcd tv, kettle, decent shower but the overall feeling was rather soulless. The room was also freezing and when I tried to turn up the heating cold air was blasted out of the air vents therefore making the room even colder. Climbing on top of my bed I saw that what is presumably the warm air vent was blocked up by a mountain of dirty grey fur which is presumably why nothing came out - nice! The lobby and general hotel appearance and atmosphere is ok but certainly nothing special and by no means deserving of a top ten place on tripadvisor for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kingpete
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in Barcelona. Really can't fault this hotel. Wonderful location,cool decor, warm welcome with chilled cava, room ample size, comfortable, spotless, great bathroom, superb breakfasts, friendly staff who discovered (how?) that it was my wife's birthday on the 2nd day, left a lovely note in the room along with complimentary bathrobes, pamper bags and chocolates. Unreservedly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Space Factor”
Reviews.Author: PC6789
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Barcelona but our first to the Universitat Hotel which caught out attention because of the high ratings on the 'TripAdvisor' website. However, when we opened the door to our room we couldn't believe the incredibly small amount of space. 'Postage stamp size' is the best term. Just room to walk down either side and foot of the bed; minimal storage space; nowhere to sit except on the bed. The shower, toilet, sink area was comparatively large but was separated from the sleeping area only by an opaque glass screen. We asked reception for a change to a larger room but this was not possible as the hotel was fully booked. We discovered that on each floor the majority of rooms are of a perfectly acceptable size but a couple are extremely small and despite the presence of a double bed would be better suited to single travellers. The following morning we checked out and the next three nights of our long weekend visit were spent at the Avenida Palace. Bliss! If you are thinking of staying at the Universitat do check the room size first. Apart from the incredibly small room we did think other aspects of the hotel were fine.

Reviews.Title: “weekend in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaNorwichUK
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 2 minutes walk from airport bus stop. Lovely modern clean facilities, excellent breakfasts. Friendly helpful staff. One word of warning - watch your valuables when outside of the hotel. I had my handbag stolen while in a restaurant which rather spoiled our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bill912
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with a party of 12 (in 6 rooms) 30 Nov to 3 Dec. All the rooms were fine; you are on a main road so there is going to be some traffic noise but none of the rooms were too noisy or too small so you really must be unlucky to get a duff one (or complain too much!) The hotel is ideally located, the rooms we had were big enough, clean, had nice bathrooms and were perfectly adequate for a short stay. OK the TV only had CNN / Sky News as English channels but how sad are you if you spend your time watching TV when you are in Barcelona? We didn't book the breakfast but went around the corner to Vips or one of the other cafes and just ordered whatever we felt like having that day, eating with the locals. We debated staying in the Jazz, which is literally across the road and one block down but decided to save the extra £20/30 per night and spend it on enjoying the town and we are glad we did. However the Jazz did look a really nice hotel. We will stay in the H10 Universitat again next time we visit Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Barca”
Reviews.Author: Smudgerpugs
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on H10 website this was cheaper than other sites. Hotel is in a great location - 5-10 mins walk from Ramblas. 2 metro stations closeby. When you arrive at the airport catch a train/metro into the centre. A travelcard is 5 euros - great value. I booked 6 twin rooms for our party of 12 aged between 22 and 66 (mainly over 40) we went to see Barcelona play at Nou Camp - great experience. We arrived Sat afternoon superb check-in arrangements. We were each given a chilled glass of cava on arrival - a nice touch. Rooms are clean and modern. Bathrooms excellent - superb shower. Breakfasts are also brilliant - everything you could want. Cannot recommend this hotel enough. To top it all it was 22 deg C in late November!

Reviews.Title: “Had great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sol124
Reviews.Content: To summarize: Great hotel and in great location! Me and my wife stayed there for 3 nights. I will try not to repeat what others have written just important points: 1) The suggestion to travel by bus to the hotel was excellent. Eurobus travels from the airport (just outside) to "Plaza de Catalunya" and back every 8-12 minutes (3.5EUR pp). The hotel is situated 3-4 minutes walk from there. 2) Breakfast is excellent. Try if possible to include it in the hotel price (as otherwise it does not come cheap 15EUR pp). Most of the online sites do not include breakfast in their offers. We booked from a travel agent and recieved a better price from all the online ones (expedia, hotels.com etc.) + breakfast. 3) Many people complained about the small rooms. Some however said that the rooms were fine. When we booked our room we specifically asked for the room numbers (literally!!) of the poeple who wrote good things on their rooms size. The hotel of course cannot ensure specific rooms (and it didn't) but at least in our case we got what we wanted. The room (not surprisingly) was large and confertable with a little balkony (Room 512). Looks through the reviews and add other series. Worth trying... 2 little bad points: 1) If you are suffering from noise to large extent, the room we satyed at (and I guess all rooms) have a little (very little) background buzz of the street below (which is a main road with heavy traffic). 2) My wife complained that there are no English speaking TV channels on the TV (beside CNN). Bare in mind of this is important to you....

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmwhite
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, amazing location for exploring the city. However, some rooms very small, so make sure you request a larger room when booking. Large selection of food at breakfast and helpful reception staff. All round a very good hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The truth about H10 Universitat.”
Reviews.Author: KevWARING
Reviews.Content: The truth about this hotel is that it is just fantastic. First things first, if you are flying to Barcelona make sure it is Barcelona Airport and not Girona. If you are traveling to this hotel, dont bother with a taxi as the aero bus right outside the airport terminal takes you to Placa Catalunya right in the heart of the La Rambla!!! The hotel is just 3 minutes walk away, close enough to drag your luggage with you. On arrival, everything went like clockwork. The staff were very friendly and efficient. We were allocated room 607 on the 6th floor. A good size unlike other reviews with a fantastic double power shower and all the other nice things you would expect of a 4 star hotel. Ask for a room at the front or rear of the hotel as these are the bigger ones. There was no noise at all in our room. The breakfast was just fantastic, hot and cold stuff to suit all, see 4 yourself!!! Just what you need before a day taking in the beautiful sights and culture on offer in barcelona!! I would highly recommend this hotel and is certainly one of the best we saw whilst we were in barcelona. WE WILL RETURN!!

Reviews.Title: “TEN OUT OF 10”
Reviews.Author: ASNOWDEN
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had been to Barcelona so I was hoping the hotel would be ok and in the best location. What can I say other than, FAB. Impressions Upon arrival we were given a glass of champers, what a great way to start the city break. The staff were lovely and the hotel was clean. The room was clean and catered for our needs, we were not planning on spending much time in the hotel anyway. The location couldn't have been any better. La Rambla was a two minute walk away and the hotel is placed right where you need to be. We paid 80 pounds a night for my wife and I. This included breakfast. My advice is to include breakfast as it was well worth the extra. Put it this way, there is everything you would want for brekky !!. When choosing this hotel I also considered the Hotel JAZZ which is just a stones throw away from the H10 universat. While there I also had a nose at this hotel and it looked great. Overall I have no complaints what so ever (which is unusual for me !!). I am only 35 but like quality at a reasonable price if you know what i mean. The weekend was great and if you have a nice hotel it makes it even better. The hotel is geared for tourists and doesn't have the facilities like pools gyms etc etc. The hotel is a place to used as a base only and not somewhere to spend your time in Barcelona other than sleep and you know what !!. Would I stay again - DEFINITLEY. One bit of advice. IMPORTANT. We flew to Barcelona landing at Girona airport with Ryan air. I didn't realise that Barcelona is over an hours bus journey from Girona airport. Ryan air only fly to Girona airport and advertise this with (Barcelona) after this. Girona is NOT in Barcelona. This is worth noting. My advice is to fly to Barcelona airport as it will save you loads of time travelling and further expense etc. At least I learned something.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: myrtlemoo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fantastic long weekend in Barcelona - what an amazing city! We had no complaints about the hotel. Friendly and welcoming staff. Fantastic location - just off La Rambla and within minutes of the tourist bus stop. Our room was on the top floor (level 8) at the back and we had no problems with noise at all. Very clean room with everything you need for a short stay. Particularly liked the showers! Breakfast great and is well worth the money. Will definitely return when we next visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay before Cruise”
Reviews.Author: IGDaddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2006, a couple days before our Princess Cruise. The location is excellent: -right at the top of Las Ramblas, -just around the corner from Las Ramblas, so you don't get the noise and foot traffic, -right near the beginning of the tour bus route so you can get a good seat, and a very short taxi ride to the port where the cruise ships leave. We arrived early in the morning from our flight from the US and our room wasn't ready yet. We waited comfortably in the lobby which featured free wireless internet or complimentary use of a PC connected to the web. Once we got to the room, it was was very nice, with modern decor. Not huge, but very comfortable for a "european" hotel room. Free internet in the room. The bathroom was interesting--a totally (frosted) glassed-in room. There is a door to the bathroom, but it doesn't lock. Very modern plumbing with a power shower. Breakfast was included in our room package. It was a very nice buffet/continental-style. Besides a great location, the staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. I had some postcards to mail and asked if I could buy some stamps. They said don't worry about it - we'll mail them for you --and they did! Next time I'm in Barcelona I will stay here again. Wonderful hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Lou78
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and hassle free. We were given a room at the front of the hotel (as rooms are bigger than at the back) and on the 7th floor as requested in advance. The Cava was a nice touch after our Airport Bus ride. The room was above average for a 4star Spainish Hotel and very spacious. Twin beds, bath and shower in separate bathroom. However the road noise was loud even with the doors shut but not to bad if you pack ear plugs. The beds were very, very hard and the air conditioning really poor. It was very warm when we arrived on 30th Oct and complained to reception that the unit in our room was not working properly. We were shown another room but were told the basically the air con was not great and took 10 - 15 min to have an effect in any room.
