I know that air con in general in European Hotels is never that great but this is the worst we have had and to be honest if it did not cool the room down in Oct/Nov over three days I hate to think how hot the rooms get in mid summer! Breakfast was good, fresh fruit and juice really tasty. Everything else was ok. If you ask for a strong coffee the lovely friendly staff bring you a nice americano instead of the weak jug of coffee that is handed out as standard. Location is wonderful. Right by everything you need. Tourist bus routes (great value two day pass), La Rambla, Gothic Quarter etc. If you get a room at the top of the hotel (so metro noise is not so bad), get a room at the front so you are not squashed in, pack earplugs, ask for a room that does not interconnect to another and get a good deal on the hotel website with breakfast then go for it . Barca is an amazing place, we will be back but not to this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “sorry don't get it!”
Reviews.Author: IanRD
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we were really looking forward to staying at this hotel, unfortunately we were disappointed. The double room was so small you couldn't have swung a hamster never mind a cat and the glass doors to the bathroom mean nothing is left up to the imagination. For the money we paid we were expecting a decent four star hotel this is at best a three star. Having stayed at other H10 hotels in Barcelona we did not find this as good as the others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Munster1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. Location was excellent-metres from Airport Bus stop, Tourist Bus stop(Use the one around the corner from hotel Turn right from hotel and cros to the left at traffic lights and NOT the stop in Catalunya Square as the queues are huge here!) It is also near lots of shopping streets and around the corner from La Rambla Reception was very helpful-glass of cava on arrival too! Do include breakfast -great selection of hot and cold with beautiful fruit and champagne if required. Our room was small but contained everything one would need, lots of extras-shoe shine, comb, sewing kit etc. It had a minibar and prices were fine. The bathroom was big with a good shower. We would go back again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Jess1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the H10 universitat and would recomend it to anyone. My sister and I took my Mum for her 60th Birthday and she loved it. Hotel is 5 mins from Airport Bus stop on Place Catelunya. Rooms were very nice, room 402 is a twin or double with Balcony on 4th floor, excellent sound proof balcony doors so slept right through. Welcome Cava on arrival - great. Choccies from Manager for my mum and a little wash bag thingy put in her room for her birthday - not overly flash but she felt special and gesture was appreciated. Even the Porter stopped her on the stairs on morning of her Birthday to wish her a good day. I think things like that make a hotel. Breakfasts were really good - booked direct with the hotel so was only 6euros each. Very good choice from full english to smoked salmon, cheeses, juices and loads of fresh fruit salad and cereal. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful - compared to other Spanish waiters (rude) they were like our best friends!! bathroom good size and power shower great after long day sight seeing. Reccomend to all - family groups, couples etc.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jxl36
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in September after reading the positive reviews on this site, but I have to say I was a little disappointed. The room was incredibly small - we literally had to scramble over the bed to get from one side of the room to the other. There was nowhere to put a bag or case. The bathroom was in the same room but separated by a glass screen - if you are sharing the room with someone else, you need to know them very intimately indeed to want to use the bathroom! As the hotel is contemporary in design the floors are polished - no carpets. Although this looks great it amplifies the noise that the maid makes in the mornings as she's pushing her trolley so be prepared to wake early! On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location, the staff were friendly and the breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Sweet Spot”
Reviews.Author: kataleyfe
Reviews.Content: It's my third night in the H10 Universitat and I couldn't be happier with my choice. I booked online for 4 nights (Thurs-Sun), with breakfast, for a grand total of 540 euros, including tax. Considering the location, it's an insane bargain; just north of the Ramblas, and just south of the Eixample. The bus from the airport (3.5 euros) drops off and picks up two blocks away. It's near major metro stops (Universitat, Catalunya) and on a major street packed with convenient buses. I requested an upper floor and a room without street noise. As ordered, I got an inner room on the 8th (which is the top) floor with no balcony or view but it has been very peaceful for sleeping! Rooms are small, but this is more typical in Europe, and if you are a single traveler or a couple the cozy room will suit you. The bathroom is generous and the shower decadent; breakfast is ample and there are chilled drinks and sweet and salty snacks available in reception. Staff is good with English and they helped me replace a defective 3-day metro pass. There is wireless, which I found somewhat spotty but it's working now as I write this review :-) My room safe is large enough to fit a laptop *and* a full set of 35mm camera gear (a large camera body and two large lenses), a rare and much appreciated hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good value overall”
Reviews.Author: alexa21
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor Member, County Down, Northern Ireland We are just back from 5 days at one of the H10 Hotels in Barcelona. I picked it after reading Trip Advisor and I am pleased with my choice. We had a lovely room at the front however had to move rooms after the first night due to the noise from the traffic, sirens etc. at all hours of the night. The hotel is on one of many busy roads and Barcelona is an all night city! Our room at the back also had high quality fittings and was likewise very clean and tasteful. However it was smaller and ideally we would have liked the larger room. The whole hotel is very clean and modern although it housed in a typical Barcelona terrace. The breakfast buffet is well worth the extra 7 euros. It has absolutley everything from sausage and fried and scrambled eggs to sponge cake! I particularly liked the fresh fruit salad. You can also ask for double espressos and a jug of hot milk. Location very central as we like to walk to shops etc. You can walk up the Passeig de Gracia for posh shops and fabulous buildings or down the way for the Rambla and the atmospheric gothic quarter. Overall a good choice in a lively city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: D1F1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Universitat Hotel late September for the La Merce Festival. This hotel has a great location especially for the Procession as it started right underneath our balcony on the 4th floor. The room was a great size with an enormous bed (room 412) and the marble bathroom more than adequate with that power shower other travellers have mentioned. Although our room was at the front after we closed the balcony doors it was amazing how quiet the room was with only a distant rumbling from the metro. Some of the fittings in the room were a little tired but the location, size of room and most of all the amazing staff more than made up for this. Try and get a deal with the hot buffet breakfast thrown in - its really worth it - fantastic variety and that great service again. They also serve free rolls and pastries in the afternoon (in the bar area) - just right after a days sightseeing when you have come back for that shower and a siesta to set you up for the evening! For great Tapas try La Boqeria Market off La Ramblas - walk right to the back and have your super-fresh sea food cooked right in front of you at La Boqeria tapas bar - wonderful!! If you are there spring to end of September also try the night tour on the open top 'Bus Turistic' - very romantic and Barcelona by night is gorgeous! Will definately be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: IrishDave
Reviews.Content: I normally dont write reports on hotels and maybe I should as I use this site to pick hotels when I travel. My comments on this hotel for what they are worth are, that like everyone says about this hotel, it is in a great location and is indeed a lovely hotel that has everything you need for a pleasent short stay. My only problem I had was with the size of the room, myself and wife have travelled all over Europe in the last few years and the room we were given for our 2 night stay here was the "smallest" room we ever stayed in, we were lucky enough to only have 2 small bags with us and no way could you fit a suitcase if we had one, we even had to get out of each others way going around the bed there was so little space. The bathroom is only a glass petition between bedroom and batroom which I found very odd. As this is one of the more expensive hotels in Barcelona we were disapointed in the room size for a 4 star hotel. I will accept that we may have been unlucky with our room allocation but even after going to reception on 3 occassions to see could we change we were told that there were no other bigger room available. Overall, lovely hotel, great location but rooms are way too small.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: gweaffer
Reviews.Content: september 24-27 -2006 (3 days) Sayed in a room at the front of the hotel in contrast to some reviews saying front rooms were noisy, we had no problem with noise. The room was very clean and beds comfortable. All staff were excellent, approachable and very friendly. Hotel is an ideal location. Had lovely six course meal in the hotel restaurant , very resonable price, a bottle of wine and coffee was included Look forward to returning to barcelona and staying at the lovely Universitat hotel again. Lil and Francis from Liverpool

Reviews.Title: “H10: excellent again”
Reviews.Author: Hero101
Reviews.Content: Stayed in H10 Catalunya in July. That was perfect and H10 Universitat Hotel was even more perfect. After each day visiting all the interesting spots in Barcelona it felt like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: cmh1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. Room is extrememly small, barely can fit 2 person and luggage has to be put on the table. Air conditioning wasn't working and we have to waste an hour waiting for the maintenance guy to fix it. Window open out to the wall, no view and bad ventilation. Bathroom was huge compared to the size of the room. Would have prefer if they extend the size of the room instead. Service is ok, breakfast was too expensive at Eur15p/p so didn't try it. Try to find somewhere else - this hotel is not worth the price you have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Ionsys
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights mon/tues Aug 14-15 Hotel is very clean and has an upscale look to it inside--full breakfast (extra) was excellent--about 16euros/person as I recall Parking is a short block away--about 18Euros as I recall Free internet in lobby--it's a little slow to load web pages Quite safe in our view as so many tourists around---a lot of pickpockets in ramblus i gather but my wife wasn't bothered if we went back to Barcelona we would stay at H10 again In our room on 8th floor there was no shower curtain--and one also had to be careful entering and exiting the shower in the tub don't forget to leave your card in the wall socket inside the room--that runs the lights nice balcony

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-taker
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and it's location. Got a taxi from the airport, €25 each way, between 4 of us. From the moment we arrived, service was great - glass of Cava while checking in, free snacks while having coffee in the bar area each afternoon, etc. There were 4 of us and we had adjoining double/twin rooms. Found the rooms to be spacious enough for a city-break, bathrooms were more than adequate, a free safe in the wardrobe. We had breakfast twice and paid for this on departure but found a great selection of foods on offer. Location-wise, you couldn't fault it - just off the Ramblas, right in the heart of everything. We'd stop every night on our way back for a large baileys at a Tapas Bar just round the corner! Tried a Jazz club which was good (but not really our thing). Used the book provided in the room and found a great Chinese Restaurant for our last night which was a little walk out of the centre. Did a 2-day bus tour which we'd highly recommend (blue and red routes were good) - found it really interesting and helped us get around the city on a short break. On our last day walked down to the beach and had a few hours relaxing there until it got too hot!! All in all, a great City and a great Hotel. We all hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMUPU
Reviews.Content: We stayed on upper floor in thesmallest room we ever had. The view was to the opposite wall. We are club H10 members but it means nothing at all. Hotel location, breakfast, staff and cleaning was ok.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Mr_L_teacherman
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for a week in August-- our first time in Spain. The location was ideal, close to most sites, a five minute walk to the Ramblas & Gothic quarter. The employees were friendly, patient and helpful. The rooms were stylish and clean. The beds were a little stiff, but not uncomfortable. The breakfast was wonderful-- high quality, lots of variety. It was a great value. We would stay here again. Actually, we did: the night before we left Spain. They were overbooked, so they bumped us up to a suite at no extra charge. Nice one.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: samra94
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 7 days while we were passing through Spain. When we arrived, we were greeted with a friendly smile and a glass of yummy cava. The whole hotel is very cool...almost like a boutique. Our room was adorable, modern and CLEAN. It also had a mini-fridge and a safe which made us both happy. The breakfast was delicious and the staff was so helpful and friendly. They did everything possible to make us feel comfortable. The location is within walking distance to everything including the Ramblas. We walked the whole time we were in Barcelona. The only drawback is that they only have one computer in the business center for internet access. If you go late night, it’s normally available. We will be staying here the next time we visit Spain! I just can't say enough good things about our experience here. If you're picky like me you'll love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: 1love2travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the H10 hotel before going on a Mediterranean cruise the next day. The Aerobus shuttle from the airport dropped me off on Las Ramblas and from there, it was just a 5 minute walk to the hotel. The staff were very friendly upon check-in and the room itself was great. Extremely clean with a big bathroom and shower. The size of the room itself was fairly small but it didn't matter so long as I could get my suitcase open on the floor. I had a room on the 3rd floor and it was often quicker to take the stairs than to wait for the elevator. I booked this room for 80 euros and got the breakfast for an additional 5 euros which I highly recommend all directly from the hotel website. The hotel is in a great location and they will even store your luggage if need be. All in all, I had a fantastic stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. I also stayed at the Hotel Colon for a few nights but this one is way better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Steve&Sally
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the H10 and would thoroughly recommend it. I searched carefully for a well-located and priced hotel for Barcelona for a weekend break with my wife, and with the help of other TripAdvisor reviews, chose this one. I have been to Barcelona before, so knew the location was good, and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and spoke English well (which helps, given my poor level of Spanish!) The breakfast buffet was excellent quality with fast and friendly service. I did mention in advance that I wanted a 'quiet' room, and we got just that, although the whole hotel seems pretty much sound-proofed, with the majority of the city noise kept outside. I would very much recommend staying here. Apart from breakfast, we didn't eat in the hotel, so cannot comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NY_Londoners
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our baby daughter for 3 nights. The room was stylish and clean. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The location was great, as central as you can get near the Placa Catalunya, and very convenient for the airport bus. We plan to stay here again when the Sagrada Familia is finished!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Solskinnsbolle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H10 Universitat for 7 days in July. Everything was perfect for us. The staff are friendly and helpful. Very nice with a glass of sparkelig cava when we arrived. Great location. Clean, spacious and very nice room with aircondition. We will stay there again next time. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: miku78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in july. The location of the hotel is excellent and staff were so friendly and helpfull. It was also nice surprise to have a glass of Cava after check in. The room was quite small, but as a solo traveler it was not a problem to me. The only minus was small ants on my room. Well, they didn't bite me, but anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and style, cramped room”
Reviews.Author: DrEthOH
Reviews.Content: Great location near Placa Catalunya and with an Internet café in the same block. Friendly staff and stylish design interior. My single room was a bit cramped, with no seating group as promised in my reservation, but I did at least get a welcome drink of Cava. The bathroom was very generous in size and was covered all over in marble. Well-functioning air conditioning in an otherwise extremely hot city in July. One of the very best breakfast buffets I have ever had, both in quality and assortment. I will sure stay in H10 Universitat the next time I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: SPFlorida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two young teen children recently stayed overnight at the H10 hotel prior to boarding our cruiseship. This is not a luxury hotel, but I was very pleased with the price/value, cleanliness, and location of the property. Front desk personnel were helpful and offered refreshments on check in. We arrived around 2pm and had a short wait for our rooms - we were told this was in order to accomodate our request for adjoining rooms. Our rooms were not overly spacious but fine for our needs - I understand this to be usual for most European properties. As I think some others have commented, the elevator is small as well. Bathrooms were quite nice, and rooms with a rather modern/minimalist style had wood floors. Rooms are air conditioned and were comfortable in the summer heat. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from Placa Catalunya and the upper end of Las Ramblas, making it easy to walk and sightsee in the evening. There are several American chain restaurants nearby (Subway, KFC, etc), a number of small cafes, and a larger cafe with outdoor seating near Las Ramblas which was nice but a little pricey. Of course, there are lots of cafes on Las Ramblas to choose from if you walk a bit farther. The large department store (Le Corte Engles, or similar name) on the far corner of Placa Catalunya has everything, including a grocery store on the lower level. I booked my reservation on the Active Hotels website, and was given a price quote inclusive of all taxes. Cancellations are permitted prior to arrival, and payment is made at the hotel. Everything pertaining to these arrangements went very smoothly, and the price was reasonable for two rooms. The Active hotels website gave very good directions to the hotel from the airport using public transportation, and apparently the Aerobus from the airport stops very close to the hotel, but we elected to take a taxi for the four of us (which I think was around 40 Euros). Taxis are readily available, clean, and seemed reasonably priced. Barcelona was lovely- La Sagrada Familia is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of July. We were greeted on arrival by very pleasant staff and a refreshing glass of Cava! The room was very clean, our only complaint was that the safe did not work, we reported this to reception who looked into the issue quickly but unfortunately could not resolve the problem and no alternative was offered. We booked direct with the hotel over the Internet and the price included breakfast. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice, our only complaint was the lack of fresh coffee, we were brought instant decaffinated when we asked for coffee. As for the location you cant really get much better, 2 minutes walk from Placa Catalunya at the top of Las Ramblas. Would definitely stay here again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llacour
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from an amazing trip to Spain. We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and had a great visit. The room was very nice, the shower was amazing and beds were comfortable. The location is great, right next to everything you'd like but not right on the main strip. We didn't have breakfast there as we decided to walk around the corner to this great cafe and had the best cafe con leche in Spain! We stayed on the 6th floor and had a great balcony facing the street. It was a bit loud in the morning but it was good for us as we needed to get up and enjoy the day. We did feel the subway a little but since we were on the 6th floor, it didn't bother us much. I would recommend staying on one of the higher floors because it may be a bit much on the lower levels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, convenient & friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my sisters. The staff were very friendly, nothing was too much trouble. The rooms (we had 2 next door to each other) were lovely, very comfortable & complete with a safe in each for our valuables. The restaurant was excellent - buffet breakfast with everything you could want. We also dined here twice, the food was so good and so reasonable we couldn't resist coming back. Of course that was partly because the service was so good & the waitress so friendly. We loved our stay here from the champagne welcome drink to the free internet access in the lobby. The hotel is within an easy 3-4 stroll of the top of Las Ramblas & the departure spot for the tourist bus. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona & would look at staying at another H10 hotel on future visits to Spain

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff, Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: JandGWestSussex
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the H10 Universitat for 1 week to celebrate his birthday. The hotel is ideally located near shopping/restaurants/transport links. We had a lovely time and the hotel was a very good choice. We booked online and were very impressed with the room and our arrival drinks. We were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday and much to our surprise, the hotel staff delivered gifts to him- a bath robe, slippers and chocolates! The buffet breakfast was lovely and the staff were very friendly. If I ever go back to Barcelona, I'll definitely stay at the H10 Universitat!

Reviews.Title: “Super stay at the Universitat”
Reviews.Author: Netherland
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a three-day trip to the Hotel Universitat. We did a lot of online research before we booked and we're really glad that we choose this hotel! The location is perfect, a two minute walk from the pl. the catalunya, close to the ramblas, you can walk to the harbour, to the shops, etc. The hotel is very stylish but elegant. Nice lobby, beautiful restaurant. The rooms are pretty big for europe standards and are beautiful decorated. The beds were not awful at all; a little hard but very comfy! The room and bathroom had everything you wish for. The breakfast is great! A lot to choose and everything is really fresh and delicious. Lots of bread (most of them still warm), sweet pastries, fruit (from cinnamon-apples to melon), yoghurt, cereals, salmon, cheeses, etc. I can really recommend it. The people in the hotel are great and very warm. When you arrive, there's champaign and some nuts/chips waiting for you (what a welcome) and in the afternoon you can get some snacks. Everything is perfectly organised. Can't say a bad thing about this hotel, would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RNoon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Barcelona. The H10 Universitat was a great hotel with really friendly staff. When we arrived we were given Champagne which was lovely and each afternoon in the bar you could get complimentary pastries, sandwiches & crisps, which was a really nice touch, they also had free internet access. We went with another couple who's suitcase didn't arrive with their plane and the staff took all the paperwork from them and keps phoning Easyet periodically throughout the day to see what was happening. When it did arrive they left it in their room as we were out for the day. It was also one of our parties birthday the day before we arrived, which we didn't mention to them but they must've noticed from the passports because they delivered a box of chocolates to her just after we arrived. The location is great and very easy to get to and from the Auerobus (which is the best way from the airport), it's literally a 5 minute walk which is very handy when you're lugging your suitcase around. As per other comments you can feel the metro underneath but only as a faint rumble and it certainly didn't disturb me, I didn't notice that the beds were uncomfortable but after a day of walking around Barcelona I would've happily slept in the bath.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - awful bed”
Reviews.Author: Tessar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location and very close to the underground, and so easy to get to. The staff were friendly and we were given champagne on arrival. We were on the 7th floor and the room was very nice. The King size bed turned out to be the worst bed we had ever slept on (or not as was the case). It was like sleeping on the floor it was so hard. We slept really badly the 2 nights we were there, which was a real shame, because apart from the bed, it was a lovely hotel. We're not big on breakfast ourselves, but it was good, and varied.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good service - Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Valueformoney
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Super staff. Best location. Use the public services Blue stripe bus from airport E3.75 pp to Universitat street(3d stop), get off there and ask local for direction only 'stones throw away'. The staff are helpful and very polite. Once there try tourist bus highlights the best areas to determine future plans(very windy on top deck) . Must see Maritime museum and Barri Gotti area where the restaurants are good and not as expensive as Las ramblas. Dress is smart,comfortable and very casual. Lovely atmosphere will return to H10 Universitat. No problem with pickpockets - just be sensible.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: Bluenose44
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the H10 11th to 14th April. What can i say, superb hotel, superb service and food. Rooms are very clean and a good size and as for the shower, what a wake up call, very powerful. We stayed in a room on the 4th floor at the front. Spotlessly clean, cleaned each day. Noise from traffic was minimal, didn't have to use ear plugs at all. As per previous posts you can hear the metro trundling underneath the hotel but this again was minimal. The staff were very helpful right from the speedy check in to the end of our stay. Breakfast was buffet style and was included in my price. It was good value everything you could want in a breakfast. It is also a 5 minute walk from the main hub of the city and La rambla. This is a 4 star hotel bordering on a 5*. I got a good deal when i booked direct with the hotel. If you want luxury and dont want to pay over the odds then it has to be the H10!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a city break in Barcelona, staying at the hotel Universistat. This hotel is within easy walking distance of the aerobus , which transported us very efficiently from Barcelona airport. The staff were polite and gracious, the decor clean , cool and contemporary, and the breakfasts were top class, catering for every possible taste, from the tradional British fry to rice cakes, carrot juice and even soya milk. Full marks to this hotel - keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone, stayed at the H10 Universitat last week-14th to 18th March. Took a taxi from the airport-about 15€. But you can also take a bus which stops at Placa Catalunia, a 3 minute walk from the hotel. We asked for a room on a higher level not to the main street-and got it. The story with the tube is true-you can "feel" that she is running under the hotel, but that`s not worth talking about it. Breakfast costs 15€ per person, sounds much, but it`s really good and huge. You get everything there, so you can have a kind of brunch and don`t need much for lunch... You can have breakfast from 7.30h to 10.30h. The hotel is right in the centre of Barcelona, 5 minutes away from Las rambles, the big and famous street that goes right down to the harbour/beach. We walked a lot, used the tube sometimes, you can get a day card, costs 5€ per person, you can use train, bus and tube as often as you like during that day. The room was good sized, not to big, but ok, very clean, which should be the most important thing... People there are also very friendly, so we absolutelly enjoyed our stay in that nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “10/10 for H10”
Reviews.Author: DR GILL
Reviews.Content: Superb location with easy foot/bus/metro access to everything this fantastic city has to offer. The hotel is on a very busy and noisy junction so make sure your room is high up (there are 8 floors) and not overlooking the street if possible. Our rooms were lovely, contemporarily furnished and decorated, spotlessly clean and each with a modern, large bathroom. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and everybody speaks English. The restaurant lacked atmosphere but the food was really excellent (tho' we didn't have the 15 euro breakfast there, preferring the tiny but cheap and tasty Bagel House just off La Rambla.) Buy a 2-day Tourist bus ticket from the tourist office in Placa de Catalunya 200 metres from the hotel (one day on the northern circuit and one on the southern) and, if you're like us, you'll want to return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Universistat”
Reviews.Author: Die007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just got back from a very enjoyable 3 night stay at this excellent 4 star hotel Feb 2006. Superb position 100yds from the Metro at Placa Catalunya. We had room 212 which was very clean and comfortable also quite large. The bed was huge although maybe a little hard for some. Hotel was very quite and the food for breakfast was excellent with a great choice of hot and cold foods. Most of the main tourist attractions are within working distance, La Rambla for example approx. 200yds away. Plenty of bars, restaurants etc close to hotel. Don't use the train from the airport as you will be put on a shuttle bus which drops you about a mile away from Placa Catalunya and you may not know where you are. This is because they are improving the line and it looks as if it will be like this for some time to come. We booked the hotel on H10's own site which was cheaper than anyone else. GREAT HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Tommac
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in the Universitat. Great location, friendly people, fine room, excellent breakfast, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “first class”
Reviews.Author: paulreith
Reviews.Content: went to the hotel universitat on 29/01/06 with my wife for 2 days for my birthday. This hotel is first class for service, cleanliness and friendliness of staff. Glass of bubbly on arrival and when the staff found out it was my birthday, they had chocolates sent to our room. Taxi from airport is 25 euros and the price of drinks etc is much the same as home. Iwould have no hesitation reccomending this hotel to all, and would definitely stay here the next time we visit Barcelona. If anyone would like more info, you can e email me p.reith@ntlworld.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: seleus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days over Xmas 2005. Couldn't fault the hotel, great room, great breakfast (champagne on Xmas morning) staff very friendly and helpful. We didn't mind it being at the top of Las Ramblas and enjoyed walking up and down there. Went to the Attic resturant for a meal, what a mistake!! Overpriced, plates removed as soon as you had finished, not much atmosphere. Wouldn't recommend it, much better places to eat and cheaper. Loved Barcelona, plenty to see and do, in fact going back in May to cover what we missed first time round. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff and a very powerful shower!!!”
Reviews.Author: d00bht
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the end of January for a weekend. I booked direct with the hotel which amazingly worked out cheaper than expedia, last minute etc! I did request a double room but when we arrived they showed us to a huge twin room - we went down and were very quickly moved to a double room which wasn't exactly huge but was well equipped and had a gorgeous bathroom with an incredibly powerful shower (I could have stayed there all day!). We had no problems with noise and loved the welcome cava. Breakfast is huge and very good, the staff are friendly and helpful and the hotels location is superb! I would definately recommend this hotel and will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Special_Kay
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from spending 3 nights at the H10 Universitat, and we have no complaints at all about this hotel. I requested a non-smoking room on a high floor and the hotel did as I asked, the room was a good size for the two of us and we did not experience any noise whatsoever, perhaps because our room was not facing the main street. The staff were pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. The hotel was only a couple of minutes walk from Placa Catalunya after we got off the aerobus, and we were welcomed with a glass of cava which was much appreciated! On the second night we ate in the hotel and the meal was fabulous, I would definitely recommend eating there. Overall, the H10 is a great hotel in the centre of Barcelona, and my boyfriend and I are already considering a return trip for our 21st birthdays in September.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - just be pushy about your rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: UnitedGirlLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked this place on the basis of tripadvisor reviews and was not disapppointed - just returned from 3 nights in Jan 06 - myself and baby (they provided cot) plus my parents - 2 rooms - all room requests were met - we had interconnecting rooms on 6th floor both good size and altho they were not soundproof - as a family it was not a problem - I would strongly recommend you check if you have a connected room and ask to be changed as you WILL hear them next door very clearly - great facilities including kettle and fridge (again -great if you have baby)- v clean and modern - as far as noise goes - Barcelona is noisy and i have been many times - take earplugs or expect to hear the road and hallways outside - the location is perfect for exploring all parts of the city and very near good transprt links - breakfast was best I have had in European hotels and they don't mind if you are running late - cava and coffee still flows at 10.30 - fantastic staff and when you have a baby in tow - this is invaluable - if you can get a good deal on the internet (we paid 89 euros per night including breakfast) then this is very good value for money -I would recommend this place as long as you ask for and get the room you want oh- the welcome glass of cava after a delayed flight was much appreciated!! eating tips - Sagardi on calle Argenteria for basque tapas in El Born area (in fact this whole area is great for eating/drinking) travelling with baby tips - no changing facilities ANYWHERE! except Parc Guell and Picasso museum -be warned.

Reviews.Title: “A frustrating experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I so much wanted to like this hotel but it really let itself down in a big way. First of all the plusses. Fantastic location, right in the centre of town, close to everything. Superb breakfast, both in the room or in the restaurant. Superb staff, did an excellent job of being very welcoming and accommodated several requests (I speak Spanish so I don't know if that helped). Rooms, wonderfully well-appointed. However, and this is a really big one, the main point of staying in a hotel is being able to sleep and this is one thing that was impossible in this hotel. I was on vacation and in no hurry to get up early every day. Yet, I was woken up every morning at 8:30 by the cleaners in the hallway, screaming, shouting and going about their business. I figured it was a one off, but sadly it happened on my second morning after having returned to the hotel at 6am. It was too bad as I really wanted to like the hotel but sadly, on this occasion, I was let down.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed 3 nights at this hotel just recently. I can highly recommend it to anyone wanting to experience the brilliant city of Barcelona. It is a two minute walk to La Ramblas and only a little further to some of the main attractions (such as Gaudi buildings). The staff were excellent, the breakfast was good and the room was perfect. If we go back to Barcelona, we won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic find this hotel was. We have just completed our Christmas shopping in the city and this hotel is in a perfect location for this. It is 500 meters from the top of La Rambla and close to everything you need. The hotel is clean, modern, freindly staff, affordable (check the tourist info website for the best prices) and ideally located. Quality

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Patchoo
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to the H10 Universitat Hotel as a surprise for his 30th birthday and we both loved it. I didn't mention the fact that it was his birthday to the hotel and yet we arrived back to our room one afternoon to find a happy birthday note and some chocolates! This coupled with the welcome cava made our stay a little more memorable. The rooms are a little small but the main point is that they are clean, comfortable and safe. Also, despite some previous concerns about the area around the hotel being unsafe, we found it totally fine and didn't witness any mugging/pickpocketing at all in Barcelona. Book this hotel for a hassle free stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location -- clean but slightly small room”
Reviews.Author: Heldigmann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H10 Universitat for three nights. We had asked for a quiet room when we booked online. The hotel staff noted this when we checked in (without our prompting) and gave us a room on the highest floor away from the main street. It was nice of them to accommodate us. Unfortunately we got a room that was rather small for two. Looking at the floor plan, which is near the elevator, we gathered that there are two or three room sizes for double occupancy, and ours was in the smallest class. We asked to change room after this discovery, but it was too late by that time because other guests have checked in. If you decide to stay at this hotel, and you find that your room is a little small, you might want to check the floor plan to confirm this. Remember rooms for the same occupancy (and probably same price) are not all equal in size. We also found that our door does not block out hallway noises very well. Luckily the guests on our floor were not noisy, but we could hear them coming and going. On the plus side, the room was well maintained, with clean, modern styling. The bed was firm and comfortable, although the sheets were a little rough on the skin. We liked the little conveniences provided with the room, like the electronic safety box and the powerful hair dryer. The bathroom, which runs the length of the room, was spacious in sharp contrast to the rest of the room. After a while, we joked that we should remove the bathroom door to reduce the claustrophobic feeling. The location of the hotel is terrific. It is about half a block from the Plaça Catalunya, and lies at the southern border of the Eixample. The Barri Gotic and Raval neighborhoods are all easy walking distance away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Finlay_Jake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 21/11 to 24/11 and booked it for a very reasonable rate from lastminute. The location is the BEST thing about this place as it is only a 2 minute walk to Plac Catalunya and the Ramblas. The staff are vey friendly and although the room was very clean it was a little small. Would have preferred a bath but the shower was excellent. All in all a great place and would definitely recommend it to a first-timer in Barcelona. **tip for a lovely meal in a friendly environment is the Citrus restaurant on Passeig de Gracia (across from Casa Baltto)**

Reviews.Title: “Universitat was great!!”
Reviews.Author: ronniem
Reviews.Content: Great!!! Met all (or most) expectations. Generally couldn't be faulted. A slight niggle was that if you breakfast late (at the weekend) the hot food was not filled up. Cava for breakfast made up! A tip from a previous writer was great - get the barcelona bus at the last stop before the square - turn right from the hotel; turn left at the lights - bus stop 50m on opposite side - good top floor seats - but cold at this time of the year!

Reviews.Title: “Centre of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: imabari
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend for 4 nights and had a very good stay. We booked directly on the H10 website after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. We requested a large room and got a decent size room at the back of the hotel wich was very quiet. Whilst the room was not as big as we had hoped, it was a little bigger than some that we happened to see (but not as big as others). The hotel is very trendy, modern and friendly. The bathroom is huge and probably takes up a third of the room. The location is fantastic being a 1 minute walk from the Plaza de Catalunya and La Rambla! We had the breakfast which we were very happy with. There were lots of hot and cold options which were all very tasty! Also available were some English language newspapers and free internet at the 2 terminals in the lobby. All in all we had a great stay right in the centre of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find. Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Barcelona, and very pleased with our choice of Hotel. It was recommended by a Spanish colleague, who stays there all the time. Excellent location for a first timer to the city, as its central for all the main attractions, and easy to find. Welcomed with a glass of Cava and nibbles (nice touch) Staff very friendly, and couldnt fault them. Room was average size (twin room)and very clean. Room faced main street. Street noisy, but as you would expect in the middle of a city. great modern bathroom, with great power shower. Lots on offer offer at breakfast time.. hot and cold options. Some great eateries to the north of the hotel (away from La Rambla) and less touristy. Overall a very enjoyable stay and would go back there without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't find a single fault with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've recently got back from staying at the H10 universitat and had to write this review to let people know how fabulous it is! We somehow managed to land a top floor suite with a terraced balcony (complete with sunbed, table and chairs), a separate living room and bedroom (both with their own tv's - plasma in the bedroom!), and a fabulous bathroom with a cozy jacuzzi bath! I'm pretty sure that we just got lucky, as I noticed other rooms as I walked past with their doors open that didn't seem to be as spacious. However, they are all decorated to a brilliant standard, and even if we didn't get the room that we did, I'm sure we would have been equally as pleased with this hotel! The location is also good - we could see the placa de catalunya from our room and were therefore not very far at all from la rambla, but just far enough away to avoid the craziness of it all! All in all, it was an extremely enjoyable trip. And to top it all off the hotel staff are especially nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “The W of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: RockNuvell
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. We stayed on the top floor facing the street... marble baths, comfy bed, outdoor patio, and it was stylin and new. Little bar downstairs to grab a drink before going out for dinner. Oh! only drawback is that we left 1:40 pm, way past the check out time, and they will make you pay for an extra day, regardless whether you are actually staying or speak fluent Spanish from Spain. Overall, this place should suit all walks of life... you can pay more for a five star hotel, but this is pretty top notch for Spain.

Reviews.Title: “H10 never let you down”
Reviews.Author: nmaria
Reviews.Content: The Universitat has a great location as mentioned previously by so many. The rooms are clean and spacious. Everything you would expect of a 4* hotel. Breakfast is full of variety and the staff are dilligent - ensuring you do not wait too long for service or a table. The reception staff are excellent and friendly throughout the day. I enjoyed my stay earlier this year and have chosen to return again this autumn.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Audri
Reviews.Content: My two female friends and I have just returned from a 3 day stay in Barcelona and we were all very pleased with our choice of hotel - especially me and I am VERY fussy about accommodation. First of all I must say something about the hotel's location. It is perfectly placed for sight seeing, shopping and dining. It is only a couple of blocks from Plaza Catalunya from where you can travel by metro, train or bus to almost anywhere in the city. This is also where all the bus tours (costing 17 Euros for 1 day or 21 for 2 days) begin and end plus you are close to the Passeig de Gracia (wonderful examples of Gaudi's architecture and great shops) and La Rambla - not a favourite of mine. You are in strolling distance of Port Vell and just around the corner from the Barri Gotic AND the airport bus - costing 3 Euros - stop a few metres away. You can also get an air conditioned train, directly to the airport from Plaza Catalunya at a cost of only 2 Euros. How brilliant is that! In terms of the hotel itself - after reading, on this site, about the traffic noise and the pokiness of the rooms on the lower floors, I emailed the hotel, requesting rooms on the 7th floor. They were very pleasant in their response but said they could not guarantee where rooms would be situated but would do their best to grant my request when we arrived. So I was really pleased when we checked in to discover that our rooms were on the 7th floor. The cold glass of cava, offered to all guests on check-in, free of charge, added to my delight. I had a single room and my two friends shared a twin. Both rooms were lovely. The twin was spacious enough for two women with far too much stuff for only a 2 night stay and my room had a double bed and a huge bathroom with a superb shower and (all the women I know appreciate this) a well lit, adjustable make-up mirror. Though we had no view to speak of the rooms were light, extremely clean, very quiet and well appointed with safes, independent air con and heating system, toiletries - including toothbrushes, and plenty of wardrobe space and hangers. The mini bar was well stocked and reasonably priced and I loved the plasma screen TV in my room. The staff were friendly, polite and very attentive. The buffet breakfast which was included in the price (150 Euros/£100 per night for the twin room and 120 Euros/£80 for single) was excellent, offering everything from a wide selection of fresh fruit, fresh fruit juices, cereals, hot and cold food, cheeses, cakes, a choice of teas, coffees and best of all - Cava. My only complaint is about the water temperature which was very unstable. Second after achieving the perfect temp the water would go cold so showering was a bit frustrating. Also the flooring was a little dodgy. They have used a laminate and it is beginning to move and lift a little. That apart I really liked this hotel and would definitely stay there again which I hope woun't be too far in the future. A TIP - the queues for the tour buses in Plaza Catalunya were very long. Save yourself the boredom of a tedious wait by getting on the bus in the street just across from the hotel. Come out of the hotel, cross the street, go right then first left. The bus stop is at the end of this road on the other side. This is the pen-ultimate stop before the tour ends and the bus is almost empty so no waiting and plenty of room on the top. I wish someone had told us about it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: MartinaZT
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a five-night stay at the h10 universitat. Our experience was mainly very positive. Prior to our stay (having read the reviews on tripadvisor) we had requested a larger room above the 4th floor. When we got there we were indeed allocated a large room on the 7th floor. We were not offered any cava on arrival but the room was ready when we got there at 12 noon so that was more important. The room was at the front of the hotel, clean and spacious with two large single beds (which we pushed together) and a wonderful bathroom with the most amazing shower and plenty of storage space next to the sink for toiletries. The air-conditioning is extremely efficient (it was 28 degrees outside) and so quiet that we weren't sure it was working when we first got to the room. The hotel is located a couple of minutes away from plaza catalunya, less than five minutes from Las Rambla or the much better Rambla Catalunya (go here for the best meals and evening drinks rather than Las Rambla which is overpriced and poor quality). We walked nearly everywhere during our stay and only took the metro/buses when we got too weary or to go to Parc Guell and Tibidabo which is well worth it for the view. We can't comment on the breakfast as we didn't try it, however, 14 Euros per person seems way over the top and we had breakfast at various places in the neighbourhood, from hot baguettes and coffee for under 10 euros total to pastries and coffee for under 5 euros total. We did have a couple of problems at the hotel: 1. When we got there the minibar was not stocked up. 2. There are coffee/tea making facilies in the room but our housekeeper never stocked up the tea and coffee and we had to ask at reception every day. 3. To open the doors for the small balcony you had to obtain a key from reception of which there was only one for the whole hotel - a bit odd for a four star and very inconvenient. 4. There were only half a dozen hangers in the wardrobe. On reflection, it seems to be the housekeepers who let the hotel down which is a shame. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and more than happy to sort out any problems. On balance the problems we experienced were minor compared to the positive aspects and the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff, but beware currency rip off!”
Reviews.Author: JohnofStamford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August with another couple. The location is excellent, just a few minutes walking from Las Ramblas and Place de Catalunya. Our double rooms were the smallest we have ever stayed in, with barely enough room to walk around the bed. Still, not a big problem as we weren't in them enough for it to worry us. Main thing was that they were spotlessly clean and reasonably well equipped including plasma tv and room safe. In contrast the bathroom was large with a very powerful shower. Breakfast was excellent with a large choice of high quality hot and cold fayre. It really set us up well for the day. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. I would have given this hotel 4 'dots' had it not been for the fiasco over billing which I only discovered when we got back to the UK. I paid with a Nationwide Visa card which I use because Nationwide do not make any charges for currency conversion. We had been quoted a price of 85 euros a day beforehand and all of the booking details were quoted in euros. When I got home I realised that instead of euros I had been charged in £ sterling. What's more , the credit card voucher which I had signed said " I accept that I have been offered a choice of currencies for payment, I accept the conversion rate and final amount". NO SUCH CHOICE WAS OFFERED. Despite 6 weeks of copious correspondence and complaint to the hotel manager they insisted that they were in the right. I reckon the currency 'con' cost me around 15 euros - not a huge amount but I object to being ripped off by anyone by any amount. But here's the real incredible bit. The hotel manager, whilst maintaining they had done nothing wrong, said he would collect the 15 euros from his staff if I sent him my address!! I reminded him that the company policy was the problem and not the staff and told him not to bother. This is a growing practice so beware. Rather than charging the bill in euros, the foreign firms are converting it to sterling on the spot, making a hefty profit on the exchange rate. There is currently nothing that UK credit card companies can do about it although I think they're on the case according to other websites. Out of principle I won't be returning to the H10 group which is a pity for them as we take up to 6 european breaks each year. Don't say you weren't warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: donalDublin
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. This hotel is located very near Plaza Catalunya (about 2 mins) but far enough to escape the noise. The rooms are are well specced out with plasma screen TVs with programmes in many languages. The only minor quibble is that the room is a little on the small side. However the bathroom is excellent. The shower is fabulous. As other reviewers have noted the room has a safe. I cannot comment on the restaurant as breakfast at 14 euro is a little stiff. Potential customers are advised to try several booking sites to obtain the best price. For a 3 night stay (single room) there was a difference of 100 euro between two sites. By telephone the hotel quoted a price which matched the dearer web price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: marshreed
Reviews.Content: The H10 Universitat is not the most luxurious hotel but it is clean and provides excellent service. The key to this hotel, however, is "location, location, location". Universitat is smack-dab in the middle of the action. Still, it is about 1/2 block off the northern end of Las Ramblas - just far enough to escape the noise of one of Europe's busiest streets. If you walk just north, you are on Passeig De Gracia, Barcelona's equivalent of New York's 5th Avenue. Hotel breakfast is pricey but it's the only game in town as you can only find Jamon and Queso (ham and cheese) anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay--plusses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: sarahito
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a nice big room on the 4th floor in the back of the hotel. It was pretty quiet, although at times we could hear others talking loudly. Plusses: big room (according to European standards), nice shower and vanity, lots of TV channels. BIG plus: VERY close to all the action in Plaza de Catalunya and la Rambla. Maids did a good job. Minuses: beds were the hardest I've ever slept on! They also moved around easily---when I propped myself up to watch TV the whole bed would move 6 inches. Blankets were not cozy. Pillows were flat, but there are fluffy ones in the closet. Our deadbolt didn't lock (the plate on the door frame wasn't attached properly).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in centre Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, the staff are really helpful though their English is a bit unexpected sometimes. they give us the information we need at their greatest help. The room is a bit small, just two steps from the door to the bed. However, it is bright, clean, and comfortable. The bathroom is big, especially the strong shower. A nice and relaxing shower is guaranteed! The plasma TV with many different channels in various languages is very good. No need to worry about safety as the area around is safe, just a 3-min walk from Metro Plaza Catalunya. The safety locker provided in the room is a good place to put your valuables. Las Ramblas, which needs a 5-min walk, and El Corte Ingles (a huge department store with all kinds of goods) are bonus for the hotel. No problem to walk back to hotel from Las Ramblas even at midnight. One more thing, really undefeatable, is its buffet breakfast. It's too difficult to use words to describe --- starters, salad, various kinds of cereals, cakes, bread, fruits, yogurt.......and more. The quantity is so great that you can have lunch until 3 p.m. Overall, it's worth to spend and stay in the H10 Universitat with the quality and service provided!!!

Reviews.Title: “As previus told, great value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H10 Universitat between 8th and 16th of august based on reviews at this site. It was a nice hotel with somewhat small rooms but compared to other european hotels they were of normal size. The rooms were modern and nicely decorated. We got a room at first facing the street but the streetnoice and subway disturbed our sleep at night so we changed to a room at the 7th floor facing the backyard. It was so much better and quiet but a bit smaller and due to the windows the toilet and shower was a bit tiny. If you go there you should absolutly try to get a room facing the street at the upper floors! Better space and better bathroom with tub instead. Two nights we got disturbed by people talking in the corridor but we called the reception and they got up at once and told them to be quiet. Sound from the corridor easily gets through the doors but it was only the nights between friday and sunday we herd anything. Breakfast buffet was included in the 85€ we payed per night and it was excellent, even better than at the 5 star luxury hotel we stayed at in Madrid last year. The staff was helpful, some were more helpful and more nice than others as it always is. I beleve that you not can expect same service in Spain as in my home country Sweden, you totally feel a difference in shops and restaurants... The staff could recommend restaurants but since they handn't tried them i think you better find other sources to get recommendations. We ate at a restaurant at Rambla first night but it was overpriced and terrible so I recommend you go somewhere else to eat, except for one restaurant; Attic close to Placa Catalunya, it was great. Attic belongs to a chain of restaurants in Barcelona so you can get similar food at different restaurants. I could stay at the hotel again but 7 days in Barcelona is enough for me for some years. Maybe in the future...

Reviews.Title: “Prefect city Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redhotrobert1979
Reviews.Content: City breaks are all about location, and look no further than this cracking hotel. Located in the heart of the city - easy 50metre walk to Placa da Catalunya Metro station (direct trains to airport) and easy 2 mins walk from La Ramblas, main shops, and loads of restuarants and bars including Hard Rock Cafe (if thats your thing!). We just found the htel the ideal base to get around the city. Inside staff are warm and friendly, the atmosphere is relaxed, but being a new hotel all the rooms are well finished to a high standard e.g. flat screen TVs, huge showers and 1st class bathrooms. Breakfast was excellent (included in price) The only thing that stops this hotel getting 5 stars is the room size, which I felt was a little on the small size, but being a 6ft 4 chap - you may not have the same problems! All in all, the hotel made Barcelona a delight to visit

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money. The rooms are very clean, lovely bathroom and great service. Our rate included breakfast which was good value with lots of choice. Really good location, a minutes walk to Placa de Catalunya and La Ramblas. Only downside was no key to our balcony door, if you want to sit on balcony you have to phone reception who will send someone from housekeeping to open doors - you then have to go through procedure again to have then closed if you leave your room. Having said this, staff were very friendly, approachable and willing to help so it wasn't too much of a problem. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would have no hesitation returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, almost great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kentuckeye
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the H10 Universitat, and all in all, we found this to be a very nice hotel that was a great value. This hotel gets high marks for striking modern design, cleanliness, friendliness of staff, great breakfast, and perfect location (a block from the metro and 2 from the Ramblas). However, there were a few things that knocked it down in my book. First, as the hotel was filled to capacity, the staff seemed to have some issues with handling efficiency. The maid continually "forgot" to put things in one of our rooms (one day it was soap, the next enough bath towels, the next clean glasses). Each time I asked for and was presented the items with a smile, but each time it was clear she had simply run out of these things and had to get them from another floor. Although very cozy for one person, my room was indeed very small, although my parents' room was a nice size. As stated by others, the airconditioning was rather weak for what was a blistering heat wave. The room ACs are very weak, and this is one of those hotels in Barcelona where you have to put your room key in a slot in the room for the electricity to work. It didn't take so long for the room to cool off, but the AC must go off when you leave and take your key, so your room may be quite hot when you get back. Also, we asked to be placed on a non-smoking floor, and were given smoking rooms on a smoking floor (ash trays in both the rooms and in the halls). I'm not sure if there even was a non-smoking floor (we were told at check-in that there was), but the rooms didn't smell at all of smoke and we had no complaints or reason to ask to move. Still, the location was great, the hotel was impeccably clean, everyone was friendly, and the free internet computers a plus. My room, although tiny, was cozy and high tech, with piped in music (not working though!) and a flat screen TV. The included breakfast was fantastic. The hotel was a great value, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone. Although I had a few complaints, I have to realize 3 things: 1. This is Europe. If I wanted blasting AC and big rooms, I could have chosen an American hotel in Barcelona. But what's the point in going another country if you don't immerse yourself in all aspects of its culture? 2. This was a very busy month, and I think the staff just wasn't quite ready to handle the turnover. This is a brand new hotel and pretty new chain, but H10 as a company seems very efficient and dedicated to service, and I'm assuming they have a few bumps to work out. As an aside, we rolled in with 7 big bags, which the bell man carried up to our room by hand. When I asked the front desk if they had a bell cart, she told me it was on order and would be in in 2 weeks. So, like I said, seems like they're still working out a few kinks. 3. The week before, we had stayed at the Hotel Amabassador, just about 4 blocks to the south. The H10 was 100 Euros less per night, and about 2 full stars better. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind a few of the little quirks in exchange for saving A LOT of money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, very happy and no hesitation in recommending!!”
Reviews.Author: Woods,irl
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay in this hotel and this incredable city. Where do i start??, Location is fab only 3-4 min walk to the nearest pickup point for the "aerobus", the only way to travel to and from the airport, 3.60 per person eachway. Only a short stroll from nearest metro, bus stop outside front door, La rambla a stones throw away. After reading other reviews we requested a room to the front which we got (402), room wasn't huge, but was big enough for a 4 night stay, aircon was fine, bathroom fantastic. We also got the cold glass of cava which was much appreciated. The staff were very friendly and helpfull, i asked for a recommendation for a top class restaurant for 1 night of our stay and this was duly obliged, "La Dama", on Av. Diagonal, truely a treat!!. We booked with breakfast included and couldn't find fault here either, every morning until 10.30am a fresh and very extensive array of varying types of fare in buffet format, definately sets one up for a days site seeing or shopping. For site seeing would recommend "bus turiste", the red and blue lines should satisfy everyones preferences. Don't leave without visiting the magic fountain display at espanya, we went at 9.30pm and really enjoyed it. All in all will have to put this trip down as a truely memorable one, and if we get the chance to go back will stay in the H10.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 5 night stay. Having read the Hotel reports on this site, we were a little sceptical. So having taken in all the remarks we asked for a room at the front of the hotel (these are definately the largest) our room 412 was nothing short of excellent and so well soundproofed from the 24 hour traffic of Barcelona. We too used the touristic bus, but found the 'blue' route very busy. I think that a one day ticket for a general view of the City plus subsequent travel on the Metro would be best suited for most. The Staff were excellent and arranged a beautiful bouquet of flowers for our anniversary. I should be glad to answer any E Mails fot further info.

Reviews.Title: “H 10 Gets 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one full week . Very pleased with all aspects of our stay at this great hotel. Rooms( we had a second room for our adolescent children ) were spotless and well equiped . Breakfast was great and went on till 10.30 hrs. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Barcelona was also an excellent city for a summer break,keeping all four of us as busy as we wanted to be.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: photoguy47
Reviews.Content: Largely based on tripadvisor reviews, my wife and I booked nights at the Universitat for pre and post cruise stays in Barcelona. Until arriving at the hotel, I did not realize that my travel agent had made the reservation for 1 person. Since we had not added the breakfast option, I didn't think this would be an issue, but the staff acted like I was trying to pull a fast one. Our pre cruise stay in the hotel was ok, other than climbing over our luggage in the small but nice room and being uncomfortable due to barely functioning air conditioning. Since the number of people had been an issue, I contacted my travel agent to change the post cruise reservation for 2 people to avoid issues on the next stay and hoping to get a larger room. Upon arrival at the hotel for our post cruise night, we were told that a water leak had flooded the 7th floor and we would be moved to another H10 Hotel. I was assured that the other property was equivalent to the Universitat including in room broadband internet access. Since another guest was checking in while we were talking to the manager and he seemed very tense and stressed about the situation, I had to question what was really going on. We were walked to the H10 Hotel Gravina several blocks away. It was ok, but the rooms were not as nice as the Universitat, no in room broadband access and the air conditioning was even worse than the Universitat. While reading reviews for the Gravina, I noticed that on two recent occasions they had experienced "flooding" also. What only seemed odd before, now appears to be a standard method for handling over booked situations at H10. I raised these issues with H10, but have not received any response. The Gravina staff were barely civil in responding to my complaints during checkout. All in all, not a horrible experience, but far less that I expected from a hotel with this rating and one of the low points on an otherwise fantastic vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Universitat for 3 nights in June. The best thing about this hotel is it's location. Right on the Catalunya square, yet quiet enough to get some sleep. Reception staff were very welcoming, and although our room wasn't ready on arrival, we only had to wait about 15 minutes and were handed some very cold champagne whilst we waited. The room was modern but very, very small. Barely enough room to walk round the bed, very little wardrobe space (fine if you're only staying a few nights though), but was spotless. The bathroom is quite large and also very clean. Huge shower which was a real bonus. Other than the size of the room, there really was nothing to complain about at this H10 hotel. The location and cleanliness are definately the plus points. We didn't pay for breakfast, but there were plenty of take aways/eateries immediately outside the hotel to grab something quick and cheap enough. Would definately stay in this hotel again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grovemontjanet
Reviews.Content: Great in every way...location, comfort, safety, cleanliness, helpful staff. Small rooms with every needed amenity. Affordable.
